loans.name: Ngoun's Group

texts.en:
Ngoun, 63, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district. She has four kids. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 28 years, and the current business earns her family about 66,000KHR per day. 

There are three members in Ngoun’s group, and she is has been with VisionFund for six cycles already. Ngoun, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend for labor. 

She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Sok is 61 years old and mother of seven children. 

To support her living, she works for others for a fee and grows rice to earn more income. She can earn income of about 40,000 HKR per day. 

For Sok, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of three members, she is a group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter for her family. She hopes that she can have clean water to use for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter for family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and herbicides for pineapple  and vegetable plantation

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia amoroso, es separado por lo cual se encarga de la educación de sus hijos, trabaja brindando servicios de transporte fluvial - turístico en su ciudad natal, Calleria. Diariamente Pablo sale muy temprano de casa para poder trabajar todo el día y así pueda mejorar sus ingresos y brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Es una persona soñadora, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es muy alegre y amable con los clientes, él cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque se esfuerza mucho además porque cree que con una sonrisa todo se ve diferente.
Pablo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá mejorar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes y comprar nuevas puertas y ventanas. Con esto la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Más adelante espera cambiar el motor de su bote por uno de aluminio para así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pablo is a loving father of a family. He is separated so he is responsible for the education of his children. He works offering tourists river transportation services in his native city, Calleria. Every day Pablo leaves his house very early to work all day in order to increase his revenues and provide quality education for his children.

He is a dreamer and has a lot of desire to get ahead. He is very happy and friendly with his customers. He feels that he is doing very well in his work thanks to the amount of effort he puts in but also with a smile that makes everything seem better.

Pablo is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can make improvements to his house like plastering the walls and buying new doors and windows. This will improve the family's quality of living. In the future he hopes to replace the motor in his boat with an aluminum motor and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is 38 years old and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 15 years, the current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Sina is the existing client of VisionFund who has received the loans for two cycles. The past loans have helped her relieve her family's financial burden to a great extent. 

She is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna hails from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 37 years old, married with a fifteen-year-old son. For the last ten years, she has been raising hogs and operating a Sari-sari store for an income. This is her way of helping her husband who works as a painter. 

Myrna wishes to improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy stock for her store such as candies, canned goods, chips, powdered fruit juice flavoring, shampoo, detergent and feed for her swine. 

Myrna dreams of seeing her business become a success.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as candies, canned goods, chips, powdered fruit juice flavoring, shampoo, detergent and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
48-year-old Nilda is a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married and has six children. The youngest child is 16 years old. Nlida engages in fish vending as a business. She sells fresh fish to the nearby community. In addition to that, Nilda  raises and sells hogs. These are her sources of income.

Despite this income, she is in need of additional capital to improve her livelihood and prosper. Nilda is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy various fresh fish to sell and feed for the pigs. This will help Nilda  augment her income and thus provide her family with a nutritious diet and good living conditions.

Nilda hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy various fresh fish to sell and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a 43-year-old single man and a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. He engages in farming. Gregorio grows and sells rice to earn for a living. Aside from farming, Gregorio raises hogs.  He has been farming rice for more than 10 years now. 

Due to the higher demands on farming expenses, Gregorio is asking for a loan to buy more rice seedlings, fertilizer and pig feed. This will help Gregorio improve his farming and hog raising livelihood, to get higher earnings. 

In the future, Gregorio hopes that he can expand his both business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pig feed

loans.name: Hieng's Group

texts.en:
Hieng, 34, is a mother of two children living in Kampong Speu province. 

She struggles to provide for her family via rice cropping. Moreover, she is a tailor and it earns her about 12,300 KHR per day. 

For Hieng, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. 

She hopes that she can make her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokha is 30 years old and married with one kid. 

For more than 11 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of their family’s income to make a living, and they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 30,000 each day for their future needs. 

Sokha has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is going to use her portion to buy piglets and pig feed for nourishing them. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed for nourishing them

loans.name: Jhom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Speu province, Jhom is 57 years old and a mother of four children. For her living, she can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping. She can earn income about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can have clean water for drinking.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Modhela* Group

texts.en:
This group is called Modhela*. It consists of six women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Aisha is a hardworking woman. She is a 30-year-old married woman living with her family in a humble house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is the leader of the group. Aisha studied till the secondary education but she couldn't complete her studies. Now she works in dressmaking with some small materials and sewing machines. Most of the money she earns from her business goes to cover some of the family expenses. 

On other side, she wants to increase her business more but she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase sewing materials to enlarge her business to more able to meet all the demands of her customers.  
Aisha looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a small dressmaking store outside the house, and buying many sewing machines and equipment to work in a better way.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials to enlarge her business more

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 27 years, Horn is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children. She earns a living through farming rice and raise pigs. 

This is the fourth loan for Horn with VisionFund. She has used the loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, laminated sheeting etc to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Iris Rosibel

texts.es:
Iris de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica. Es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante, es madre de un hijo de 7 meses de nacido; su compañero de vida trabaja como camionero y juntos trabajan para el sustento familiar. 

Iris posee un negocio de venta de antojitos ubicado en su casa y todas las tardes trabaja desde hace  más de tres años, esto lo aprendió  de su mamá que también se dedica a este negocio y de ahí aprendió y menciona que le va bien.  


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la remodelación de la concina de su casa, ya que el techo se le ha dañado y por lo cual se siente insegura a la hora de estar cocinando sus alimentos y preparando la venta, de esta forma con el crédito podrá subsanar el problema y presentar mejores condiciones de salubridad. Comprará específicamente lámina, madera, clavos y teja.  


A futuro la señora y su esposo lo que más desean es que su hijo tenga las mejores condiciones de vida y también los hijos que están por venir ir mejorando de a poco su vivienda, además que el negocio se mantenga firme como hasta ahorita y que crezca
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Iris had a basic education up to sixth grade. She is an enterprising woman who has always fought to better herself. She is a mother of a seven month old son. Her partner is a truck driver and together they work to sustain the family. 

Iris owns a business in which she sells traditional corn-based snacks from her house. For more than three years she has spent every afternoon working in this business, which she learned from her mother, who also works in this kind of business. It was there that she learned her trade and she would like to mention that it is going well.  


The loan she is requesting is for the refurbishment of the kitchen in her house. The roof has been damaged and this makes her feel insecure when cooking her snacks and preparing them for sale. With this loan she will be able to correct the problem and present better health standards. The specific items which she will buy are metal sheeting, wood, nails and tiling.  


The thing that she and her husband most want from the future is that their son has the best living conditions and that the children to come go on gradually improving their home; and also that the business will remain as strong as it has been up until now and will grow.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and tiles to refurbish the kitchen in her house, because  the roof is damaged.

loans.name: Usikilivu Group

texts.fr: Maombi est une femme ambitieuse, présidente du collectif de crédits «Usikilivu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 5 enfants, dont 4 vont à l’école et 1 est marié. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle est vendeuse grossiste des légumineuses dans un marché  de la ville. Elle va acheter des amarantes, sombes, choux, tomates, etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Maombi is an ambitious woman, president of the loan group  called «Usikilivu», a client of MFI Hekima, married, aged 40 and mother of five children, of whom four attend school and one is married. She began her business with funds she received from her parents. Her spouse is jobless. 

Maombi sells vegetables wholesale in a marketplace in the town. She is going to buy 'amarantes', 'sombes', cabbage and tomatoes, etc. She hopes to get more loans so as to grow her business, keep her children in school, and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not able to access loans from banks.

loans.use: to buy 'amarantes', 'sombes', cabbage and tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 28 años  de edad casada residente de Suchitepéquez, se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la venta de  zapatos.  Ella tiene 2 hijos y son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La  actividad que ella realiza es la venta  de zapatos, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de cinco años, ella tubo esa iniciativa porque  en la comunidad  donde ella vive no existen estos negocios y es por ello que ella se decidió a realizarla y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de mercadería de zapatos ya que para ella es de mucha importancia contar con mercadería para  atender a las personas con una surtida y variedad de zapatos y así ella puede tener un ingreso económico par el sostenimiento de su familia.

Una de las aspiraciones de Antonia es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y ampliar más el negocio con que ella cuenta.
texts.en:
28 year-old Antonia is married and lives in Suchitepéquez. She has made a living working in one of the most solemn professions in society; that is, selling shoes. She has two children and they are excellent students in their community.  

She sells shoes for a living, and she has done so for more than five years. She had the idea for this initiative because in the community she lives in, there are no businesses like this, which is why she decided to start one. She has made a good living to support her family.

The aim of the loan is to buy shoes wholesale, since it is very important for her to have merchandise to offer people, with a stock and variety of shoes, and therefore have income to provide for her family.

One of Antonia's aspirations is to see her children grow up and become professionals in their lives and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Gul

texts.ru:
52 летнюю женщину на фотографии зовут Гул. Она с семьей проживает в городе Душанбе в столице Таджикистана. Гул добрая, вежливая и культурная женщина. У нее трое детей. Гул замужем за музыканта. Ее муж певец. Он поет на свадьбах и мероприятиях. Сама Гул раньше работала преподавателем, но решила оставить профессию учителя и выбрала совсем иную деятельность. На сегодняшний день она занимается шитьем. Гул берет заказы на шитье женской одежды. Она влюбилась в свою работу и не жалеет, что оставила карьеру учителя. 
   Как сверху упоминалось ее муж певец. Ему для работы необходимы новые инструменты и Гул решила помочь мужу приобрести новые сам буферы и прочее аппаратуру за счет кредита. Она с мужем надеется, что с улучшением качества звука, заказов на свадьбах будет больше.
texts.en:
The 52-year-old woman in the photograph is named Gul. She and her family live in the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is a kind, polite and cultured woman and has three children. Gul is married to a musician, a singer who performs at weddings and other events. She herself used to work as a teacher but decided to leave her profession and chose a completely different occupation. Currently she works as a seamstress, taking orders for women's clothing. She has fallen in love with her work and is not sad about having left her work as a teacher.

As has been mentioned, Gul's husband is a singer. He needs new equipment for his work and Gul has decided to help him buy new subwoofers and other items by taking out a loan. She and her husband hope that with better sound quality, he will receive more wedding work.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her husband's singing business

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de productos de belleza por catalogo, los cuales vende en los cantones cercanos. Ana se encuentra preocupada ya que la puerta principal del corredor de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorada, por las constantes lluvias que han causado que se corroa el hierro, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro y mano de obra para reparar la puerta principal del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: 43 year-old Ana lives in her own home along with her life partner and 2 children, aged 10 and 13 years. She is a hard-working woman who for the last 3 years has earned a living selling a variety of catalogue beauty products, which she sells in nearby cantons. Ana is worried because the main door to the hall of her home is worn down, due to the constant rainfall which have caused the iron to corrode; this is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in  iron and workforce to repair the main door to the hall of her home.

loans.use: to invest in iron and workforce to repair the main door to the hall of her home.

loans.name: Leydi Siomara

texts.es:
Leydi de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado, esta casada su esposo actualmente se encuentra en estados unidos, se fue hace unos tres años y son padres de tres hijos una ya adolescente y los otros dos mas pequeños, viven en casa propia.

Leydi trabaja de vendedora en un comedor donde venden desayunos y  almuerzos todos los días, ademas venden lácteos como:queso,crema,quesillo etc, negocio es de un familiar, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM a 2:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cancelar una deuda a un pariente y  lo demás lo necesita para comprar unas medicinas que necesita urgentes, de esa forma lograra cubrir la necesidad que existe en este momento.

El sueño de Leydi es que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para su vida y tener las fuerzas para trabajar para darles la alimentació.
texts.en:
29 year-old Leydi studied until 7th grade. She is married and her husband is currently in the United States. He left about three years ago, and they have three children together: one is already a teenager, and the other two still live at home with her.

Leydi works as a salesperson in a canteen selling breakfasts and lunches every day. Furthermore, they sell dairy products such as cheese, cream, cottage cheese etc. It is a family business, and the working day lasts from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.

She is asking for a loan to pay back a debt to a relative, and she will use the rest of the money to buy some medicines she needs urgently. This way, she will be able to provide for her needs at the present time. 

Leydi's dream is for her children to have what they need in life and to have the strength to work in order to feed them.

loans.use: to pay back a relative's debt, and to use the rest of the money to buy medicine she needs urgently.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is 37 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She makes clothes for a living and works in a workshop, which she has been doing for 15 years. She makes a variety of different items of clothing, mainly national women's dresses. Her work is of a good quality, which is why many people come to her. Dilbar has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. 

Dilbar requested a loan from IMON International, which she will use to invest in her small business and buy key supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic, and needles. The loan will enable her to increase working capital and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, elastic, and needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for registration fees, transportation, and study materials.

loans.name: Dúo San Pedranas Group

texts.es: Dúo San Pedranas La encargada de este grupo es la señora Mirian Elizabeth quien se dedica a la confección de camisas para damas y caballeros desde hace 7 años.  Contando con el apoyo incondicional de su padre, hermano y esposo cada día le da muchas gracias a Dios por el negocio que tiene. Vive a un costado del pueblo y su sueño es tener una empresa grande con muchos empleados y ser una gran confeccionista, muy conocida por el buen trabajo de la confección.   Las  fiestas navideñas se acercan y los pedidos están creciendo, contando con cuatro maquinas se ve en la necesidad de comprar una más, valorada en cinco mil quetzales.  No le es suficiente el dinero que tiene ya que es para la compra de tela y producir las camisas que le han pedido y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes.  Por tal motivo tiene necesidad de hacer un préstamo y comprar su máquina que le hace falta.  Su compañera la señora  Elena María se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde 20 años y también venta de refacciones los fines de semana. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos  profesionales y darles la oportunidad de estudio que ella y su esposo  nunca tuvieron.  Le han hecho varios pedidos de güipiles típicos y cortes, pero aun le falta dinero para comprarlos, por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y aprovechar las ventas de las fiestas navideñas que están cerca.
texts.en: Dúo San Pedranas The head of this group is señora Mirian Elizabeth, who has made a living making ladies' and men's shirts for the last 7 years. Along with the unconditional support of her father, brother and husband, she thanks God every day for her business. She lives close to the town and her dream is to have a big company with many employees, and to be a great clothing manufacturer, well-known for her good handiwork. The Christmas holidays are approaching and the orders are piling up; with four machines, she needs to buy one more, valued at five thousand quetzales. The money she already has is not enough to buy the fabric and make the shirts that have been ordered, and she does not want to disappoint her customers. This is why she needs to ask for a loan and buy the machine that is missing. Her partner, señora  Elena María has made a living for the 20 years selling typical clothing and doing repairs at the weekends. Her dream is to see her children become professionals, and to give them the chance to study, which she and her husband were never able to do. She has received various orders for traditional blouses and skirts, although she still needs money to buy them; this is why she needs a loan, so as not to disappoint her customers, and to make the most sales because of the approaching Christmas holidays.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain and fertilise his cocoa plantation.

loans.name: María Pastora

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado. Junto con su compañero de vida venden ropa en el centro de la ciudad y son padres de dos hijos.

María posee su negocio de ropa para damas como: faldas,blusas,sostenes, etc su esposo vende junto a ella ropa para caballeros como:pantalones boxer,calsonetas etc. el negocio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad económica, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM a 2:00 PM.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar mas ropa para todas las edades, como:  faldas, blusas, ropa interior de hombre y mujer, camisas, vestidos, etc. para tener mas variedad y tener mas clientes.

El sueño de María es tener un puesto estable donde vender su ropa y  comprar mas para obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
39 year-old María studied until 9th grade. Together with her life partner, she sells clothes in the city centre, and they are parents to two children.

María owns a clothing business for ladies which sells skirts, blouses, bras, etc. Her husband works alongside her, selling clothes such as trousers, boxer shorts, swimming trunks. She learned about business because of economic necessity, and the working day lasts from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm. 

The loan she is asking for is to buy more clothes for all ages, such as skirts, blouses, men and women's underwear, shirts, dresses, etc to have more variety and have more customers.

María's dream is to have a stable stall from which to sell her clothes and to buy more in order to receive more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for all ages, such as skirts, blouses, men and women's underwear, shirts, dresses, etc to have more variety and have more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy footwear and Topper shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en:
Kon is 36 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support her family, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She earns about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Kon is the leader of her group. She requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthier rice to increase her family’s income and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is the married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high costs of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Yancelly Alejandra

texts.es:
Yancelly se dedica al negocio de cría y levante de cerdos actividad que aprendió y heredo de su padre, es madre de un hijo de 2 años de edad y puede sostener a él, a ella y a su familia gracias a este negocio que aspira a que su hijo lo tome y se encargue de él haciéndolo un negocio de tradición familiar.
Yancelly antes que suceda esto quiere potenciar y mejorar su negocio y destacarse entre la competencia.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una cerda de cría y cerdos de engorde esperando tener buenas ventas pues se avecina la víspera de año nuevo en donde el cerdo se vuelve un plato muy tradicional.
Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresa y no dejar que el negocio familiar desparezca
texts.en:
Yancelly works in the business of breeding and raising pigs, a profession which she learned and inherited from her father. She is a mother of a two-year- old son and can support him, herself and her family thanks to this business. Her aspiration is that her son will take it over from her and make the business a family tradition.

But before this happens Yancelly wants to build up and improve her business and make it stand out from the competition.

She is asking for this loan to buy a sow for breeding and pigs for fattening and is hoping to have good sales because New Year's Eve is approaching, a time when pork becomes a very traditional dish.

Her dream is to continue growing as a company and to not allow the family business to disappear.

loans.use: buy a sow for breeding and pigs for fattening, because New Year's Eve is approaching and the business becomes very profitable at that time.

loans.name: Alma Dinora

texts.es: Alma tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 14 años y una de 2 años de edad. Alma es muy comprometida con sus familia, responsable y muy reconocida en su comunidad como una mujer integra. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Alma solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción  del corredor en su vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y hierro. Para proceder a la construcción del corredor lo antes posible.
texts.en: Alma is 40 years old. She is married and has a 14 year-old and 2 year-old daughter. Alma is very dedicated to her family; she is responsible and well-known in her community as an honest woman. She has been working as a housekeeper for a long time, which allows her to provide for her household. Alma is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in building a hall for her home. For this, she needs to buy materials such as galvanised metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand and iron, in order to proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand and iron to buy a hall for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a toilet, cement, and pvc sewer pipes, and to pay workers to install the toilet system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain his cocoa plantations and fertilise his plants.

loans.name: Symphonie F Group

texts.fr: Kajangwa est commerçante, vice présidente du groupe d’affaires «Symphonie F», âgée de 57 ans, veuve, mère de 9 enfants dont 4 étudient et 5 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 24 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds  reçu de sa fille. Dans l’avenir, elle compte entretenir sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kajangwa is a vendor and the vice-president of the Symphonie F business group. She is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of nine; four of her children study, and five are already married. She has been selling used shoes at the central market of her town  for 24 years and is seeking a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution. She will buy 10 bales of shoes to expand her business. She launched her business with the funds received from her daughter. In the future, she plans to provide for the maintenance of her house and pay for her children’s education. Kajangwa is thanking Hekima for its support of small business owners who lack access to the traditional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of shoes.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Speu province, Phalla is 28 years old and a mother of one child. For her living, she earns income to support her family  via rice-cropping. In addition, she is a tailor and that earns her about USD 5 per day. 

This is Phalla's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living and health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nimol is a married mother of two children. Rice farming is her family's primary source of income. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she can earn about 40,000KHR per day and manage to save about 30,000KHR each day after expenses. 

Nimol has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already. and she wisely used the previous loans to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burden. Now, leading her group to request a new loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. Nimol hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kimlun's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Speu province, Kimlun is 45 years old and a mother of five children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income, earning about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Now leading a group of three, Kimlun is requesting her first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy a water filter. Kimlun hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and have enough clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан 58 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Гулумкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, также у нее есть собственный павильон, где она продает продукты питания, а дочь помогает в предоставлении услуг ксерокопии. У Гулумкан большой опыт в ведении собственного бизнеса. Благодаря упорному труду Гулумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 2 коровы, 6 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 5,13 ГА, где она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. На ежедневной основе она реализует около 10 литров молока, экологически чистое и очень вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулумкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистой дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока, также бычков и овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на покупку жилья для детей.
texts.en: Gulumkan is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five. Gulumkan has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows farmproduce. She has her own small store where she sells groceries, and her daughter works providing photocopying services. Gulumkan has extensive experience as a business owner. Thanks to Gulumkan’s hard work, her farm now includes one horse, two cows and six sheep. She also has 5.13 ha [12.7 acres] of land, where she grows potatoes, grains and sainfoin [a herb used for animal feed]. On a daily basis she sells around 10 l [2.6 gallons] of milk;  environmentally clean and very tasty, it is in great demand. In order to develop her business further, Gulumkan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 140,000 KGS to buy a purebred dairy cow to increase the volume of milk sales as  well as steers and sheep for fattening and resale. Gulumkan plans to invest the resulting revenue in a further increase of livestock. She also would like to save up to buy homes for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow to increase the volume of milk selling as well as steers and sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru:
Сафармох 48 лет. Она с сыном проживает на районе Кубадиен. Сафармох работает уборщицей и параллельно занимается скотоводством. У нее нет мужа, и она одна помогает сыну встать на ноги. Сафармох бесспорно достойна уважения, в наше время не легко женщине одной вырастить ребенка. 
   Сафармох с сыном решили сделать ремонт, и им не хватило не большой суммы денег, чтобы закончить ремонт. Сафармох решилась обратиться за кредитом, потому что она видит только один вариант решения данной проблемы. Поддержите Сафармох купить стройматериалы и закончить ремонт. Она заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en:
Safarmoh is 48 and lives with her son in the Qubadiyon region. She works as a cleaner and at the same time in animal husbandry. She doesn't have a husband and is helping her son get on his feet by herself. She is deserving of respect for this, as it isn't easy these days for a woman to raise a child on her own.

Safarmoh and her son decided to do some renovations to their home, but they don't have enough money to finish them. Therefore she decided to request a loan, as it's the only solution she sees to the problem. Please help Safarmoh buy building materials and finish her renovations. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete her home renovations

loans.name: Yesica Gabriela

texts.es: Yesica tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Yesica es vendedora de ropa de forma ambulante y en su hogar de habitación. De esta forma  junto a sus esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y pines para reparar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en:
Yesica is twenty four years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and their six-month-old son.

Yesica is a street vendor of clothing and also sells it from home. In this way, together with her husband, they maintain the family finances. 

She is applying to FUSAI for this loan with the desire of improving their living conditions. She will invest it in the purchase of galvanised steel panels, wood and pins, to repair the roof of the house, which has deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy galvanised steel panels, wood and pins to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en: Alvaro is married and lives with his family , he currently works on a telecommunications company.  He had to change glasses constantly because they detected him with a vision problem to see from far distance. They suggested him a  surgery to correct his vision problem. Nevertheless due to economic reasons, he has not have the eye surgery yet.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Ines Rebeca

texts.es:
Ines es una madre de familia que con el fruto de su trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, hoy se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, así como zapatos, ropa en su ciudad natal, Ica. Su familia es el motor de su vida, por ellos siempre lucha para poder sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles todas las comodidades que se merecen.- Cada mañana Ines se despierta muy motivada a salir adelante, es una mujer muy optimista, alegre y amable con sus clientes.
Ines está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería como más productos de belleza y ropa, así podrá implementar su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos. Más adelante espera ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales porque es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Ines is the mother of a family who by the fruits of her labor has raised her children. Presently she works selling beauty products and also shoes and clothing in her native city, Ica. Her family is the driving force in her life and she has always fought for them to get ahead and provide them with all the comforts that they deserve.

Every morning Ines gets up very motivated to get ahead. She is a very optimistic woman, happy and friendly with her customers. Ines is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva because with the support they offer her she can buy merchandise like more beauty products and clothing. These can help her business and allow her to offer a variety of products. In the future she hopes to see her children become great professionals as this is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Exitosos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Inversionistas Exitosos” es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa. 
La socia Amanda tiene 46 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como docente en una de las universidades de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Los Inversionistas Exitosos" [Successful Investors] communal bank belongs to the Arariwa Association.

One of its members, Amanda, is 46 years old, married and with 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her job as a teacher in one of the universities in the city of Cusco. She has had this occupation for quite some time and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working to be able to support her family.

Amanda requested this credit to pay for her children's studies.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to repay it on time. 

The bank member that appears on the attached photo had to be late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf is 22 years old and eager to study economics at the Kurgantube State University. He is clever boy and graduated from secondary school with excellent grades. His favorite subjects are math, computer studies, and English. He was one of the best pupils in his school and took part successfully in all competitions. He has a lot of friends, many of who are his classmates. All his friends love and support him. Rauf lives with parents, who are employed but make a small income which is not enough to pay his tuition. He is seeking a $600 loan to pay his tuition at the university. This will allow him to study and achieve his dreams. He is a smart and capable young man who appreciates the assistance of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 36-year-old, married woman from Marneuli district. She lives with her husband and four children. Ruta's husband works at a car wash service and generates approximately GEL 400. 

Ruta didn't have any source of income for herself until she decided to open her own canteen at the local market. She purchased all the needed merchandise and devices with saved money and started her business. 

Now, Ruta needs financial support to purchase supplies and have money for working capital, to continue doing her lovely job. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo - a startup program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. So, Ruta will expand the variety of dishes and will attract more clients. 

The loan will be a great help to this hard-working woman, enabling her to satisfy her children's needs and make them a better style of life. 

She awaits your support for maintaining her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her canteen.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en: Ma. Dolores is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Ma. Dolores has borrowed and repaid eight prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for 21 years. She supplements her income by farming sugarcane. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thav's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thav is now 26 years old and a married mother of one. Thav and her husband have been rice farmers for 10 years, able to earn 30,000KHR daily and  save about 20,000KHR each day. 

Now leading a group of two, Thav is requesting her third loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. Thay hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice healthily to make more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
Saidniso is 23 years old and lives in her parents' house with her family. She makes clothes for a living and she works from home. She makes a variety of different articles of clothing and sells them at very affordable prices. Her work is of good quality, which is why many people come to her. She has worked in this field for five years and has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. 

Saidniso needs financial support now, because her mother is ill. She must buy medicines for treatment of her mother. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her mother. She awaits your mercy and your help.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her mother

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a rice farmer from the municipality of Mcarthur, Leyte. Aside from farming with her husband, she is also into cooking snacks and meals to sell in her neighborhood. She usually cooks sauteed vegetables, noodles and fish as well as rice cake and steamed rice cake.Her business has been in existence for 26 years now. This is her way of providing for her seven children ages 8-26, specially when they were little.  

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business. She will use it to buy fertilizer, pesticides, vegetables, seasonings, rice, sugar, fish and meat. She hopes that her business will continue to flourish and allow her to live an abundant life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, vegetables, seasonings, rice, sugar, fish and meat

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns income from fishing and farming rice.

Imelda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mariakan

texts.ru: Мариякан 37 лет, замужем, мать 7 детей. У Мариякан - средне-специальное образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2005 году, благодаря упорному труду Мариякан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров и 5 овец. На собственной земельной доле мерою 5,00 ГА она выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу и чеснок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мариякан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Мариякан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mariakan is 37, married, and the mother of seven children. She has a vocational educataion and earns supplementary income for her family through livestock and crops. She started farming in 2005, and thanks to her hard work she currently has five cows and five sheep. She has her own 5.0 hectare plot of land where she grows wheat, corn, and garlic to use at home and to sell. She earns about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, Mariakan applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She is planning to use the profits to invest in additional livestock in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to fatten and resell

loans.name: Pun's Group

texts.en: Pun is 56 years and lives in Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of nine children, and works for others for a fee to earn the income she needs to improve her family 's living conditions. She supplements this income by raising rice. This is first loan request Pun has made to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has also agreed to lead a four-person loan group.  She will spend her entire loan portion of this loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that this will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Edileo

texts.en: Edileo is 36 years old and lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. He is married, has a three-year-old child, and earns a living by raising and selling hogs. He has been in this line of work for almost five years, and is seeking a loan to buy additional pigs and feed for them to eat. This will help Edileo increase his output and earn higher income. This will, in turn, allow him to provide his child with nutritious food which is very essential to growth. His goal for the future is to continue earning greater profits from his business so that he has a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment and materials needed to fix her videoke machine.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosalina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Rosalina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is an ever-smiling rural farmer in Litein, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is blessed with one child and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize, and when she is not farming, Sharon offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction, despite meager earnings. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Sharon's biggest challenge is drought. The long, dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Sharon formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small, rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for “beautiful”), which produces milk daily that Sharon sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Sharon. The money Sharon got from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. 

Today, Sharon is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her plan for the future is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Sharon is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hearing a description of Alice can sound a lot like hearing someone describe your own mother. She doesn’t stand out in a crowd. She’s not the first one to speak, nor the loudest. She sits down every day in the evening to catch the latest intrigue on her favorite local radio station, which provides maybe the only break in her day. Alice, who is a mother of six and based in the Litein area of Kenya, has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. She sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. That makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy building, so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy building. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that provides small holder farmers with a service bundle that includes credit, training and market facilitation, she believes her life will change. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy building provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from contracting diseases that may arise from being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Alice believes that through this loan her living conditions will change, because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy building. Alice believes that ending poverty begins with empowering women so that they can control their own destiny.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Speu Province, Sokhorn is 34 years old and single. Currently, she grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She earns about 17,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sokhorn's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As group leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will live in healthy conditions after she builds this latrine.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene lives in the town of Dulag, in the province of Leyte. For 20 years now, she has owned a sari-sari (general) store in her house. She has four children; the youngest is 12 and the rest are grown. 

Arlene is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, chips, bath soap, candies and seasoning for her store. She hope to make her store look full, thus attracting more customers. 

Arlene hopes to have a bigger and more successful store in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, bath soap, candies and seasoning to sell

loans.name: Noame

texts.en:
Noame is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Noame is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Noame has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like shampoo, body lotion and other personal items.

Noame has been in this business for four years. In the future, Noame would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, body lotion and other personal items.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, 45, is a mother of three children living in Kampong Speu province. She grows rice as her main source of income to support her family. She can earn about 17,000 KHR per day. 

This is Phan's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy materials to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can have a latrine for her family's use.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation her family.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham Province, Sothea is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and one who is too young. She grows rice on three hectares area to support her family's condition. Moreover, she can earn additional income by raising ducks. 

This is Sothea's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have enough electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Noong Het 3 Group

texts.en:
Quy, 34, lives in a small old house with seven other family members, including her husband and her two children of 11 and 2 years old. Quy and her husband are complimented by people in the village as hardworking and kind people. Indeed, besides cultivating rice and vegetables on the farm, Quy has diversified into raising pigs and chickens, while her husband works extra for local construction employers and as a hired laborer harvesting rice. 

This is the fifth loan that Quy has taken out from Anh Chi Em Program, and this time she will use the loan to buy food for her pigs. With the agricultural technique support from the socio-economic team of Anh Chi Em Program, Quy hopes that she can earn more income for her family and provide better living conditions for her children. 

In the picture, Quy stands first from the right with the traditional Thai hair style.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Gulafsho

texts.en:
Gulafsho is a young entrepreneur who took the initiative to start a business selling shoes for men and women to support her family and help them get ahead.

Gulafsho thinks that her business is doing well due to her dedication; she works ten hours a day. Gulafsho has a selling place in a local market. She dreams of opening her own shop, because in the winter season it is cold in the local market. From the profit of her business, she offers good living conditions for her children. Her husband helps her transport goods.

Gulafsho is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide, she will be able to buy more shoes, thus increasing her sales. This will improve her family's quality of life. She will continue to work hard to create a large company.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, thus increasing her sales

loans.name: Lovisa's Group

texts.en:
Lovisa's group is comprised of hardworking women. Lovisa is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Lovisa has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Lovisa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy tomatoes, eggplant, and black pepper. This will help Lovisa to generate greater profits and buy school essentials for her siblings. Lovisa hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big grocery. 

Lovisa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplant, and black pepper

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a factory worker, aged 26. She is from Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines and she has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Alexandra is a Garment Production Worker. She plays an important role in garment making processes from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Alexandra is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Alexandra is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every payday. She looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help to her. She will use the loan to redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

Alexandra hopes to be always healthy and strong. She wants to give her children a better life and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To reclaim her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Zaida requested her third loan from NWTF for 27,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alba Mery

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Desde hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside y, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Alba manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alba is a woman who is dedicated to her family and to her work.

Her tenacity and perseverance has allowed her to get ahead, overcoming many obstacles that she has found in her path. 

Two years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon located in a space in the house where she lives and she also travels to her client's homes. 

Her business has allowed her to make enough money to help her husband with the household expenses and to meet the needs of her only son. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her business in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, among other things). This will allow her to continue with her work and give her clients a more complete, flexible and efficient service. This will benefit her profit margins. 

Alba maintains that her greatest desire is to be able to continue with her work, establishing and strengthening her business so that she can be more competitive in the market. In this way she will have the capacity to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for her business: hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, among other things.

loans.name: Bua's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bua, born in 1983, is an ethnic Thai person. She lives with her husband and her two little children in Mai Son District, Son La Province.
Her family has a small garden growing coffee and fruit trees, and her family’s main income is based on that garden. Each year, the income collected is only enough to cover the family’s living expenses and have a little left.  

This year, she and her husband have decided to expand the planting area, so the money to invest in buying seedlings and fertilizer is not enough. Knowing of M7 Microfinance Institution Limited, she and her husband hope the institution will extend a loan to them so they can buy fertilizer for the garden.

She expects that the amount borrowed from the institution will help her family’s coffee garden become laden with fruit, bringing in a high income for her family. Her family’s economy situation will be better, and her children will have good conditions for studying to become good and useful citizens of society.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the garden

loans.name: Biatriz

texts.es:
Biatriz es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos de 10, 9 y 6 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso. 
Ella es buena madre, responsable, constante, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ que se encuentra ubicada a orillas del lago Titicaca, donde el clima es muy frío y los rayos solares muy fuertes.
Biatriz es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza muy poco el español porque la mayoría de la comunidad habla aymara. Su negocio es la producción de queso y esta varía de acuerdo a la producción de leche que obtenga de su ganado. Su vivienda es de adobe como la mayoría de las viviendas y goza de agua y luz, sus hijos asisten a la escuela, su esposo realiza labores de siembra y cosecha de la tierra, y produce quinua. Ella sueña mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, realizando la refacción de su casa; se acercan las temporadas de lluvia y necesita arreglar el techo de la habitación donde duermen sus tres hijos para que no filtre agua y puedan descansar calientes, también necesita refaccionar su establo para que sus vacas den leche y la producción de queso sea continua.
Es por esos motivos que Biatriz solicita un préstamo para refaccionar su casa de adobe y sus tres hijos duerman calientes.
texts.en: Biatriz is a 36 year old woman. She is married and has three children who are 10, 9 and 6 years old. Her business is cheese production. She is a good mother, responsible, constant, tenacious and very hardworking. She works in the community of ‘Cachilaya’ which is located on the shore of Lake Titicaca, where the weather is very cold and the solar rays are very strong. Biatriz is dark skinned, of medium height and long black braided hair. Her mode of dress is ethnic (shawl, skirt and hat). Her native language is Aymara, and she does not use Spanish much because her whole community speaks Aymara. Her business is cheese production, and it varies according to the milk production of her cattle. Her house is made of adobe, like most of the houses, and she has water and electricity. Her children attend school; her husband works growing and harvesting the fields, which produce quinoa. She dreams of improving her family's quality of life by fixing her house. The rain season is coming and she needs to fix the roof of the room where her children sleep so water does not leak and they can rest warm. She also needs to fix her barn so her cows give milk and her cheese production is continuous. These are the reasons why Biatriz is requesting a loan in order to fix her adobe house so that her three children sleep warm.

loans.use: to repair her adobe house so that her three children sleep warm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge siempre le ha llamado la atención ser independiente por eso hace 3 años inicio en el sector de chinu un café-internet, muy necesario en el sector pues es de extrema pobreza pero con ganas de salir y gracias a este café los jóvenes y niños pueden tener un lugar donde consultar sus tareas, donde divertirse e interactuar. 
Jorge tiene un compromiso grande seguir con este proyecto que algo aporta a la sociedad por eso quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de un equipo y Una pequeña fotocopiadora. 
Con el crédito tendrá más servicios a favor de la comunidad.
Su sueño es terminar su carrera de administración de empresa, seguir apoyando sus padres y en el futuro tener una familia con la cual convivir y amar.
texts.en:
Jorge has always wanted to become an independent worker, so he opened an internet cafe in Chinú three years ago. The area is extremely poor. Therefore its inhabitants needed this type of business. Now, children and youngsters have a place where they can do their homework, have fun and share some time with others.

Jorge is highly committed to this project, since it contributes to society. This is why he wants to request a loan to buy a computer and a small photocopy machine. This loan will allow him to offer more services to the community.

His dream is to graduate from Business Administration, continue supporting his parents and in the future have a family to cherish.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a photocopy machine to better serve his community.

loans.name: Ñapua Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Ñapua Oñondivepa quiere decir levantarse todas juntas, y ese es el propósito que tiene, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la señora Norma.
Ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una surtida y modesta despensa, es una mujer muy emprendedora, y trabajadora, todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, hasta muy tarde.
La Sra. Norma solicita de este préstamo para la compra  de  productos ya sea harina, carne, verduras, fideos, aceite, azúcar, etc. para luego vender a los clientes, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ñapua Oñondivepa means “all rise up together,” and that is the purpose of the group. They are a part of the poverty elimination program, where one of the members is Norma.

She makes a living in sales. She has a modest store with a lot of variety. She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. Every day she starts working very early, until very late.

Norma is requesting this loan to buy products such as flour, meat, vegetables, noodles, oil, sugar, etc., to later sell them to her customers. This will help her have a more solidified business plan, which will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, vegetables, noodles, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
For the last five years, Wycliffe has been running an electronics shop where he sells a variety of electronics and earns a monthly income of KES 28,000 (Kenyan shillings). He is married to Faith and blessed with two children, ages four years and a month-old baby.

Wycliffe has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use the loan to buy more stocks of assorted electronic goods.

Wycliffe will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of assorted electronic goods.

loans.name: Dario De Jesus

texts.es:
Darío un hombre de 69 años el cual atiende una tienda en el sector muy conocida pues esta ha pasado de generación en generación se ha vuelto una tradición familiar que Darío quiere llevar a otro nivel convirtiéndola en un mini-mercado o bueno ese es el sueño y trabaja todos los días recogiendo recursos para materializar sus sueños. 
Darío es un hombre casado y tiene tres hijos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido en abarrotes, gaseosas, cervezas, que necesita para surtir su negocio pues las ventas no han estado muy bunas y lo poco que ha ganado ha sido para alimentar a su familia. 
Darío es un recurrente prestador lleva 5 créditos con un excelente habito de pago.
texts.en:
Darío is a 69-year-old man who owns a neighborhood store which is very well known, since it has been passed down from generation to generation. It has become a family tradition that Darío wants to bring to another level, converting it into a mini-market. At least, this is his goal and he works every day gathering resources to realize his dreams.

Darío is a married man and has three children. He is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of inventory such as groceries, soft drinks and beer, which he needs to stock his business. His sales have not been very good and the little he has earned has gone toward feeding his family.

Darío is a returning borrower and has received 5 loans with an excellent track record of payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer and provisions to stock his business because due to low sales, he doesn't have the capital to replenish products

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus 3 hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Sonson, Antioquia. 

Ella es madre soltera y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde y pollos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus pollos y cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Maria is a single woman with drive and perseverance. She lives with her 3 children in a humble farm in the rural part of Sonson, Antioquia. She is a single mother and during all this time she has had the bravery and courage to raise her children through her own means.

She makes her living raising and producing pigs and chickens. She has been in this business for 10 years with the goal of having sufficient resources to sustain her family. She works every day as the pigs and chickens require cleaning, food and constant monitoring to develop properly for their future sale. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed for her animals. This will give her the opportunity to have some better fed pigs in better condition for consumption. She dreams of seeing her children as professionals with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 45 años de edad padre orgullo de 3 hermosas hijas que son su tesoro y su motor de vida, se dedica a la mecánica gracias a un taller que monto por vocación pues le gustan y le atraen muchos los motores. 
Trabaja 10 horas por día 6 veces a la semana, reamente se desgata pues quiere que sus hijas estudien y tenga una vida digna.
Debido a la competencia del sector, el señor Cesar quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de herramienta que le permita desplazarse y cubrir la emergencia en el lugar del acto haciendo ver su negocio más atractivo que los demás. 
Su sueño es poder tener recursos para pagar una hacienda propia y dejar el legado de su taller de mecánica  a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 45 year-old man, the proud father of 3 beautiful daughters who are his treasure and the driving force in his life. 

He works as a mechanic in a shop he set up by vocation because he loves motors. He works 10 hours a day 6 days a week. He really drains himself working because he wants his daughters go to school and have a good, respectable life.

Because of the competition in his area of work, Cesar is requesting a loan to invest in tools that will allow him to cover emergencies, going to fix problems on site where they happen. This will move his business above and beyond the others. 

His dream is to have enough resources to buy his own estate, and leave his mechanic’s shop as a legacy to his family.

loans.use: to invest in tools that will allow him to repair emergencies on site and surpass the competition.

loans.name: Elvis Manuel

texts.es:
Elvis es un joven estudiante que vive en la ciudad de Lima, junto a sus padres y su abuelo materno. Su madre es natural de Puno, ciudad ubicada en el altiplano Peruano, ella trabaja de manera informal en la confección de prendas de vestir, su padre lamentablemente sufrió hace unos años un derrame cerebral, es por ello que no puede trabajar, siendo la madre el único apoyo económico en la familia. Elvis es hijo único debido a que su madre perdió un bebé a los meses de nacido.
Para poder tratar de ayudar a su familia, Elvis aparte de estudiar, también trabaja de manera informal como ayudante de sastrería, percibiendo sólo S/. 80.00 semanalmente, lo cual le es muy bajo para apoyar a su familia.
