Debido al deseo de superación que tiene de llegar a ser un excelente profesional y a la difícil situación económica  por la que está atravesando su familia, Elvis recurre al apoyo económico que le pueda brindar KIVA mediante un Crédito Educativo que le pueda permitir culminar sus estudios, porque necesita hacerlo para poder apoyar a su familia que tanto lo necesita
Actualmente está cursando el II Ciclo de la Carrera de Mecatrónica Automotriz, la cual le interesa mucho porque le gusta el funcionamiento de los vehículos al igual que aprender los nuevos conocimientos y tecnologías sobre vehículos desconocidos. Con esa carrera Elvis siente que podrá progresar rápidamente y apoyar a sus padres que tanto lo necesitan.
Elvis siente que la labor que realiza KIVA es admirable y digna de imitar, está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado para que pueda culminar satisfactoriamente su Carrera Técnica y pueda ser un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Elvis is a student who lives in the city of Lima with his parents and his maternal grandmother. His mother is originally from Puno, a city that is located in the Peruvian high plains. She works informally by making clothes. Unfortunately, his father suffered from a cerebral hemorrhage a few years ago and is not able to work. Therefore, his mother is the only one providing financial support for their family. Elvis is an only child since his mother had lost a baby a few months after giving birth.

In addition to studying, Elvis tries to help his family by working as a tailoring assistant. He earns 80 PEN each week, which is nowhere near enough to support his family.

Due to his desire to succeed, his drive to become a successful professional, and his family’s difficult financial situation, Elvis looked to the financial support that Kiva could offer through an educational loan. This will allow him to finish his studies because he needs to be able to support his family. He is currently in his second unit of coursework toward a degree in Automotive Mechatronics. Elvis is greatly interested in this field because he likes to see how vehicles operate. In addition, he enjoys acquiring new knowledge about vehicles that are not well-known. With this degree, Elvis believes that he can make rapid progress and help his parents with whatever they need.

Elvis feels that the work that Kiva does is admirable and worthy to be replicated. He is extremely grateful for the support that has been offered so that he can satisfactorily finish his technical degree and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for his educational expenses.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un joven estudiante natural de la ciudad de Huánuco, ubicado en la Sierra Central de Perú, al igual que sus padres emigraron a Lima en busca de un mejor futuro personal y profesional. Actualmente vive junto a sus padres y sus  6 hermanos (1 hombre y 5 mujeres), él es el hijo mayor.
José Luis se encuentra cursando el II Ciclo de la Carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica, la cual le gusta e interesa mucho porque gracias a ella tendría un trabajo seguro, que le beneficiaría mucho en el futuro y podrá ayudar a sus padres y poder apoyar con la educación de sus hermanos menores.
Si no hubiera tenido acceso a este Crédito lamentablemente hubiera tenido que dejar de estudiar por un año para que se dedique solo a trabajar hasta que pueda reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita poder continuar sus estudios.
José Luis, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado de los asociados de KIVA, él piensa que este programa es muy bueno para aquellos estudiantes que al igual que él, necesitan el apoyo económico  porque sienten que no pueden solventar los gastos debido a la actual situación económica que atraviesan actualmente; logrando así en un futuro a corto plazo, convertirse en un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
José Luis is a young student who is originally from the city of Huánuco, located in the central mountains of Peru. Like his parents, he emigrated to Lima in search of a better personal and professional future. Currently, he lives with his parents and his 6 siblings (1 brother and 5 sisters). He is the oldest son. 

José Luis is currently taking the second part of the degree program in Mechanical Engineering. He likes it and it interests him very much, because it will provide him with a secure job, which will benefit him very much in the future, allowing him to help his parents and support his younger siblings with their education. 

If he had not had access to this loan, he would unfortunately have had to give up his studies for a year in order to work full-time so that he could save up enough money to continue his studies.

José Luis is very grateful for the support provided from those associated with Kiva. He thinks this program is very good for those students who, like him, need economic support because they feel that they cannot cover their costs due to their current economic situations. In this way, in the near future he will be able to become an excellent professional.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the current cycle of his degree program.

loans.name: Carolayn Yiselle

texts.es:
Carolayn, es una joven estudiante natural de Lima. Ella vive en el Distrito de Puente Piedra junto a su hermano menor y sus padres.  Su madre realiza el trabajo de Operaria de Limpieza y su padre no cuenta con un trabajo formal. 

Ella empezó a trabajar a los 19 años de edad,  percibiendo S/. 80.00 nuevos soles semanales trabajando 48 horas semanales. Debido a sus bajos ingresos, su madre hace todo el esfuerzo posible para que Carolayn se forme un futuro profesional.

A pesar de estar trabajando y estudiando, Carolayn actualmente está cursando el 4to. Ciclo de la Carrera de Administración Industrial, e  indica que de no haber tenido acceso a este crédito, la hubiera afectado mucho, ya que por no tener el dinero suficiente para solventar sus pagos, tendría que haber dejado de estudiar y solo trabajaría para poder reunir el dinero que le falta para culminar sus estudios.

A Carolayn le interesó mucho su carrera desde que se encontraba estudiando en el Colegio y está segura que el terminarla le permitiría iniciar su propia empresa para así poder ayudar a su familia.

Para Carolayn, KIVA es una organización que ayuda a las personas que se quieren forjar un futuro, y que por falta de dinero no pueden culminar sus estudios, por lo que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado ya que le permitirá cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carolayn is a young student who is originally from Lima. She lives in the District of Puente Piedra along with her younger brother and her parents. Her mother works as a housekeeper and her father does not have a formal job.

Carolayn began working at the age of 19, earning 80 PEN each week by working 48 hours. Despite her low wages, Carolayn’s mother did everything she could to make it possible for her to become a professional in the future.

Despite having to work and study, Carolayn has now reached her fourth year of study toward a degree in Industrial Management. She says that she would have been greatly affected if she were not able to access this loan. Carolayn would have to quit her studies if she did not have enough money to make her payments. Working full-time would be the only way for her to raise the money she was lacking in order for her to finish her studies.

Carolayn is very interested in her degree because she began studying the subject in high school. She is confident that she will finish because it will allow her to start her own business and be able to support her family. For Carolayn, Kiva is an organization that helps people who want to build a future, but lack the money they need to finish their studies. She is extremely grateful for the support that has been offered so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to cover her current educational expenses.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Susan has been working hard to manage her food stall business, in which she sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables, like cabbage, and will help Susan to generate greater profits and pay for her house rent. Susan hopes that, in the future, she will be able to save money. 

Susan is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell, like cabbage.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. Renato, her partner, is a maintenance worker and they have a child. Eleanor has been working as a factory worker for two years through the aid of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Eleanor is part of the Garment Production Department. She is responsible for the garment making process from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging, and shipping. One of the main dilemmas of employees like Eleanor is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses; they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who have taken their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

Eleanor requested a loan to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She will be using the loan to get back her ATM card that she pawned. She will also use the loan to provide for the educational needs of her child. She has repaid her prior loans as the loan payments are deducted every pay day.  

Eleanor wants to give the best for her child’s education and she is determined to work hard for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned ATM card and to sustain the educational needs of her child.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
La señora  Mayra de 40  años de edad tiene un hijo que depende y vive con su esposo en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 15  años  al negocio de compra venta de pescado,  en su actividad sale todos los días muy temprano  a vender sus productos de forma ambulante.
Doña Mayra está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pescado de todas las clases y para mejorar el techo del lugar donde prepara vende el pescado, con el préstamo desea hacer crecer su negocio y obtener más ganancias para salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en: Mayra is 40 years old and has dependent  son. She lives her husband in the community of San Lorenzo Valle un the south of Honduras. She has made a living for 15 years selling fish. She leaves very early every day to sell her product as a street vendor. Mayra is asking for this loan in order to purchase all kinds of fish so she can earn enough money to improve the roof of the location where she wants to establish a more permanent sales point. She hopes the loan will help her grow her business and earn more money so she can get ahead in life, along with her family. Her dream is to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens, raise them, and then sell them.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
	
For the past three years, Fatuma has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Fatuma wants to purchase a stock of cooking oil, ten kilograms of green grams, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cooking oil, ten kilograms of green grams, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Idalia Group

texts.en: Idalia and Sebastian live in the state of Veracruz, in the beautiful community of Tuxpan municipality. Idalia is married to a fisherman, and she helps him sell the product in the local market. Her home does not have grid access and this situation forces them to pay $3USD daily for buying candles, and that lighting is not enough at nighttime hours, specially for her kids that arrive late from school. She thinks having a solar system is not only improving the quality of lighting for her kids to study, it also represents savings and stop enhailing hazardous fumes and at the same time this system would allow her to charge her cellphone at her place insted of having to do so in a store in a nearby town

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of candles and diesel lamps with clean and reliable energy

location.town: COL. FIDEL HERRERA BELTRAN, TUXPAN, Veracruz

loans.name: Delmira Antonia

texts.es:
Delmira, es acompañada, ya es madre de una niña de 3 años, vive con su compañero de vida y su hija; al formar su propia familia con su compañero de vida iniciaron a trabajar en la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, de esta manera generan ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Está solicitando capital para comprar cerdos y aves de corral, de esta manera incrementara su negocio y así lograra generar más ingresos que serán de utilidad para ir cancelado las cuotas de su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
Los sueños de Delmira son seguir luchando por ampliar su negocio y tener recursos económicos para ofrecer mejores oportunidades de desarrollo a su familia.
texts.en:
Delmira is the mother of a 3 year daughter and has a common law marriage. She lives with her husband and with her daughter. When they formed their family, her husband began to raise pigs and poultry chickens so he could earn enough money to cover household expenses.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase more pigs and poultry chickens so she can grow their business and to earn more money that will be useful for paying off debts and improving their quality of life.

Delmira's dream is to continue to expand her business and to have economic resources to offer to her family so they can have opportunities to grow.

loans.use: purchase pigs and poultry chickens.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 16 years old, is a hard working yoiung woman. She lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda where, for the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking utensils and will help her to generate greater profits and increase her sales. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to expand into a big restaurant. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils

loans.name: Martha Nuvia

texts.es: Martha de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 7 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Martha solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Martha is a 35-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her child. She has a beauty salon business that she has been operating the past seven years out of her home. Martha works Monday through Sunday and has many clients because of her excellent work. With the income earned, she is able to cover their household expenses.

Martha is requesting a loan so that she can buy products for her beauty salon such as crèmes, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other things that she needs. As a result, she will be able to generate more income, which would help provide better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, cement, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Santos de  44  años de  edad vive  con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 8  años al negocio de venta de agua  vende agua en botellones,  bolsas en fardos y  juguitos en bolsas de varios sabores sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas de las comunidades vecinas,  ofrece muy buena atención y buenos productos.
Don Santos vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante  y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de botellones y fardos de agua y también necesita reparar su carro de trabajo ya que tiene algunas partes en mal estado.
Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old and he lives with his wife and children. He has spent the past 8 years selling water. He sells his water in water dispensers, bags, packages and water bottles of various different flavors. His customers are his neighbors and other individuals in the surrounding area. He offers quality service and good products.

Santos lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with dreams of getting ahead in life. He works every day to improve his quality of life.

Santos is asking for this loan in order to stock his business with more water dispensers etc. He also needs to repair is work car because some of the parts are in bad condition.

His dream is to expand his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase water dispensers and bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of candles with clean and reliable energy

loans.name: Nuraeni

texts.en:
Nuraeni, 30 years old and married, has one daughter and one son. She has been in the business of selling clothing and household items since 2011, glad to help increase her family's income.

Nuraeni has requested a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6.000.000 rupiah to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in their home to improve the family's access to water and safe sanitation. The family income will enable complete repayment of the loan.

Nuraeni and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet

loans.name: Hieu's Group

texts.en:
Hieu is 30 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her husband died when he was chasing a criminal. She has to work hard to feed her child by herself with her small salary each month. 

A number of households want to invest in cow breeding. Hieu does not have enough money to do so and requested a loan from M7-MFI, which she will use to start her cow breeding model. Next year the mother cow will give birth to healthy calves and her family’s economy will be well-off.

loans.use: to invest in a cow breeding model

loans.name: Yosuman

texts.ru:
Ёсуман активная молодая девушка, которая в настоящий момент и учится и одновременно работает. Она успешно совмещает учебу с работой. Ёсуман учится заочно в Таджикском Национальном Университете на третьем курсе. Она учится по специальности бухгалтер-аудит. Параллельно Ёсуман работает кредитным офицером в микрокредитной организации. Свою трудовую деятельность она начала 8 месяцев назад. 
Ёсуман еще не замужем. Ей 20 лет. Она живет с родителями, братом и двумя сестрами в Яванском районе. Ее отец и брат сейчас находятся в России на заработках. 
Ёсуман хочет успешно окончить ВУЗ и стать квалифицированным специалистом в своей области. Однако, к сожалению, за текущий год обучения она еще не смогла оплатить по причине нехватки финансов. Поэтому Ёсуман обратилась за кредитом в размере 1300 долларов США. Эту сумму она намерена потратить на оплату за годовое обучение, а также на покупку учебных принадлежностей. 
Ёсуман надеется на Вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Yosuman is an energetic young lady who is currently studying and working.  She is 20, has yet to marry, and lives with her parents, brother, and two sisters in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  At the moment, her father and brother are in Russia as migrant workers.  Yosuman is a distance-learning student in her third year at Tajik National University, where she studies accounting with a focus in auditing.  She has no trouble balancing her studies with her job; she works as a loan officer with a microfinance organization, a position she's held for the past 8 months.

Yosuman wants to successfully graduate and become a highly-qualified specialist in her field.  Unfortunately, she has yet to pay her tuition for the year as she hasn't had enough money to do so.  As such, she is seeking a loan of $1,300 USD to pay for her tuition as well as buy some school supplies, and is counting on your compassion.

loans.use: buy school supplies and pay for her tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: Kihiti est commerçante, membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Karibu», âgée de 53 ans, veuve, mère de 9 enfants dont 2 étudient et 7 sont mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse de pommes de terre et huile de palmes. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de pommes de terre et 20 litres d’huile de palmes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Kihiti is a businesswoman and member of a loan group called «Karibu». She is 53, a widowed mother of nine children of whom two are studying and seven are married. This Hekima client sells potatoes and palm oil. She displays her merchandise in a market in the town. She began her business with money she received from her husband before he died,  and she has been in this business for 25 years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy three sacks of potatoes and 20 liters of palm oil. In this way she hopes to grow her working capital and pay for schooling, clothing and food for her children. In conclusion she is deeply grateful to Hekima for helping  women entrepreneurs, who can't otherwise access loans, to become independent. Please note that several of the women are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of potatoes and 20 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Dúo Pedregal Group

texts.es:
Dúo Pedregal
este grupo esta conformado por la señora Elvia Leticia de 59 años de edad, Desde pequeña ella confeccionaba su propia ropa empezó a confeccionar tambien prendas de vesrtir a sus vecinas  empezó a cobrarles una minima cantidad pero ella se dedico a desarrollar su propio negocio ella empezó a diseñar vestidos de novia de 15 años de graduación pero su capital es muy poquito ella esta my agradecida primeramente con Dios y a fape por la oportunidad que le dieron hace 6 meses con otorgarle el credito ahora ella sigue creciendo en su negocio  y esta obteniendo mas ganancias y ayudando a su familia.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de vestidos.
texts.en: Elvia Leticia belongs to the group Dúo Pedregal . She is 59 years old and since she was young she has made her own clothing. She also made clothes for her neighbors and she began to charge them a small fee. And so her own business was started. She specializes in designing quinceañera dresses and dresses for graduation. Currently, her working capital is very small. But she is thankful first and foremost to God and to Fape for the opportunity given to her 6 months ago to get her first loan. Her business has grown since and she is earning more money and helping her family. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase more material in order to make more dresses.

loans.use: purchase material to make dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.ru: Санабар 55 лет, имеет 3 детей, замужем. Образование у Санабар среднее, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад с 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Санабар, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 3 теленка и 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санабар обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Санабар планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sanabar is 55 and married with three children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as an additional source of income for her family, a business she began 20 years ago with 12,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she currently has three cows, three calves and seven sheep, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Sanabar has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 135,000 KGS to purchase three cows. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil tienen dos hijos que asisten a la escuela.


Rufina tiene un negocio de tamales los vende en el centro de la ciudad,se dedico al negocio para darles lo necesario a sus hijos para los alimentos diarios, el horario de trabajo es de 1:00 PM al 6:00 PM.       

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  medicinas para su hija.

El objetivo de Rufina es que su familia viva bien y que estén bien de salud y siempre seguir trabajando para cancelar a tiempo sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rufina is 30 years old, and studied up until 7th grade. Her life partner works as a construction worker, and they have two children who are at school.

Rufina has a business selling tamales in the city centre. She works at the business to give her children the daily food they need. She works from 1pm - 6pm.

The loan she is asking for is to buy medication for her daughter.

Rufina's goal is to see that her family live well and are healthy, and to always continue working so that she can make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy medication for her daughter.

loans.name: Yimen De Jesus

texts.es:
Yimen es un hombre de 40 años de edad, separado de su esposa y con dos hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad a los cuales les brinda alimentación, estudio y vivienda.
Yimen es un vendedor de comidas ambulante que tiene su carrito, gozando su vida, entablando buenos amistades con sus clientes por los cuales les pregunta siempre como están, antes de venderles un producto mostrando su afecto y carisma por ellos.
Solicita un crédito para realizar unas mejores a su “nave” como estima su carrito de comidas, ampliándolo y haciendo ver más afectuoso a la vista de sus clientes, también quiere comprar insumos para realizar sus comidas, fritos entre otros.  

Yimen sueña con que su negocio le de ingresos suficientes para mantener a él y sus hijos y poder seguir viviendo una vida tranquila.
texts.en:
Yimen is a man of 40 years of age. He is separated from his wife and has two children, ages 17 and 8, to whom he offers food, education, and shelter.

Yimen is mobile food vendor who has his cart, enjoys his life, and enters into good friendships with his customers. He always asks how they are before selling them a product, showing his affection and charm for them.

He is applying for a loan to make some improvements in his "ship," as he considers his food cart, expanding it and making it seem more inviting in the eyes of his customers. He also wants to buy supplies to make his foods, [which include] fried snacks, among other items.

Yimen dreams that his business will give him sufficient income to support himself and his children so that they can continue living an untroubled life.

loans.use: to make improvements in his food cart, which is indispensable for selling, and to buy a stock of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ines De Jesus

texts.es: Don Inés de 61 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura teniendo amplios conocimientos y con más de 30 años de experiencia en la actividad, el terreno lo tiene ubicado en una zona agrícola, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Don Inés solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. Para poder darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Inés is 61 years old and lives with his wife in their own house. He makes a living working as a farmer, a job he has extensive knowledge about and has done for more than 30 years. He has land located in an farming zone. When is harvest is ready, he stores it in sacks likes those shown in the picture. With the profits he makes from his sales, he manages to make ends meet in his household. 

Inés is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc, so he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Las Honestas Group

texts.en:
The six women entrepreneurs of Las Honestas Group live in the community of San Antonio Aguas Calientes in the Department of Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. They consider themselves to be hardworking and honest women, which is why they chose the name Honest Women for their group.  They have a variety of businesses selling clothing, vegetables, tortillas and firewood.  Their average age is 30 and their average education level is 6th grade of primary school. These women are looking forward to get business education classes and the monthly visits from Namaste Business Advisor, who will help them write and implement their business plan. Their hope is by doing this work with Namaste, they would improve their businesses, increase their profits ,and have a better life for themselves and their families.
One typical member of this group is Wanda (first from right), a 30 year-old single woman with a 6th Grade Primary School Degree. Her dream is to have, in the future, her own family with whom she can share her life. Since she was little she has enjoyed the business world and started selling in her community at an early age.  Now she has her own tortilleria, where she also sells vegetables, grains and firewood. Her current monthly profit is 2050 Guatemalan Quetzales per month and she is projecting an increase in sales of 33% during her nine-month cycle with Namaste. She will invest her loan money in more product to sell and in buying items in bulk so she can get better prices.

loans.use: to buy items in bulk to obtain a better price and sell those items.

location.town: San Antonio Aguas Calientes, Antigua, Sacatepéquez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sow for breeding, and feed to nourish his pigs as he is the father of 6 children and they depend on him.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of hardworking women. Florence is 22 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Florence has been working hard to manage her food business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a frying pan, cooking oil, wheat and sugar. This investment will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay her house rent. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, cooking oil, wheat and sugar

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is married, with four school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Maku has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 38 years old from Dulag, Leyte. For the last four years, she and her husband have run multiple businesses. She buys and sells copra (dried coconut meat), sells electronic loads (prepaid loads for cellphones), raises hogs and makes hollow blocks. She has enjoyed what she is doing for four years now. 

Marissa is asking for a loan to continue expanding her business. She will use it to buy more copra, electronic loads, and feed for hogs. With these available, it will be easier for her to focus on managing her business. 

Her income is used for food and reinvestment in the same venture. She hope to make her business more sustainable someday.

loans.use: to buy more copra, electronic load, and feed

loans.name: Flores De Santiago Group

texts.en:
The seven members of this group live in the town of Santiago, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. The age range is from 21 to 57, and have an average education level of third grade of primary school. All the members of the group are indigenous Maya and wear the traditional dress of their town. Several of them speak Kaqchikel, one of the Mayan languages.  They all want very much to have a better life for their children. The mothers have worked hard to keep their children in school because they know how hard life is with little education.
Several of the businesses involve making and selling food.  One woman buys and sells fruits and vegetables. Another buys and sells used clothing.  One sells the typical skirts and blouses of the area.  Another has a small store selling daily necessities. They are hard workers and dedicated women. They are eager to learn how to improve their businesses with the business training giving for Namaste.  They will receive classes in financial literacy and each will have a personal business adviser, who will help them to write a business plan and offer advice on how to grow their business to meet their goals.

One of these women, Nicolasa (first from left), is very entrepreneurial and has a small store that sells products for daily need for people in the neighborhood.  She is 57 years old, married, and has nine children.  She did not have the chance to go to school and therefore cannot read or write.  This situation is not keeping her away of hard work and progress in business.  She has worked in family businesses since she was very young and has had her own house for 20 years.  She heard of the Namaste program through her niece, who is also a member of the group.  She wants to learn as much as she can, so she can grow her business and improve the life of her family. She plans to spend her loan money increasing the stock and variety of products in her store. She currently makes a profit of 3,900 Guatemalan Quetzales per month. With the help of her business adviser she projects that during her nine months with Namaste she will increase her profits by 66%.

loans.use: increasing the stock and variety of products in their store

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Un, 32, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province. 

Un struggles for her family's living conditions via rice-cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and it returns her about KHR 20,000 per day. 

This is Un's first loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can have better living conditions after get this latrine.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two daughters, and her husband is a migrant in Russia. She is a farmer, and her mother-in-law helps her in farming. They have a farm and raise corn and other crops there. Malohat has been working in this area for two years and has good experience, but her monthly income is low. This very low income doesn’t cover the family’s demands.

Farming has expanded much in Tajikistan, and raising corn and crops is in high demand. People raise corn and sell the harvest to bakeries or local bazaars.

The farm’s productivity has fallen, and Malohat can’t get the usual income from sales. The family has a hard time, and they need money to cover their demands. She has applied for a 10,000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) loan in order to supply the farm with good fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stone, sand, and cement - and to pay for workers to build a wall.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia es una persona mayor de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato con sus pareja hace cinco años, de esa relación tiene un dependiente económico que es su hija, alcanzo estudiar hasta el nivel técnico, pero actualmente está dedicada a la agricultura, produce papa, haba y otros productos, en la misma comunidad donde vive junto a su pareja  tiene sus propios terrenos  agrícolas heredados de su padre y una casa rustica, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para compra de abono orgánico gallinaza y semilla de papa, de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos y por lo tanto la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a single adult, but she has been in a common-law relationship with her partner for the past five years. They have a daughter who is a financial dependent. Julia received her technical education, but now she engages in agriculture. She grows potatoes, beans, and other products.

In the community where they live, Julia and her partner own land that she inherited from her father. They live in a house made of basic materials. Julia currently needs a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and seed potatoes. This will improve her earnings and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seed potatoes.

loans.name: George

texts.es:
George tiene 23 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; aún no tiene hijos, vive en casa de familia con papá y mamá en caserío el Fraile, vivienda es de material rustico de dos pisos. Él y cónyuge son naturales de la comunidad, la misma que está ubicada en distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. George se lleva bien con los miembros de su caserío, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales; su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza George es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor, plantación esta en primer año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 5 años en caserío; cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito santo tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica al cultivo de maíz amarillo criollo duro contando a la fecha con 2 has. Por cosechar en caserío el fraile sector la Moyuna.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
George, age 23, has a stable household at his wife’s side.  They do not yet have children.   He lives in the family house with his father and mother in the Fraile settlement.  The house is made of very basic materials, and it has two floors.  He and his wife are from this community, which is located in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarc region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

George gets along well with the members of his settlement.  He has good personal and good work references. His community works basically in crops, cattle, and commerce.   

George’s business activity is cultivating coffee.  To date he has one hectare of the ‘catimor’ variety planted.  This is the first year of production.  He has his own agricultural land where he grows coffee is.  He has been in this business activity for five years.

He has experience in the field of cultivating coffee.  He sells the product in the Santo Tomas district to buyers in the area.

Additionally, he cultivates a hardy hybrid of yellow corn.  

He will use the loan for maintenance on his one hectare of coffee that is in production.  This will assure him of a greater and better production in the 2015 season.  As a result, he will get greater income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Carlos Romeo

texts.es:
Carlos de 38 años de edad, es bachiller, esta casado. Su esposa se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, tiene dos hijos solo uno depende de él porque el otro ya trabaja.

 Carlos tiene distintas actividades de trabajo es agricultor, ganadero, trabajos que a desempeñado por muchos años. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado para luego venderlo y obtener una ganancia.   Carlos desea comprar bastante ganado para poder dejarle un buen patrimonio a su familia y tengan para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old, is a high school graduate, and is married. His wife works in the sale of fruits and vegetables. He has two children, only one of which depends on him because the other one is already working. 

Carlos has several occupations; he is a farmer as well as a rancher, and both are jobs that he has held for many years.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase livestock in order for resale and to make a profit. Carlos would like to buy enough livestock to leave his family with a good amount of assets so that they have enough to continue working.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale and to make a profit.

loans.name: Cesar Carlos

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, vive en casa alquilada, natural de la zona, cuenta con buenas referencias personales, económicas y laborales. Cesar vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Cesar es brindar servicios como transportista cuenta con una unidad propia, las rutas son Pomahuaca las juntas y viceversa. Tiene 2 años de experiencia en esta actividad, además se dedica realizar trabajos como peón agrícola, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito con total normalidad.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en arreglos a su movilidad, asegurando de esta forma el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Cesar is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife and young child in a rented home.  He is originally from this area and has good personal, financial, and work references.  Cesar lives in the rural part of the Pomahuaca district in the Jaen province and Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.  He has water and electricity services.  His community mostly works in farming, livestock, and commerce.

Cesar works providing transportation services with his own vehicle.  His routes are from Pomahuaca to Las Juntas and back.  He has two years of experience with this work.  He also works as a farmhand, and his additional income will allow him to repay the loan without trouble.

He will use this loan to invest in repairs to his vehicle, to ensure that it is functioning correctly so he can do his work.  In a short time period he can generate more income and be able to improve his quality of life.  His work has no major competition in the area, so he earns the best prices.

loans.use: to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family has a small coffee garden and it is her family’s main source of income. In addition, her family also does pig-raising for meat, and they have chickens as well. The income from these activities is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. 

After gaining knowledge about plants, she and her husband decided to change the type of fertilizer for her coffee garden from chemical fertilizers to organic fertilizers, with hopes for higher yields.  But because their income is only enough for food, she and her husband do not have enough capital to change fertilizer, so she wishes to request a loan from M7 Microfinance Institution Limited.

Hopefully, in the future, she will become the first successful one in her area using this method of using organic fertilizer for plants, and her coffee garden this year will have more fruit and bring higher income for her family, and she hopes that she and her husband will have money to repay the loan from the institution on time.

loans.use: to change the type of fertilizer from chemical fertilizers to organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in banking.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Beatrice, a 40-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Cheborgei, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. She is happily married and has three children that depend on her for the basic needs. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major primary sources of income are egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. 

The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a secure solid education to her children.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong was born in 1981 and she lives with her husband and daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding. 

Her daughter is at school age, so Phuong wants to borrow a loan from M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7-MFI) to pay for her daughter’s education cost. She hopes the loan will help her daughter feel secure in studying and that she can contribute to her native land when she grows up.
	
Phuong and other members of the group will work hard to get money to repay M7-MFI on-time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education cost.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Dulag, Leyte. Her youngest child is 15 years old. 

She engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish. She has been selling fish for more than 5 years now. Aside from fish vending, Lydia engages in selling dressed chicken, which she does in a small stall located inside the market. These are the sources of her income.

She is planning to put up a piggery, but due to lack of capital, Lydia is requesting a loan to buy more stock of fresh fish, dressed chicken, and materials for the construction of the piggery. These are essential tools to augment her earnings and could eventually pay for the family's daily needs.

Lydia would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fresh fish, dressed  chicken, and materials for the construction of a piggery

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene de 45 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, sin carga familiar, vive en casa propia de material rustico en el caserío de Laynas del distrito de la Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Alberto es la compra y venta de leña. Él lleva a los pueblos de los alrededores en su mototaxi. Adicionalmente se dedica junto con su esposa a la venta de chicha de jora y comida(piqueos de pescado básicamente), esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, contando ya con clientela fija de su distrito y alrededores. El destino del crédito será para la compra de cerveza incluidas cajas y jora en grano(insumo para elaboración de chicha). Pues Alberto desea inyectar más capital a este negocio familiar porque la compra le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos ya que el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas porque hay campaña de cosecha de arroz y por ende su clientela tiene capacidad adquisitiva para consumir sus productos, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorarán.
texts.en:
Alberto is 45 years old, and he lives with a partner. He has no other dependents.  He lives in his own home, made of rudimentary materials, in the rural settlement called "Laynas."  This is located in the Matanza district, a place where the residents work in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.  In his house, he has basic utilities such as water and electricity.  His community is located in the Matanza district of Morropon province, on the northern coast of Peru.

Alberto's business is to buy and sell firewood. He buys the firewood and sells it in the surrounding towns. In addition,  he and his wife sells chicha de jora (a Peruvian beverage) and food (mostly snacks made from fish).  He's had the chicha  business for 5 years, and he already has an established customer base in his district and in the surrounding areas.  He will use this loan to buy crates of beer and corn grains used to make the beverage. This purchase will help him to increase his income. Alberto is willing to use more capital in this family business because the market opportunities for him due to the rice season his customers have more money to consume his products.  Therefore, he will be able to generate more earnings and income, and thereby improve the quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and grains for corn to make a beverage to sell

loans.name: Allie

texts.en:
Allie is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Allie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy coconut seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Allie has been farming coconuts for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lucia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ad's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampot province, Ad is 33 years old and a mother of eight children. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, two of whom are in school and one who is younger. 

For her living, she earns income to support her family condition via rice cropping. She can earn an income of about 13,800 KHR per day. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of two to get the new loan. As the group leader, she will use the loan funds to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in a healthy environment.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Fatuma has operated a business selling clothes, which she sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Fatuma dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
Scovia's group is comprised of hardworking women. Scovia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past yeas, Scovia has been working hard to manage her brewing business, which brews local beer. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy benches, jerrycans, sorghum and millet, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her kid. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy benches, jerrycans, sorghum, millet

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Muhisini, who is in his mid-thirties, is a widower with two children who are still in school. He has been selling fish since 2000. He works from 4:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Muhisini's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep increasing the fish stock, and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to increase the fish stock and meet his customers' demand. He dreams of having very big fish sales.  

Muhisini will share this loan with his loan group "Nadia", which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the fish stock and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is not true for Judith, 25, who is based in the Litein area of Kenya and is a mother of four lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 8 years and she has managed to earn a decent income. 

Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows." Her hobby is milking Lelkina (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet the demand. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margin and increased income levels. 

Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Judith is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yoghurt.

An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.en:
Sirojiddin was born in 1993. He is a single man. Sirojiddin is a student of the fourth course at Tajikistan Metallurgy University. He studies well. Since childhood, he has liked to read books. So, he read a lot of books. Sirojiddin usually takes part in many competitions. He has good knowledge. 

Sirojiddin is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition because he has not enough money. He awaits your mercy and needs your financial support. Sirojiddin thanks Kiva in advance for the generosity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Claudia is married and has two children. Works as a primary school teacher. She helps her parents since their both were retired.His father has developed a vision problem and requires an eye surgery because it is affecting his daily activities. Due to economic problems, he has not been able to have the eye surgery yet.

loans.use: to pay for an eye surgery for her father.

loans.name: Kulusumu's Group

texts.en:
Kulusum's group is comprised of hardworking women. Kulusum is 18 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 4 years, Kulusum has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, selling food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Kulusum has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge, sauce pans, plates, tables and plastic chairs, and will help Kulusum to generate greater profits and pay her rent. Kulusum hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Kulusum is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, saucepans, plates, tables and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Getrude's Group

texts.en:
Getrude's group is comprised of hardworking women. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Getrude has been working hard to manage her poultry business, raising chickens. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feeds, drinkers and containers, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and increase her chicken sales. She hopes that in the future she will be able to become self-dependent. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more chicken feeds, drinkers and containers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been earning well from her business activities for many years. She has been retailing meat in the market, farming, and is now running a retail store in their village, from which she is earning good income as well. She has repaid successfully her previous loans used for her business and farming. 

To improve her business, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods, grains, and livestock feeding supplies for her store. She makes it possible to improve her business and their farm in order to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, grains, and livestock feeding supplies for her store.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Dulag, Leyte. Her main source of livelihood is fishing. She sells fish to the nearby community. Aside from fishing she also raises hogs as an additional source of income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and additional pigs and pig feed. These will help improve her fishing activity, as she gains a larger catch. She will also sell more pigs. With these improvements, Jonalyn can now afford to buy nutritious food for her growing children.

In the future, Jonalyn hopes of expanding both of her businesses and making them successful.

loans.use: to buy to fishing net and additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Maria Ligaya

texts.en:
Maria Ligaya is single and has a business of selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. In the future, Maria Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Icyerekezo  Need Photo Group

texts.en:
Isabelle is a group leader; aged 29. She is married with 2 children, ages 4 and 2, and neither goes to school yet. The group is called ICYEREKEZO, which means “Vision” in English. This photo was taken close to the UOB offices. 

The members of this group sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for making a better future. Isabelle has a supermarket and has been running this business for 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk, yoghurt, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more milk, yoghurt, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Preah Vihear province, Soung is 54 years old and a mother of six children. She can earn income to improve her family via rice cropping and growing various kinds of vegetables to earn more income. 

This is Soung's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can improve her family and cut down on her spending.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Kanoatsho

texts.en:
Kanoatsho was born in 1995. He is not married and lives with his parents. Last year, he successfully graduated from school. 

Kanoatsho continues his education in the university. He studies to get a bachelor's degree. His profession is economics. He reads a lot of books, so he often goes to the library. 

Kanoatsho’s parents do not have the ability to pay for his tuition. So, he is asking for a loan of USD 700 to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Hello World... meet Purity. She is a smallholder farmer. She lives together with Frederick, her husband, in Mugwe village, which is located in central Kenya. Their 13-year-old marriage has been blessed with 4 children, the youngest being 4 and the oldest 13. They have managed to pay for their children to attend boarding schools so that they can focus on building a future of their own.
 
Purity became a farmer in 2007 when she started making use of her husband's one acre piece of land. She has grown the farmstead to a sustainable and profitable state. This unrelenting farmer is seeking a loan to further boost productivity.

She is seeking a loan to purchase feeds for her animals. The feeds that she plans to acquire have a well-proportioned nutritional content that will help improve animal health and boost milk production. On the farm, she has one dairy cow, 8 poultry and one dairy goat that will benefit directly from this loan. 

Purity was born second to last in a family of 6 children. She was promising, but her education was cut short in the first year of high school. Her passionate interest for farming took over, and today she makes a decent living off farming to pay for her children's upkeep and education in boarding schools. 

She is so committed to the success of her farm that you will witness evidence of progressive techniques like irrigation on her farm. What also drives her is her love for animals. She named her cow 'Mwendwa' which means 'loved one'.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, creamer, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, sugar, etc. to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, creamer, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is composed of hardworking women. Christine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her fish business, which sells fish. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and provide essentials for her family. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to enroll for a course. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a smart and young woman. She is 19 years old. 

Nargis is a student of the second course. She studies at the Pedagogical University. Nargis also works in a school. She teaches geography. Nargis has good knowledge. She manages both work and education well. Nargis is not married and lives with her parents. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to pay for her university tuition. Nargis awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Cassamo

texts.pt:
O senhor Cassmo  é militar, viuvo, pai de 4 filhos 2 já maiores 2 a estudar  no nivel  primario vive na casa do servico.
Ele diz que com este valor irá comprar chapas de zinco, pedra, areia, varroes e cimento para dar continuidade a construcao de sua casa.
No futuro tem como planos fazer o muro de vedaçāo de seu quintal, terminar a casa e fazer criacao de gado bovino.
Diz que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos e que alem  salario vendes carne de caca que servem de reforco para a renda familia.
texts.en: Cassmo is in the military. He is widowed and has 4 children, 2 who are adults and 2 who are in primary school.  He lives in military housing.  He tells us that with this loan he will purchase zinc panels, stones, sand, metal bars, and cement to continue building his home.  In the future he would like to build a wall around his property, finish construction on his home, and raise cattle.  He will make his payments as scheduled and request additional loans.  In addition to his salary he also sells wild game meat to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase zinc panels, stones, sand, metal bars, and cement.

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika, a hardworking young woman, is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her clothing-sales business. 

To help expand, Zalika has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes. This will assist her in generating greater profits and paying for necessities. Zalika hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Zalika is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Natividad works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fruits. Natividad is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers through her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Natividad successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 2 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.

Ella tiene un pequeño puesto de trabajo en el que vende jugos de fruta que ella misma prepara en su casa. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a su carro de jugos, comprar utensilios de trabajo y comprar insumos para sus preparaciones.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda y buen corazón de las personas para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Maria is a wise, experienced and patient woman. She is the mother of two children and has worked practically her whole life to raise them. She has a little stand where she sells fruit juice that she makes herself at her house. She works every day from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm to have her product ready and fresh for her customers, who are mostly her neighbors from the area where she lives. 

She wants to expand her business to bring in more money and to have a bigger stock of products. This is why she's resorting to a loan- in order to maintain her juice cart, to buy work utensils and to buy more products. One of her main difficulties in that she lacks the money to invest in her business, but she relies on the help of good-hearted people to keep her business moving forward.

loans.use: to maintain her juice cart, to buy work utensils and to buy more products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Maria is married and lives with her family. She and her husband are retired. He developed a vision problem. Hence, she decided to take him to a vision exam. The exam concluded that he has a retina problem. Due to economic reasons they have not been able to performed the surgery yet.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mariano is married and lives with his family. He works as a bus driver and he has an eye vision problem which is affecting his job because he has to drive for long hours. 

He is unable to see objects from far distance, and he has decided to have the eyes surgery to correct this issue.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: San Jeronimo De Surco Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN JERONIMO DE SURCO” es un grupo conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas y a la agricultura. Tarcila tiene 62 años de  edad es conviviente con hijos independiente. Ella se dedica a la compra de fruta palta chirimoya manzana al por mayor para luego expenderlos al por menor. Y a la vez vende alfalfa. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y alfalfa. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el crédito brindado. Tarcila es la que viste chompa lila. De la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Robert en la parte superior derecho que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The San Jeronimo de Surco group is made up of members who work in retail and agriculture. Tarcila is 62 years old, has a partner and independent children. She buys fruits such as avocados and custard apples in bulk to sell. She also sells alfalfa. She will invest the loan to buy more fruit and alfalfa. 

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loans they give. Tarcila is the one you see in the lilac sweater. You can also see the photo of Robert attached in the top right, as he could be there at the meeting because he had to work.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and alfalfa

loans.name: Facilio

texts.pt:
O senhor  Facilio de 27 anos  de idade é assentador de linha,casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primario os restantes 2 ainda menores  de idade sustenta sua sua mae enviando apenas e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, pranchas, carinha de mao para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar sua obra, mobilar e fazer dependencias para arrendar reforcando a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e tem uma conta onde faz suas poupancas, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Facilio is 27 years old works on an assembly line.  He is married and has 3 children, 1 of whom attends primary school, while the others are still too  young.  He also supports his mother by sending her money.  He owns the house where he lives.  The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase cement, zinc panels, boards, and labor to continue work on his home.  His projects and dreams are to finish construction, furnish his home, and build outbuildings that he can rent to increase the family income. He tells us his main challenges have been financial.  He has an account where he saves money.  He will request additional loans to put his plans into action.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc panels, boards, and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Reynaldo is currently married and lives with his family. He still working, even though he's retired . he has a vision problem that is affecting his daily life activities.  The vision issue has affected him to continue working. Hence, he is in this moment in incapacitated. He can not afford the cost of the surgery without working. He went for a vision exam, and he is a good candidate for having a surgery to correct his vision.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
