texts.en: Samantha is single and currently is living with her parents.  She currently works as an operator in a manufacturing company for A/C, she has developed a hereditary vision issue.  It is affecting her on daily life activities because she cannot see from  far distance.  Due to financial reasons she has not been able to have a surgery because she supports her parents financially. Recently, she went to have the vision exam in order to have the surgery.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Petronila requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Petronila has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Petronila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. The oldest child is 6, while the youngest is 7 months old. 

Abegail goes fishing and sells fresh fish to the people in the community. Her husband is a fisherman. Abegail has been fishing for almost six years now. Due to the scarcity of capital to finance her fishing livelihood, Abegail is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, and for additional capital to purchase rice for the start-up of her rice retailing business. These will help her earn a higher income that could help her defray the family's daily expenses.

In the future, Abegail would like to expand both of her businesses for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and have additional capital to purchase rice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Florencia is married and has  two children. She works together with her husband in a restaurant. In the eye exam she realized she was having difficulties to see objects from far distant. Therefore, she decided to apply for an eye surgery, but due to economic reasons she has not been able to afford the surgery.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Rodrigo is married and retired for his previous job. Although he is retired, he still working as a security guard. He recently developed a vision problem that is affecting his daily activities. Due to financial reasons, he has not been able to have an eye surgery.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and maintain his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber and paint.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
O senhor  Armando é pensionista de 66 anos de idade casado pai de  8 filhos  dos quais 5 a estudar  3 ja sao  independentes nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos  vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa adiquir uma viatura para uso pessoal
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Armando is retired.  He is 66 years old, married, and has 8 children.  5 of his children attend school and 3 are already independent.  He does not support anyone other than his children, and he owns the home where he lives. With this loan he will purchase cement, bars, zinc panels, beams, boards, and sand to continue construction on his home.  His projects and dreams are to finish building his home and buy a vehicle for personal use.  His main challenges have been his finances, and he will request additional loans to put his plans in action.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bars, zinc panels, beams, boards, and sand.

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.es:
Edith de 39 años de edad,  estudio segundo grado, sus padres no la dejaron continuar por lo que no siguió, ya que en ese tiempo pensaban los papás que era mejor trabajar que estar en la escuela.  Es casada,  su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen tres hijos, el mayor estudia bachillerato, la de 10 años estudia cuarto grado y niña menor no estudia aún. 

Edith administra su tienda, donde vende todo tipo de producto para la cocina, es única tienda que hay en la colonia, por lo que percibe un ingreso considerado,  sus clientes ya la conocen. Tiene más de cinco años de tener el negocio, la falta de tener ingresos y solo  pasar en la casa dedicándose solo a los trabajos domésticos, se dio cuenta que podía  darle atención a una tienda, por lo que decidió emprender. 

El negocio la tiene en la casa, por lo que las salidas que realiza es para surtir la tienda, sus hijos le colaboran al regresar de la escuela a atender el negocio. El horario que atiende es de las 6:00 am a 7:00 pm.  Los créditos anteriores se le han tramitado por la línea kiva,  y se ha podido ver su desarrollo, ya que siempre tiene capital por medio del préstamo, para poder invertir en la tienda. 
	
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar aceite por mayor y productos lácteos. Nuevamente comprara aceite ya que es un producto muy demandado en la tienda.

Los sueños que tiene son poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia, espera darle siempre el apoyo a sus hijos para que estudien. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
39-year-old Edith went to school through second grade. Her parents did not let her continue so she did not keep going, because back then parents thought it was better to work than be in school. She is married. Her partner makes a living in agriculture. They have three children. The oldest is in high school, the ten-year-old girl is in fourth grade, and the youngest girl is not in school yet.

She has a store, where she sells all kinds of products for cooking. It is the only store there is in the neighborhood, so her income is substantial. Her customers know her. She has had the business for more than five years. Not having income and only being at the house doing household chores, she realized that she could tend to a store, so she decided to do that.

She has the business at her home, so the expenses she has are for stocking the store. Her children help her tend to the store when they come home from school. The schedule that she works is from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. She received previous loans through Kiva and has been able to see development, as she always has money left over from the loan to invest in the store. She's asking for a loan to buy oil in bulk and dairy products. She will buy oil again since it's in great demand at her store. 

Her dreams are to always have increasing sales and with this to earn a greater income with which she will be able to cover the cost of her necessities and those of her family. She hopes to always be able to support her children so they can go to school. Her earnings will be invested in paying her bills and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oil in bulk and dairy products.

loans.name: Yehowa Da 2 Group

texts.en:
The group Yehowa Da 2 is composed of 5 women who average 42 years of age, and have 2 children each. They all live in traditional families in Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in pastries, plastic bowls, wigs, and charcoal. 

The women of Yehowa Da 2 Group are on their seventh loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution ID Ghana. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

One member, Vida, currently sells plastic bowls. She intends to purchase plastic bowls from the market and then retail them to her mixed customer-base in Accra. She plans on making a good profit, part of which she will save, while the rest will be used to cover her family's day-to-day expenses. Vida is married to a driver, and they have 2 children.

The members Yehowa Da 2 Group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of their loan.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls from the market to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, rice and chickens.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a hardworking woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells sacks of charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal, and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and pay medical bills. Pauline hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a hard working woman. Zakia is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Zakia has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells kids clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zakia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Zakia to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Zakia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Zakia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of beauty products for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from raising chickens and buying and selling accessories.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 29-years-old and married with two children.

Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Analy has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Analy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
O senhor  Manuel é comerciante, de 32 anos de idade  pai de  1 filhos  a estudar no nivel primario alem do filho sustenta sua irma que vive com ele vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a costrucao de um salao de cabeleireiro.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de seu salao onde sua esposa ira fazer os trabalhos de cabelereiro, fazer muro de vedacao na sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e saturacao do mercado, diz ainda que faz xitique mensal para poupar o seu dinheiroe que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Manuel has a retail business.  He is 32 years old and has 1 child who attends primary school.  In addition to his son, he supports his sister who lives with him in a home he owns. The loan will be used to purchase cement, metal bars, zinc panels, beams, boards, and sand to continue construction of a hairdressing salon. His dreams and projects are to complete construction of the salon so his wife can work there, and to build a wall around his home. The primarily challenges he faces are finances and the saturation of the market.  He says that although he participates in a xitique (traditional method of communal savings), he will request additional loans to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal bars, zinc panels, beams, boards, and sand.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria vive con padres e hija, en casa propia. Aproximadamente más de 20 años. Tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Dicha comunidad queda ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general (arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros), en el distrito de Mocupe Nuevo, desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de mercaderia (variación de productos: arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros) y ampliar el negocio, ya que depende de mucha demanda pues ella con el préstamo pretende aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos para poder atender los diferentes gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her parents and her daughter in her own house for a little over 20 years. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her family is very united. She lives in a business, agriculture and livestock community located in the district of Lagunas in the province of Chiclayo in Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru. 

Gloria has sold groceries (rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.) in the district of Mocupe Nuevo for over five years. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (a variety of products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.) and to expand the business, as she has a lot of demand. She'll be able to increase and diversify her stock of products in order to tend to her customers' needs. In this way, she'll be able to increase her sales, make more money and increase her income, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (a variety of products: rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.) and expand her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 70 years old, widowed, and has 7 children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosita has borrowed and successfully repaid 13 loans now from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 14 years and also earns income from retailing electronic credit for mobile phones.

Rosita aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина досрочно погасила предыдущий кредит, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. Кредитные средства Мадина использовала по назначению. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Мадины составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья, часть средств будет потрачена на покупку сена и корма на зиму для скота. Доходы от кредита Мадина направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Madina repaid her previous loan ahead of schedule and is very grateful to Kiva and all of the investors who helped her with the financing. She used the loan for its intended purpose and currently earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. She applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cattle to increase her livestock numbers and to buy hay and feed for the livestock for the winter. She will use her profits to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock, along with hay and feed for winter

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru:
35-летняя Розия из маленького района Яван, где проживает там вместе с мужем и сыном. Ее сыну 8 лет и он учится в школе. А муж в настоящий момент находится на заработках в России. Сама Розия по профессии швея. Она на протяжении 3 лет занимается шитьем женских платьев национального покроя и принимает заказы у себя дома. Розия шьет на своей старой машинке. Для развития дела она хотела бы обновить свою машинку и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Розия на сумму кредита собирается купить профессиональную швейную машинку, которая продается вместе со столиком. Благодаря такой машинке процесс ее работы ускорится и она сможет увеличить доходность своего швейного дела. 
Поэтому она с надеждой ждет от Вас поддержки.
texts.en: 35-year-old Roziya is from the small Yavan region, where she lives with her husband and her son, who is eight years old and goes to school. Her husband currently works in Russia. Roziya is a seamstress by profession. She has been sewing traditional women’s dresses for over three years and takes orders from home. She sews on an old machine. In order to expand her business, she would like to update her sewing machine and applied for a loan for this purpose. Roziya is planning to buy a professional sewing machine that is sold with a table. Thanks to this machine she will be able to work more quickly and increase her earnings. This is why she is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing machine and table

loans.name: Sohira

texts.en:
Sohira is a kind woman. She is 29 years old, married, and a caring mother of 2 small children.  

Sohira works in a factory. She is a very hardworking woman and does her work well. She is a weigher at the factory, but Sohira also studies at the university. She is studying for her higher education and aims to work in an office. 

Sohira is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay her tuition costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs like manure, irrigation, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Never De Jesus

texts.es:
Never es un hombre de 42 años de edad dueño de una ferretería en la cual ofrece dos empleos y busca siempre expanderser y mirar oportunidades para mejorar su negocio y poder seguir contratando personal que representa progreso para su vida.
Es padre de un hijo que tiene 11 años y a pesar que no vive con la mamá Never le responde y le brinda todo el apoyo tanto amoroso como monetario a su hijo. 
Never abrió el negocio hace 6 meses y sabe muy bien que no se puede quedar con lo mismo y la mejor manera de progresar es invirtiendo en este por dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos y varillas que se usan en construcción, con la inclusión de estos productos aumentara su oferta y sus clientes buscando posicionarse en el mercado y ser más competitivo.
texts.en:
Never is a 42 year old man and owner of a hardware store. His shop has two employees and is always looking for opportunities to expand and improve his business. He is the father of one son who is 11 years old. Even though he is not together with the mother, Never provides for his son both with money and endless love. 
He opened up his hardware store 6 months ago and knows very well that the best way to grow is to invest. For this reason he is asking for credit to buy more bricks and supplies used in construction. With the increased amount of inventory to offer clients he will have more business in the competitive market.

loans.use: to buy bricks and inventory for his hardware store

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana continua trabajando en su negocio de elaboración de pupusas, el crédito anterior le ayudo mucho para adquirir los insumos y su clientela quedo satisfecha. 

Hoy nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharron y maíz en cantidades más grandes que la anterior.
texts.en:
Ana continues to work on her business of making "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). The previous loan greatly helped her purchase ingredients, and her customers were left satisfied. 

Now, she is requesting a loan again in order to buy fresh cheese, "chicharron" (pork rinds or cracklings, or fried chunks of other meat), and corn in larger quantities than before.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, "chicharron" (pork rinds or cracklings, or fried chunks of other meat), and corn in larger quantities.

loans.name: Eneida Ivonne

texts.es:
Eneida es mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja en una cadena de supermercados de su ciudad natal, Ica. Debido a algunas situaciones económicas en su familia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ella cree que no es tarde para empezar con una carrera por eso es que actualmente estudia enfermería y cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre se esfuerza y estudia bastante.
Eneida está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la matrícula de la Universidad, de esta manera podrá continuar con sus estudios sin ningún inconveniente y así más adelante convertirse en una exitosa profesional y pueda apoyar a su familia para que tengan un futuro mejor y mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Eneida is a lady with a great desire to come out ahead.  She works for a supermarket chain in her hometown of Ica.  She was not able to study for a professional career due to some family financial situations, but she believes that it’s not too late to start a new career, so she is studying hard to be a nurse.

Eneida is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed her to pay her university tuition and be able to continue studying without problems and become a successful professional so she can support her family so that they will have a better future and wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sausages, hotdogs, and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen's husband has been running a manufacturing business where he makes wooden carts, mainly used for carrying goods and movable stalls. He is hardworking and a polite person. He needs financing for making the wooden wheel carts.

Shaheen is 39 and a mother of three children. As her husband is the sole earning person in the family, and he needs financing for buying wooden planks, wheels and tires to make new carts, she wants to help her husband by applying for a loan to help him with the purchase. They dream of a better life and want the business to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks, wheels and tires for making wheel carts.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Sharifa has been working hard to manage her business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sharifa has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal, and will help her to generate greater profits and to pay for rent. She hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Sharifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and is a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar tiene 53 años de edad, y es soltera, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Pilar se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, de gaseosas, cervezas y marcianos; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues desea invertir en compra de mayores cantidades de gaseosa y cerveza; dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, pues tendrá un mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pilar is 53 years old, single, and has no children under her responsibility. She lives with her family in a rural area in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province, which in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is basically devoted to agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Pilar sells groceries, sodas, beer, and popsicles. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business, which is located in her home. Pilar is requesting a loan for working capital since she wants to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of sodas and beer. This investment will help to increase her sales since she will have a larger stock of products that will help her to meet the various needs, requirements, and tastes of her local customers. In the short term, she hopes to generate more income and improve her earnings so that her quality of life gets better.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of soda and beer.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 48 years old and single. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

Flordeliza has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items such as snack foods, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as snack foods, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en:
Margeret  is married and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past four years, Margeret has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Margeret wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zuma Group

texts.en:
Said, aged in his early 40s, is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young. He has been running a grocery store for four years now.  He works from 11 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Said's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania all of which he has successfully repaid.  He used the previous loans to buy drinks, a fridge, and chairs and tables for his grocery store.  Said used the profit to pay school fees and rent and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy chairs and more drinks for the grocery store.  He dreams of opening a tailoring business.

Said will share this loan with his loan group "Zuma" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and more drinks for his grocery store.

loans.name: Zevar

texts.en:
Zevar is 31 years old, and married. She has two children, and she lives in a small village the south of Tajikistan. Zevar has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and wheat. She sells this harvest in the zone where she lives, and that is how she makes an income to provide for the family. 

She has previously requested several loans from the institution to take care of the crops. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 7,000 TJS to buy fertilizers, fuel and seeds to grow autumn season wheat.  Her plan is to continue increasing the production, to generate more household income.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds to grow wheat.

loans.name: Faosta

texts.en:
Faosta is a married woman and has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Faosta has operated a rabbit selling business for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses, as a challenge in the business. Faosta dreams of becoming a wholesaler of rabbits in the future.  With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 20 more rabbits and their feed for the continuity of the business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 more rabbits and their feed for her business.

loans.name: Álvaro Wilfredo

texts.es:
Álvaro de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por la situación económica y la falta de motivación de su parte no pudo seguir estudiando, se acompañó a la edad de los 20 años, su pareja trabaja con la mamá de él habiendo pupusas, con lo que gana también la ayuda a los gastos del hogar. Junto a ellos viven los papas de Álvaro, quienes también tienen negocio de pupusas.  
 
Anteriormente Álvaro  trabajaba de vendedor de pan, pero al aparecerle otra oportunidad de trabajo se decidió por una nueva fuente de ingreso, hoy se dedica a trabajar manejando una mototaxi, con estos ingresos le da el sustento a su familia y le apoya a sus padres económicamente con lo que está a su alcance,  ya tiene 6 meses de trabajar en su nuevo empleo, por lo que ya se a ganado la confianza de su patrón. 

El trabajo no le costó mucho ya que en su trabajo anterior ya lo conocía mucha gente, la que hoy también es su clientela. La distancia que recorre todos los días hacia donde le entregan la mototaxi es de unos 500 metros, el recorrido lo hace a pie.   

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos terneros para repasto, ya que sus padres tienen terrenos que no sestan siendo utilizados y que para sacarle provecho a decidido hacer la inversión, la mejora que el préstamo hará es el poder invertir en algo que lo puede recuperar cuando lo necesite. La necesidad que satisfacera es el poder estrenarse como administrador de ganado y con esto poder tener un ingreso extra.

Desea contar siempre con su trabajo, cuidarlo para poder sacar a delante su familia, espera darle estudio a su hijo hasta donde sea posible.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 24, studied up to sixth grade.  He couldn't keep on attending school because of his economic situation and lack of motivation.  He got married when he was 20.  His wife works with his mother making pupusas [stuffed tortillas]; she also helps with the household expenses with her earnings.  They live with Álvaro's parents, who also have a pupusa business.

Álvaro used to work selling bread, but he opted for another source of income when a different job opportunity came up.  Now he drives a motorcycle taxi.  With this income, he supports his family and helps his parents financially as much as he can.  He has been in his new job for six months and has earned the trust of his boss.

The job didn't take a lot of effort because in his previous job he already knew a lot of people, who are also his customers now.  Every day he walks about 500 meters to where he gets the motorcycle taxi.

The loan he's requesting is to buy two grazing calves.  His parents have land that isn't being used and, to make the most of it, he decided to make the investment.  

The improvement from the loan will be being able to invest in something he can recover when necessary.  The need this will satisfy is being able to get started as a livestock manager so he can earn additional income.

He wants to always have his job and take care of it so he can get his family ahead.  He hopes to give his son an education to the extent possible.

loans.use: to buy two grazing calves

loans.name: Aish's Group

texts.en:
Aish's group comprises two hard-working women. Aish is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her retail clothing shop. 

To help expand her business, Aish has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help her to to generate greater profits and to pay employees. Aish hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Aish is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather,  insoles  , glue, thread, etc., for making shoes

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Agness, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four children, two boys and two girls.  Two of them are still at school, while the other two are grown ups.  She has been running several projects: a mamalishe project and a genge business since 2000.  She works from 05 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Agness's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy fruits and vegetables and opened her new project of mamalishe.  She has paid all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients and restock the out of stock items in the genge shop. She dreams of growing her business and living a happy life.

Agness will share this loan with her loan group, "UNUNIO", which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and restock the out of stock items in the genge shop.

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 36 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hermelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Hermelina has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Hermelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jhon Jamer

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor de 20 años dedicado a la barbería, todo lo que se puede apreciar en la foto lo compro gracias a su ahorros, aprendió del negocio viendo y practicando luego de un tiempo se certificó para poder iniciar su negocio. 
Jhon en verdad es un joven que vale la pena ayudar da casi todos los recursos para su hogar, apoya a su hermanos y sigue creyendo que apenas es el primer paso de muchos no se conforma con lo que tiene pues quiere tiene varias barberías que trabajan para él. 
Solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una aire acondicionado pues en su sector de apartado hace demasiado claro y sera muy ameno el ambiente, también comprara una vitrina,  y una puerta y la mano de obra pues realiza adecuaciones, ese local lo construyo con su propio dinero que recogía poco a poco y lo tiene cerca a su casa pues no olvida su papel de hermano mayo y cuida de los suyos.
La persona que se puede observar en la foto es uno de su hermanos.
texts.en:
Jhon is an enterprising young man of 20 years of age who works as a barber. Everything that can be seen in this photo, he bought it thanks to his savings. He learned the business watching and practicing and after some time he got certified to be able to start his own business. 

Jhon is truly a young man who is worthy of help. He provides almost all of the resources for his home, he supports his siblings, and he continues believing that this is just the first step of many. He is not content with what he has, so he wants to have several barbershops that work for him. 

He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of an air conditioner since in his isolated sector it is too hot and the environment will be enjoyable. He also wants to purchase a display cabinet, a door, and the labor costs so he can make modifications. He built this shop with his own money that he collected little by little and he has it near his house. He does not forget his role as older brother and he takes care of his own. 

The person observed in the photo is one of his brothers.

loans.use: to buy a door, a display cabinet, air conditioning, and pay labor costs. This young 20-year-old man takes charge of his home.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, de 42 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida tener un negocio propio y sostenible para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de sus hijos.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Alba, 42 years old, is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to have her own profitable business in order to get ahead and have a better life.   She works selling varied merchandise, including clothing, accessories such as billfolds, cosmetics and other things.

She started this work eager to find all the resources necessary to support herself and her children.  Alba is an enterprising woman, and very disciplined.  She is asking for a loan to buy a  large suppy of merchandise and thus have inventory available to sell to her customers.  Alba hopes to be able to progress as an entrepreneur and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of merchandise such as clothing and accessories in order to have inventory available for her customers

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre ambicioso y soñador que se ve en el futuro como el mayor vendedor de pollos y gallinas del sector por eso trabaja 12-14 horas en su granja de pollos diariamente para lograr este objetivo. 
Vive con su pareja y dice solo querer tener hijos hasta acercarse a sus sueños quiere traer al mundo bebes que crezcan en una buena familia donde no les falte alimentación y no tengan que dejar el estudio por conseguir un bocado de comida. 
Carlos en su afán de mejorar y ser mejor empresario quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en las mejoras a su criadero de pollos, y construir otro para abarcar más aves y seguir progresando y paso a paso acercarse a su sueño de ser el mejor comerciante de pollos y gallinas del sector.
texts.en:
Carlos is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of poultry in his area.  He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream.
Carlos lives with his wife and says that they only want to have children when they are sure that they can raise them without worry of where their next meal will come from or forcing them to leave school because they can't provide for them.
Carlos is applying for a loan that he will use to make improvements to his chicken coop and to build a second one so that he can grow his business.  The investment will allow him to expand, step by step, and continue on his way to becoming the leading supplier of poultry here.

loans.use: to improve his chicken coop and grow his poultry business.

loans.name: Melsida

texts.en:
Melsida and her 41-year-old husband and her two daughters live in Ararat town, Ararat region. For four years already, Melsida has been running a small store where she trades in a different assortment of phone accessories and stationery products. 

She says that during these four years of having this trading business, she has managed to have her regular customers. Thanks to them, she manages to keep her business going, which is the main source of income for her family. 

Now Melsida is asking for a loan of USD 3,000 in order to buy new stock of phone accessories and stationery products for her trading business. 

As this is Melsida's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of phone accessories and stationery products.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.en: Evaristo is an organic certified, Maya Mountain cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. He believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop, that is both good for the environment, and will help develop his local community. Evaristo is a farmer  who produces numerous types of cash crop for home and cash sale. Evaristo is requesting for another loan so he could continue hiring assistance in properly cleaning his cacao farm. He see a major impact in  his farm with assistance given.The revenue generated from his productive trees assist him in sending his children to school paying back his loan and income for the entire family.

loans.use: To clean 4,500 cacao trees

loans.name: Sochea Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Prey Veng province, Sochea is 57 years old and a mother of one child. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she is an agricultural officer. 

This is Sochea's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizers for growing cucumber and watermelon in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes that she can expand and make her business bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers for growing cucumber and watermelon

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Noong Het 4 Group

texts.en:
Tuoi is a young Thai lady of 23 years, who is married with one daughter, 3 years old. She currently lives in a new house with her husband, her child and her in-laws. Because her parents-in-law are at advanced age, while her child is too small, Tuoi and her husband have to work hard to provide for the whole family. Like many other households in the village, they rely mainly on agricultural activities, in which cultivating rice is the most important production. However, rice cultivation cannot help to cover all living expenses of Tuoi's family. For that reason, she has diversified her business into planting vegetables and raising chickens and pigs, while her husband works extra for local construction employers. 

This is the third time Tuoi has taken a loan from Anh Chi Em Program, and this time she will use the loan to buy small fish. Tuoi said that she felt the program's services were very helpful, because she not only received loan for her investment, but also training to make the investment become efficient. Despite plenty of difficulties ahead, Tuoi is very determined about her investment in fish farming. She dreams a better future will come to her daughter, that the girl will grow up in an abundant life, and study well and have a good job. 
In the picture, Tuoi stands first from the right and wears a vertical striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy small fish for her fish farming business.

loans.name: Giovana Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Giovana Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Giovana Carmen sells food for a living. She makes various dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and sauteed meats. She works from 8am to 6pm.

She has been in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

She is requesting this loan to purchase cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to making the repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Irma Giorgina

texts.es:
La socia Irma Giorgina  se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos y negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,chompas y blusas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma Giorgina earns a living with her business selling shoes as well as a business selling clothes. She sells pants, sweaters and blouses. Through her business's she wants to get ahead. her dream is to expand the shoe selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes.

Irma Giorgina is happy about the loan and promises to make all of payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a 61-year-old, married man and a father of four grown children. He is from Dulag, Leyte. He engages in fishing. Rolando has been fishing for more than 10 years now. Aside from fishing, he also raises and sells hogs. Rolando is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing net and additional pigs and pig feed. These will help Rolando increase his daily catch, and eventually sell more pigs in the coming months. Rolando hopes to expand both of his businesses and to make them successful for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional Avon products to sell to her customers for her direct selling Avon products business.

Marilou has been in this business for 23 years. She earns more income from selling ready to wear.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon products

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 5 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  

Rosalba sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a married woman. She is very hardworking and very responsible. She worked with her family in different businesses and acquired experience in sales. Five years ago, she opened a general store to work independently and works from 7:00 a.m. till 10:00 p.m.  

Rosalba dreams of having a supermarket in the future. That is why with the loan she has asked for she wants to acquire a variety of products wholesale, such as vegetables, grains, fruit, produce, etc., so that she can offer her customers items of excellent quality. 

With this business she has been able to get ahead little by little and has tried to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a selection of groceries, grains, produce and more.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad. 

Rosa es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que es viuda desde hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal y cuando su esposo murió le tocó incrementar sus ventas para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y para lograrlo le tocó trabajar muy fuerte y luchar durante muchos días fuertemente. 

Actualmente Rosa tiene unos grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como cremas, lociones, desodorantes, entre otros, y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has managed to get her son ahead, offering him a quality education.

Rosa is a single mother, head of the household, due to being a widow for a while and this has made her economic situation very difficult, but with her business she has had great strength and has been able to get ahead.

A long time ago, she began to sell personal care products and, when her husband died, she had to increase her sales to be able to pay all of the household expenses, and to be manage that, she had to work very hard and struggle a lot for many days. 

Currently, Rosa has some large orders from her customers and due to not having a lot of capital, she is asking for a loan to purchase personal use products such as creams, lotions, deodorants, among others, and fill the large orders that her customers have. 

Her biggest dream is to get ahead with her business and from there to be able to offer her child a good quality of life and better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of creams, lotions, deodorants, among others to stock her small business.

loans.name: Oeun Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Prey Veng province, Oeun is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. 

She grows rice as her single source of income. This is Oeun's first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy chickens to raise and chicken feed for her new business. She hopes that she can better improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed for her new business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sreythor Group

texts.en:
Sreythor is a young woman living in Kampong Cham province.  Sreythor is 23 years old and a mother of one child. 

To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of income.  She grows cucumber to supplement her income. For Sreythor, this is her first loan with VisionFund. 

A group of two members, she is a group leader. She will use her loan to buy cucumber and watermelon seed and to pay for plowing fees to support her new business. She hopes that she can make her business better than it was before.

loans.use: To buy cucumber and watermelon seed and to pay for plowing fees to support her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Na Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Na is 44 years old and a mother of two children; one is in school and one is too young. 

To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. Moreover, she can make more income via fish and mouse catching. She can earn an income of about 37,100 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. 

For Na, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy chicken to raise and chicken feed to run her new business. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy chicken and feed to run her new business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina, 47, is married and has seven children. Her husband runs a machine shop in Lahore. He has to work day and night to make sure that all their family expenses are met. As they have a big family, it is very difficult for him to make the ends meet.

He wishes to buy cast iron to manufacture iron accessories, for which he needs financing. Rubina, in order to help her husband, has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. They are thankful to BRAC and Kiva for their timely support.

loans.use: to buy cast iron for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
The Baloon Bay Group from the Teshie district of the city of Accra consists of four women who know each other well and live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 38 years old and have at least two children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items such as second-hand clothing, rice, cooking oil, fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, wigs, and medicine. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the ID-Ghana loan program. They are on their third loan cycle.

Gifty, standing on the far left in the photo, sells second-hand clothing, cooking oil, and rice. She intends to use her loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothing, cooking oil, and rice to sell to her customers. She will buy from the market and sell in Teshie to her customers.

In addition to repaying the loans, the Baloon Bay Group will use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of second-hand clothing, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Mon Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Prey Veng province, Mon is 49 years old and a mother of two children.  She currently earns income to support her family via rice cropping. 

This is the first cycle for Mon with VisionFund. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy piglets and feed to run new business. She hopes that she can expand on her existing business and that she can improve her family's condition.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed to run new business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Wilber Jhonatan

texts.es: Wilber tiene 21 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar. Wilber se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos como: ropa, golosinas, bebidas, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y apoya con la economía del hogar. Wilber solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, para la construcción del muro.
texts.en: Wilber is 21 years old and lives with his family. Wilber sells a variety of products for a living, such as: clothes, sweets, drinks, etc. Thus, this is how he makes a living and supports the household expenses. Wilbur is requesting this FUSAI loan to invest in building a wall for which he needs to buy materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, and iron, in order to build the wall.

loans.use: to buy materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, and iron, in order to build a wall.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children in the village Geghakert in Armavir region. Since getting married, Lida has engaged in farming with her husband. On her farm Lida organizes cultivation of haricot, potatoes, cucumbers and greens. She sells the gathered harvest in local markets. She has some income from her nice fruit garden as well, which gives a perfect harvest of strawberries. 

Lida is now asking for this loan of USD 3,000 in order to purchase potato seeds, wire and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.  As this is Lida's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, wire and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take a further loan to buy a variety of different foods to make better dishes to sell from her stall. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different foods to make better dishes to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 31 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo etc.

Maricel has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take a further loan to buy many kinds of noodles and other food to sell from her stall. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of noodles and food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Rosa Urbana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  16 y 14 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio local.
Doña Rosa como varias personas del cantón se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, tortas y varios bocadillos para fiesta, ella prepara sus dulces para clientes particulares que le piden para todos sus compromisos sociales o para llevarlos a vender a otras ciudades, ella por lo general los  fines de semana tiene estos contratos, lleva más de 16 años dedicada a esta labor la misma que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para  comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos dulces. Lleva 17 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “San Cristóbal” communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and breeding animals as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 41 years old and married. From her marriage, she has two children, who are 16 and 14 years old. They are both in high school. Her husband works at the local council.

Like several people in the canton, Rosa makes a living by making sweet pastries, cakes and various sandwiches for parties. She makes her sweets for particular clients who order them for all their social engagements, and for selling in other cities. She generally has these engagements during the weekend. She has been doing this work for more than 16 years. She began her business with the first loan she received from the communal bank.

This loan is for buying supplies for making her delicious sweet pastries. She has been part of the communal bank for 17 years and she likes it because the loans are at very low interest rates. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in ceramic tableware and home decor. He would like to purchase raw materials, including terra cotta, paints and lacquer. Roberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story "I love being an artisan! When you've been trained in this craft, it's difficult to leave it – I tell people this work is my vice. Ceramics are crafted by hand and not just anyone can do it well. When we started up, we didn't have money to buy a potter's wheel, so we made our own with material we had available in our houses. We brought boards and rulers and such. I got a door that wasn't in use, took it apart and brought it to the workshop. Even today, we continue using that wheel for our work. "I was thrilled when I learned about the opportunity to receive this microcredit. This will allow me to invest in the raw materials I need to be able to prepare for the upcoming holiday season. Many thanks!" Use the link below to view Roberto's ceramic tableware and home decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7564

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his ceramic tableware and home décor business

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor  Hugo vive en el municipio de Colomi Cochabamba,  junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Hugo es agricultor, cuenta con un terreno agrícola de dos hectáreas, trabaja en la producción de papa, papaliza, haba para la venta por cargas en el mercado de Colomi, ahora necesita un credito para la compra de abono orgánico gallinaza (2 camiones), semilla de papa y productos agroquimicos es muy necesaria la compra de estos insumos porque sin ellos no podría realizar la siembra, ya que actualmente es la epoca para sembrar y cosechar estos productos para su posterior venta, con ello lograra generar ingresos económicos para la familia.
texts.en:
Hugo lives in the municipality of Colomi Cochabamba together with his wife and three children.  He is a farmer and has two hectares of fields on which he grows potatoes, ulluku (a root vegetable similar to potato), and beans for sale in the Colomi market.

He is currently requesting a loan so he can buy two truckloads of organic hen manure, potato seeds, and agricultural chemicals. The purchase of these items is very important because without them he would not be able to plant his crops. Now is the time to plant and harvest these products for subsequent sale. This will allow him to generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost manure (2 truckloads), potato seeds and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora  Ángela tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos tiene  casa propia y vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras se dedica desde hace  20  años a la ganadería.
Doña Ángela es una persona muy amable y responsable y su negocio es su mayor fuente de ingresos, necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos y poder surtir más su negocio.
Doña Ángela con el préstamo espera tener su pequeña granja uno de sus sueños es que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de la zona.

Trojes, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Angela is 45 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house. She lives in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras and has been raising livestock for some 20 years. 

Angela is a very friendly and responsible person, and this business is her principal source of income. She needs this loan to buy pigs and better equip her business. 

Angela hopes this loan will allow her to fill out her little farm. One of her dreams is that her business will be one of the best known in her area.

Trojes, Honduras -  September 2014.

loans.use: to buy pigs to better stock her business.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña María con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante sola  se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, tiene un corral donde alimenta sus animalitos, los mismos que compra cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a otras ciudades para faenarlos y vender su carne, de esta forma ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido con frecuencia no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos y pollos. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “San Cristóbal” communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and by breeding animals as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

María lives in this place. She is 58 years old and married. From her marriage, she has seven grown-up and independent children. Her husband makes a living from agriculture.

María, with the goal of earning some money and getting ahead in life, raises pigs and chickens. She has a pen where she feeds her little animals. She buys them when they are little; keeps them for a while; and, when they are ready, sells them to traders who come to her house to take them to other cities in order to slaughter them and sell their meat. In this way, she earns some money to help her and her husband to get ahead in life since her husband is frequently out of work.

This loan is for buying animal feed and medicine for the pigs and chickens. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans always help her to get ahead in life. Her dream is for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es propietario de una chatarrería ubicada al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos de 18 a 27 años de edad. Hierro, cobre, acero, aluminio, bronce y chatarras, son los productos con los cuales interactua diariamente Gustavo comprando diariamente y vendiendo a depósitos de reciclaje,  para poder generar ingresos y beneficiar a su familia. Sus ventas las realiza de contado al por mayor dos veces por semana, mientras espera comprar diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin parar. En la actualidad tiene metas de fortalecimiento de su chatarreria y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará Hierro, cobre, acero, aluminio, bronce y chatarras, además de que emprenderá una nueva opción de negocios, que es el montaje de un almacén de residuos de motocicletas. Su credikiva mejorará su negocio, porque incrementará su capital de trabajo, dándole a Gustavo la oportunidad de invertir mucho mas y lograr así el incremento en sus ventas, que por consiguiente impacta las  utilidades del negocio, que corresponde con el aumento de su bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Gustavo owns a scrapyard located to the south of the city, where he lives with his wife. He has three children, ranging in age from 18 to 27. Iron, copper, steel, aluminium, bronze and scraps are the products Gustavo works with every day. He buys them every day and sells them to recycling plants in order to generate income and support his family. He sells his products wholesale for cash twice a week, and he buys the products every day non-stop from 8:00am to 6:00pm. At the moment, his goal is to strengthen his scrapyard business, which is why he is applying for a Kiva loan. He will use it to buy iron, copper, steel, aluminium, bronze, and scrap metal, and he will also start up a new business option, which is setting up a warehouse for motorcycle scraps. His Kiva loan will improve his business as it will increase his working capital, giving Gustavo the opportunity to invest a lot more and thereby achieve an increase in sales. This will have an impact on the profits of the business, which will mean an increase in his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy iron, copper, steel, aluminium, bronze, scrap metal, and motorcycle scraps

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh would like to take a further loan to buy a larger quantity of oil-fired wood to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil-fired wood to sell.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu would like to take out a further loan to purchase better quality chicken and rice at competitive prices to sell from her stall. Hieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality chicken and rice.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to purchase soft drinks to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen, es una joven humilde y sencilla, aun no tiene dependientes a su cargo, solo alcanzo a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, vive junto a su madre, ambas trabajan de forma sacrificada, su casa es de construcción rustica. Carmen se dedica a la producción agrícola y también compra y vende ganados bovinos, entre los productos que más cultiva están la papa y arveja. Trabaja en terrenos de su propiedad y de su madre, ella aun es joven y recién va acumulando bienes y patrimonio. Carmen vive en Tiraque Cochabamba, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que día a día trabaja para tener una mejor vida y para poder seguir adelante, pero se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de ganados medianos y pago de abono orgánico gallinaza, para así generar ingresos económicos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a young, humble and simple person who does not yet have any dependents to care for. She lives with her mother in a crudely constructed home in Tiraque Cochabamba and only has a primary school education. They both work selflessly.

Carmen is a farmer and also buys and sells bovine livestock. She mostly grows potatoes and peas on land that is owned by her and her mother. Carmen is still young and has recently begun accumulating assets and property. She is a responsible and hard-working person who works each day to have a better life and to get ahead. But she needs to ask for a loan so she can buy mid-size livestock and organic hen manure to generate more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medium-size livestock and organic hen manure.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y papaliza como sus principales productos agrícolas en parte de su terreno propio con una extensión de 2 hectáreas. Produce con rotación de cultivos como la avena forrajera y cevada para el consumo de su ganado vacuno, tiene una experiencia y antiguedad de 16 años en  la actividad agrícola, también cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno(2 lecheras y 1 yunta). La señora Flora requiere el crédito para la compra de 1 hectárea de terreno agrícola en el mismo lugar para incrementar su producción y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flora lives and works in Colomi. She is economically independent, hardworking and responsible. She makes a living in agriculture, sowing potatoes and papaliza [a root vegetable] as the principal agricultural products on part of her 2 hectares of land. She rotates crops such as oats and barley for cattle fodder. She has 16 years of experience in agriculture, and also has three heads of cattle (2 dairy cows and 1 ox).

Flora requires a loan for the purchase of 1 hectare of agricultural land in the same location to increase her production and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a hectare of agricultural land

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Hoi is requesting a new loan to buy new products such as food and beverages to better satisfy her customers. Hoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new products such as food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Zenny

texts.en:
Zenny is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Zenny has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Zenny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store. Ha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor  Domingo tiene 55 años de edad , vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace ya 25 años y vive con su esposa  tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de él.
Don Domingo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar  debido a que en la comunidad donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica  y con esta inversión espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia y a su vez contribuir a la protección del medio ambiente.
Su sueño es tener la luz en su hogar.  

Trojes, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Domingo is 55 years old and lives in the community of Trojes in the eastern part of Honduras.  He lives with his wife and three dependent children. Domingo has been a farmer and raised livestock for 25 years.

Domingo is asking for a loan so he can buy a solar power plant because there is no electric service in the community where he lives. With this investment he hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his family while at the same time doing his part to protect the environment. His dream is to have electricity in his house.  Trojes, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar power plant for his home.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El señor Samuel tiene 38 años de edad vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras,  se dedica al comercio y también a la ganadería desde hace ya 10 años, vive con su esposa y es padre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen de él.
Don Samuel está solicitando el préstamo para compra de una planta solar para poder tener luz en su casa y poder también de esta forma contribuir a la protección del medio ambiente y  gracias a esto mejorar su estilo de vida y la de su familia. 

Trojes, Honduras- Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old and lives in the community of Trojes in the eastern part of Honduras.  He has worked in business and also in livestock for ten years. He lives with his wife and is the father of two dependent children.

Samuel is asking for this loan so he can buy a solar power plant to have electricity in his house and at the same time do his part to protect the environment. This will allow him to improve his lifestyle and that of his family.  Trojes, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy a solar power plant for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electrical appliance such as a radio.

loans.name: Gamanfel

texts.es:
Gamanfel tiene 65 años de edad, es viudo, no tiene hijos dependiente. Él vive con su hijo el cual es independiente vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca. Gamanfel vive en el caserío Las Juntas, el cual es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.
