Gamanfel se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde ofrece la venta de arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros y está ubicada en su domicilio y un pequeño bar el cual funciona en su propio domicilio, el cual está ubicado en el centro de dicho distrito. Su negocio es estable, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, u él cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de mercadería (una mayor cantidad de azñucar, arroz, entre otros). Gamanfel desea préstamo para invirtirlo en su negocio ya que desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gamanfel, age 65, is a widower with no dependent children.  He lives with his son, who is independent, in the Pomahuaca district.  Gamanfel lives in the Las Juntas settlement.  It is a small settlement that hopes to excel.  The main business activities there are agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  The settlement is located in the Pomahuaca district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Gamanfel works in commerce.  He has a small store where he sells rice, sugar, and cooking oil, among other items.  The store is located in his house.  He also has a small bar at his house.  It is located in the center of said district.

His business is stable.  He has over ten years of experience in the business.  He has very good personal and work references from his neighbors.  Because of his good service and experience, he has plenty of customers in the area.

The loan is to invest in the business by purchasing merchandise (a greater quantity of sugar and rice, among others).  Gamanfel wishes to have a loan to invest in his business.  He wishes to increase and diversify his stock of products and to be able to get an acceptable profit in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sugar and rice, among others.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es:
Nolberto tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a sus 03 hijos los cuales son independientes económicamente y por el contrario aportan a la economía del hogar. El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el Caserío Minas, aproximadamente a 2 horas del distrito de Pucara en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Nolberto es el cultivo de café variedad catimor en el caserío de Minas; en el cual tiene 15 años de experiencia es esta actividad . El préstamo lo utilizara para capital de trabajo: pues desea realizar la compra de fertilizantes, deshierbo, pago de jornales, esta actividad lo ayudará a tener mayor producción para la campaña próxima y así tener mayor liquidez para a desarrollar la actividad mencionada.
texts.en:
Nolberto is 59 years old,  married and lives in his own crudely constructed house with his three children.  They are financially independent and contribute to the family's finances. The family's home is located in the hamlet of Minas, approximately two hours from Pucara in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca. The community where Nolberto lives is a small, rural area where everyone knows each other and most of the people work in agriculture, livestock, or business.

Nolberto is a coffee-grower in the hamlet of Minas and the variety he grows is Catimor. He has 15 years of experience. The loan he is seeking will be used for working capital as he needs to buy fertilizers and weed killer, and to pay for day laborers. This will help him to increase his production in the next growing season and thus have more liquidity to develop his coffee production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weedkillers, and to pay for day laborers.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es: La señora Miguelina vive en entre ríos, Cochabamba al igual que muchos de los habitantes de la zona ella migro de Capinota buscando un mejor futuro y por ello desde entonces trabajo de todo lo que pudo, como empleada, ayudante y otras labores en las cuales se desempeñó muy bien, con el paso del tiempo conoció a la persona quien el día de hoy es su concubino con el cual uniendo esfuerzos empezaron a ahorrar dinero y compraron su propio lote agrícola donde actualmente trabaja dedicándose a la producción agrícola, esta actividad demanda cada vez más esfuerzo porque los suelos se desgastaron con el paso del tiempo, ahora solicita un crédito  para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña con ello lograra mejorar los rendimientos de su cultivo y a la vez sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguelina lives between rivers in Cochabamba.  Like many other inhabitants of the area she moved to Capinota looking for a better future.  Thus she works at whatever she can such as maid, helper, and other laboring jobs in which her service has gone well.  With the passage of time she met the person whom today is her common-law-partner and with whom she has united forces and started to save money to buy their own agricultural lot where they are now working dedicated to farming.  This activity demands more and more effort because the soils become infertile with the passage of time.  She is asking for a loan for the maintenance of her pineapple crop, and to increase yields and their incomes.   

La señora Miguelina vive en entre ríos, Cochabamba al igual que muchos de los habitantes de la zona ella migro de Capinota buscando un mejor futuro y por ello desde entonces trabajo de todo lo que pudo, como empleada, ayudante y otras labores en las cuales se desempeñó muy bien, con el paso del tiempo conoció a la persona quien el día de hoy es su concubino con el cual uniendo esfuerzos empezaron a ahorrar dinero y compraron su propio lote agrícola donde actualmente trabaja dedicándose a la producción agrícola, esta actividad demanda cada vez más esfuerzo porque los suelos se desgastaron con el paso del tiempo, ahora solicita un crédito  para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña con ello lograra mejorar los rendimientos de su cultivo y a la vez sus ingresos.

loans.use: to maintain her pineapple farm

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is requesting a new loan to upgrade the floor of her house, which is in need of repair. Dao's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade the floor of her house.

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Rebbeca operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. In addition, she sells food in her cafe to supplement her income. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Rebbeca dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra una mujer con gran sentido por la estética y la belleza que se dedica a realizar cortes y cepillados impactantes y muy del gusto de sus empleados, se dedica a la profesión hace 8 años y en ese periodo de tiempo ha solicitado 3 creditos con los que ha podido crecer y mejorar su negocio. 
Su mayor sueño es poder comprar el local comercial y desde hace poco tiempo ha comenzado el ahorro para lograr este sueño. 
Sandra siempre asiste a constantes capacitaciones e inducciones para estar al día con todo lo que tiene que ver en el mundo de la belleza y ahora se ve en la necesidad de modernizar sus implementos con los que realiza los cortes pues han llegado nuevos que le dan mejor resultado y son menos perjudiciales para el cuidado capilar de sus clientes. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de implementos de belleza demostrando gran cuidado y sentido de pertenencia por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman with a great sense for aesthetics and beauty.  She does haircuts and blow-drys that are impressive and very much to the liking of her employees.  She has been working in this profession for eight years.  During this time she has requested three loans with which she has been able to grow and improve her business.

Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a commercial place.  A short time ago she started saving in order to realize this dream.

Sandra always attends trainings and orientations in order to be up to date with everything that has to do with the world of beauty.  She now sees the need to modernize the implements she uses for haircuts.  New ones have arrived, and they provide better results and are less detrimental to her customers’ hair.

She is requesting a loan to buy beauty implements, and this shows the great care and sense of responsibility she has for her customers.

loans.use: to buy new hair care implements.

loans.name: Faima's Group

texts.en:
Faima's group is comprised of hard working women. Faima is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Faima has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells bananas. 

To help expand her business, Faima has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of bananas, and will help Faima to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Faima hopes that in the future she will be able to by a plot of land. 

Faima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, combs, a dryer, and a flat iron.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married woman with children who still attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.

She has operated a Kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Vache

texts.en:
Vache is from Goris town. He is a student at Slavonic University of Armenia, and is currently in his first year of studies. Vache's parents work and live in Moscow city, and here in Armenia, Vache lives with his retired grandparents. 

Vache is now asking for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition. Currently, he faces some financial difficulties and it is very important for this young student to be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. Dung's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials.

loans.name: Hiep's Group

texts.en:
Hiep is 54 years old and lives with his four children and wife. Hiep has been running a food stall from the front of his house to earn an income to support his family. Hiep is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, he is in the center wearing a grey shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Hiep is requesting a loan to purchase better quality food and beverages to satisfy his customers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality food and beverages to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta works hard to support her family. Ernesta is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Ernesta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Ernesta has been in this business for six years now.

Ernesta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 55 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Dolores is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dolores has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She wants to provide them good quality education and food. Therefore, she started a business stitching clothes to support her husband financially. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of  50,000 PKR and intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine, more spools of thread, lace, and ribbons in different colors to increase revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 9th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, more spools of thread, lace, and ribbons in different colors to increase revenue.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and a mother. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Caroline is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en:
Chuc is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity of new food and beverage products to sell from her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. Chuc hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of new food and beverage products to sell from her store

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 18, 15, 11 y 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días pone todo de su esfuerzo por sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo en una empresa cercana. Salvador desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda como: compra de portón de hierro y construcción de gradas, pero no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, y un portón para construir gradas e instalar un portón en su vivienda.
texts.en: Salvador is 49 years old. He lives in his home with his wife and four children, ages 18, 15, 11, and 8. He is a man that puts all his effort into providing for his family every day, through his job at a nearby business. Salvador wants to make home improvements, such as: buying an iron gate and building stairs, but does not have the necessary cash flow. As such he is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron in order to build stairs and install a gate in his home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron in order to build stairs and install a gate in his home

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 47-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She has seven children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking to inflate her sales and earn more income to bear her household expenses efficiently. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking to inflate her sales and earn more income to bear her household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 56-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa has run a food stall in front of her house for the past six years. She sells sandwiches and breads with pork bologna and sausage. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a motorcycle to go and come back from market and good quality food to sell. 

She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to go and come back from market and good quality food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, rebar, corrugated tin, and labor in order to construct the walls and change the roof of her residence.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Héctor de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hija de 17 años de edad y un sobrino. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para dar lo mejor de sí prestando sus servicios como motorista, además su compañera de vida lo apoya con la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo. Héctor tiene el deseo de construir un muro perimetral con enrejado en los alrededores de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro, y mano de obra para construir un muro con enrejado alrededor de su vivienda y así darle un poco más de seguridad a la misma.
texts.en: Héctor, 42 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner, their 17-year-old daughter, and a nephew. He is a man who strives everyday to give his best to provide services as a driver. His life partner supports the family’s economy through her work. Héctor has the desire to built a wall with a lattice-work gate around his home. He is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, steel, and labor to build a wall with a lattice gate around his home to give a bit more security to it.

loans.use: to build a secure wall around his home

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima's group is comprised of  hard working women. Fatima is 19 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Fatima has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells bread. 

To help expand her business, Fatima has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wheat to make bread, and will help Fatima to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Fatima hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Fatima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more wheat to make bread

loans.name: Yvonna

texts.en:
Yvonna is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Yvonna is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Yvonna has been in pig fattening for nine years and also earns additional income from selling mangoes.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is 42 years old and she lives with her three children in the village Aygut of Gegharquniq region. Aneta runs her farm. In her farm she takes care of two cows, a calf, two piglets, five sheep and ten chickens. The main farm product that she sells from her farm is milk, and sometimes also meat and eggs.

Aneta will be greatly happy to have this loan from Kiva which she plans to use on the renovation of the greenhouse and also purchase some grass to feed the livestock.  She says that this will be her first loan and she hopes that it will bring with it more income and stability for her farm.

As this is Aneta's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase grass as a forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 41 years old and lives with her one child and husband. Her husband works as a worker for a coffee factory. 

For the past six years, Hoa has been running a business producing glass objects and being a agent for drinking water from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Hoa is the Group Leader of a six-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the second from the left wearing a violet t-shirt. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality of glass and glass-making tools to satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality of glass and glass-making tools

loans.name: Edgar Humberto

texts.es:
Edgar es un afortunado de la vida que se da el lujo de levantarse todos los días y admirar un paraíso terrenal que le mismo se encarga de cuidar y mantenerlo tan hermoso como se puede apreciar en la foto, es agricultor y cuidar de estos terrenos es lo que le da de comer a él y su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, y uno próximo a ingresar a estudios superiores. 
Edgar quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar un ternero y alternar sus actividades, tiene una gran deficiencia monetaria y por tal razón el dinero solicitado será para la compra del ternero.
Gracias a este crédito podrá tener más ingresos y darles a sus hijos más posibilidades para ser profesionales y parte de esta, ayuda a mantener la belleza y esplendor de ese lugar que él llama hogar
texts.en:
Edgar is a lucky person in life who has the luxury to get up every day and admire an earthly paradise which he has charged himself with taking care of and maintaining so beautiful, as you can appreciate from the photo.  He is a farmer and caring for these lands is what give things to eat to him and his family composed of his wife and three young children and one about to enter higher studies.
Edgar wants to request a loan in order to buy a calf and alternate his activities.  He has a big lack of money and for this reason the requested money will be for the purchase of the calf.
Thanks to this loan he will be able to have more income and give his children more possibilities to be professionals and besides this it will help to maintain the beauty and splendor of that place he calls home.

loans.use: to buy a calf in order to have a cash income which will help him offer education to his children.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Santa Rosa Urubamba.” This group is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the Department of Cusco.

One member is Dora. She’s single, 36 years of age, and has 2 children. She has a grocery store business and also sells trout. She sells products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil. Dora works from 8 am to 6 pm. Dora has already done this business for one year and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the grocery business. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The other members are in the businesses of selling food, selling clothing, a grocery store, and selling animals. Dora is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform [Kiva] and agrees to comply with the payment of her loan repayments by their deadlines.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Sujaa Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mambo est une Couturière depuis 10 ans, présidente, membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Sujaa» âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 1 est encore gamin. Elle est couturière et vendeuse des matériels de couture a son domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels de couture (ciseaux, rouleaux tissus, fil, etc.). Elle commença avec de fonds par le truchement de son mari. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Our client Mambo has been working as a seamstress for 10 years. She is the leader of the Sujaa business group. She is 44 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom study and one is still very young. She works as a seamstress and also sells sewing supplies out of her home. She is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to expand her business. This new loan will allow her to buy new sewing supplies (scissors, rolls of fabric, thread etc). She first launched her business with the financial support of her husband, who is unemployed at present. In the future she would like to provide for the education and food of her children. She thanks Hekima for the support it offers to women entrepreneurs by granting them loans without a collateral. It needs to be pointed out that one of the clients in the photo is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy new sewing supplies (scissors, rolls of fabric, thread etc).

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 49-year-old married woman. She has four children and she is motivated to give them a happy life by providing them good clothes, food, and education. 

To support her husband in bearing family expenses she started a business of a small general store. Her son also assists her in purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains, pulses, and juices to meet the increasing demands of her customer. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains, pulses, and juices to meet the increasing demands of her customer.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to far flung areas that will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 11 años de edad. Mercedes es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de medicamentos y a la vez es agricultor y gracias a su trabajo logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar el piso del patio de su vivienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: Mercedes is 56 years old and lives in his house with his wife and 11-year-old son. Mercedes is a hardworking man who makes a living selling medicine, while also a farmer. Through his work, he manages supporting his household. With the desire of improving the patio floor of his home, he is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in buying the necessary materials - cement, sand, and gravel - in order to cement the floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, and gravel in order to cement the patio floor of his home.

loans.name: Flora Imelda

texts.es: Flora de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 19 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que toda su vida se ha esforzado por salir adelante y apoyar a los suyos con la economía de su hogar apoyada en su negocio de venta de ropa, dicha venta la realiza desde hace 5 años en los alrededores del mercado municipal de forma ambulante. Flora sabe que su negocio es la mayor fuente de ingresos de su vivienda, por lo que desea invertir en él para obtener mejores ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisas, calcetines y ropa interior.
texts.en: Flora, 47, lives in her own home with her husband and her two daughters, aged 19 and 17 years. She is a woman who has struggled all her life to get by and support her household economy. She supports her household with her business selling clothing. She has done this work for 5 years, walking around the municipal market. Flora knows this business is the largest source of income for her home so she wants to invest in order to get better profits. She requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, socks, and undergarments.

loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, socks, and undergarments

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es: Manuel de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 9 años. Él es un hombre muy inteligente que se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante apoyado en su negocio de estructuras metálicas, el que realiza desde hace 3 años y que gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sostener. Manuel sabe que su negocio es su única fuente de ingreso por lo que desea invertir en materiales para ofrecer un mejor servicio, ya que podrá diseñar estructuras para vender, no solo por encargo, y es para eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, platina, barrilla, ángulos, electrodos, discos, etc.
texts.en: Manuel, 20, has lived in his own residence for nine years.  He is a very intelligent man who forces himself every day to get ahead supported by his business of metal structures, which he has been doing for three years and thanks to his effort he has managed to sustain.  Manuel knows that his business is his only source of income because of which he wishes to invest in materials to offer a better service, since he could design structures to sell, not just work under contract.  It is because of this that he requests a loan from FUNAI to invest in iron, platen, metal bars, angles, electrodes, disks, etc.

loans.use: to invest in iron, platen, metal bars, angles, electrodes, disks, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Elba

texts.es: Gloria de 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su nieta de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que siempre está buscando la posibilidad de ampliar su negocio de venta de flores artificiales y papelería, ya que su clientela es buena ella desea retribuir un poco su fidelidad introduciendo más y mejores productos a su negocio para que ellos tengan más variedad para escoger a la hora de comprar. Gloria en su deseo de ampliar su negocio y mejorar su oferta de productos ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el que piensa invertir en: flores, coronas, libros, papelería, etc. Para tener más y mejores productos que ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en: Gloria is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her 4 year old granddaughter. She is an enterprising woman who is always on the look-out for possibilities to expand her business selling artificial flowers and paper supplies. As her clientele is good she wants to repay their loyalty a bit by introducing more and better products  to her business. Then they will have more variety to choose from when it is time to buy. Gloria in her desire to expand her business and improve her offering of products has decided to request a loan from FUSAI. She is thinking of investing in flowers, wreaths, books, paper supplies, etc. so she has more and better products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy flowers, wreaths, books, paper supplies, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mirtala

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que viendo la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos económicos de su hogar desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, aunque en este negocio ha observado que al comprar el producto, y tener a la venta es mejor la ganancia, por lo que ella desea invertir en la compra de dichos productos. María no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria para invertir en los productos antes mencionados por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, champú, acondicionador de cabello, desodorantes, etc.
texts.en: María is 43 years old. She lives in her own home alongside her life partner and her 16-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who, seeing the need to improve her home's earnings, has worked to sell beauty products from a catalog for the past 6 years. In this business she has observed that, upon buying the product and selling it, her earnings are better. For this reason, she wants to invest in the products mentioned. She does not have the liquid assets necessary to invest in the products mentioned. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: creams, lotions, shampoo, conditioner, deodorants, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: creams, lotions, shampoo, conditioner, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Saluwa's Group

texts.en:
Saluwa's group is comprised of hard-working women. Saluwa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Saluwa has been working hard to manage her charcoal sale business. 

To help expand her business, Saluwa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal, and will help Saluwa to earn greater profits. Saluwa hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Saluwa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en:
Mutuku has a retail shop in Makueni town. He is 63 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 9 children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of maize flour, rice, sugar, detergents, milk, and cooking oil to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also service the loan.

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to expand his business, educate his children, and a have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will help increase her income, expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality clothes for resale

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María de 55 años de edad,  es una mujer emprendedora, madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales dos están con ella y uno se encuentra fuera del país, además de sus hijos su mamá vive con ella, ya que se encuentra mal de salud. 

María no tuvo estudios académicos, ya que menciona que sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar. Su hija menor se encuentra estudiando el tercer año de bachillerato en opción de secretariado.  

María hace ventas de antojitos dos veces por semana, menciona que de pequeña aprendió a hacer de todo tipo de antojitos (yuca frita, enchiladas, pasteles, tamales, atoles), y mucho más ya que su madre le enseñaba como hacerlos y luego decidió dedicarse al negocio para mantener a sus tres hijos y menciona que con lucha y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante   


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la reparación del techo de la cocina de su hogar,  ya que menciona que debido a las lluvias el techo se ha dañado y por lo cual se siente insegura dentro de su vivienda, ya que se le está metiendo el agua lluvia dentro de su vivienda.

María menciona que el sueño que tiene de momento es ver a su hija graduada de bachillerato, ya que de los tres hijos es la única que ha seguido estudiando, y dese que quiere que su hija siga sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She is an enterprising woman. She is a single mother with three children; two of them are with her, and one is currently outside the country. In addition to her children, María's mother lives with her, as she is in bad health.

María did not go to school, as her parents did not urge her to study. Her youngest daughter is now in the third year of a BA program to be a secretary. 

María sells snacks two times per week. She mentions that, as a child, she learned how to make all kinds of appetizers: fried yucca, enchiladas, cakes, tamales, atoles (a hot drink made of corn), and much more. Her mother showed her how to make them, and later she decided to work in this business to support her three children. She mentions that, with great effort, she has been able to move forward.

The loan she is asking for is to repair the roof of her home kitchen, as she has said that the rain has damaged it. Due to this, she feels insecure in her home, as water is getting into the house.

María says that her dream at this moment is to see her daughter graduate with her BA; of the three children, she is the only one who is still studying. She wants her daughter to continue her university studies.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home kitchen, as the rain has damaged it.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a happily married woman. Twenty years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Naseem is popularly known in her area for her stitching skill. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth. Naseem hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married to Linet, and blessed with two children ages four and three years old. He has been buying and selling goats and sheep for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

James will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is 37 years old and married. For the past ten years she has bought scrap such as iron, steel, metal and wire that she crushes and otherwise processes. She then sells these recycled goods to people in her community. In this way she contributes to the family’s income.

Shakila has taken out and repaid five previous loans through Kashf and is now receiving a sixth loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more scrap metal in different sizes. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal in different sizes

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sarah Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing and pig fattening. Sarah Jane is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle. 

Sarah Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 35 years old, married and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to stitch dresses on time. She wishes to save part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads and packs of zippers and buttons to stitch dresses

loans.name: Rubia Esperanza

texts.es: Rubia de 39 años de edad es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día para darle lo mejor a sus 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años de edad que habitan junto a ella en casa propia desde hace años motivo por el que se encuentra muy feliz y satisfecha. Rubia observando las carencias que tenía en su hogar decidió hace 3 años instalar en su vivienda, una tienda de productos básicos con la que ha logrado sostener la economía familiar y estar pendiente de sus hijos a los que también apoya con sus estudios y es por eso que ella desea mejorar su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias para seguir enviando a sus hijos a estudiar. Rubia sabe que para invertir en su negocio necesita una cantidad de dinero con el que no cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, pan dulce, café, bebidas frías, chocolate, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc. Sabiendo que con las ganancias de su negocio podrá pagar las cuotas de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Rubia is 39 years old. She is a woman who strives each day to give the best to her 3 children, ages 10, 8, and 3. They live with her in their own home of many years, something that makes them very happy and satisfied. Upon seeing the needs of her household, she decided to open a store with basic products in her home 3 years ago. With this store, she has been able to support her family economically; she is also present for her children, and helps them with their studies. For this reason, she wants to improve her business to obtain a better income in order to keep sending her children to school.

Rubia knows that, in order to invest in her business, she needs a quantity of money that she does not have. Therefore, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: candy, sweet bread, coffee, cold drinks, chocolate, sugar, rice, beans, etc. She knows that, with the earnings from her business, she will be able to pay the quotas of the loan.

loans.use: to invest in: candy, sweet bread, coffee, cold drinks, chocolate, sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 27 years old.  She is from a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri District.  She is married to Gopal. They are raising two children (one son and one daughter); one of them is in in grade four and the other is too small to go to school. They live in a semi-concrete house in Dhupguri.

Krishna's husband works in a tea stall. His income is so little that it can hardly cover the household expenses and at the same time the educational expenses of their child. So to help her husband, Krishna runs an animal husbandry business.  She started this business a few years back.  She now has two sheep on her farm.  She buys baby sheep and raises them until they are grown and then sells them in her neighborhood and in the market. This way she gives financial support to her family. She wants to increase the number of livestock and improve the family's living condition by generating more income.

So Krishna has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, who extends their helping hands to the needy rural woman to start a business.  She plans to purchase more sheep for her animal husbandry business.  She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business. The profit from her business will enable her to provide a better education to her children and a decent lifestyle to her family.

She dreams of upgrading their house to a concrete-made house in the future and so she is very much grateful to both of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar is a married woman. Her husband (shown in the photo) is a rickshaw driver by profession. Previously, she took a Kiva loan for her husband’s business improvement. He earns a good amount of income to manage their household expenses through his business. Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase new wheels along with some auto spare parts for her husband’s vehicle. With this loan investment, Kausar expects a boost in her husband’s earnings.

loans.use: to purchase new wheels along with some auto spare parts for her husband’s vehicle.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 45-year-old hardworking woman who has four children. Her work as a seamstress began five years ago when the family was facing a financial crisis. Her efforts helped avert this crisis, and she has been sewing ever since. Her work is admired, and over the years she has established a good clientele.

In this, her sixth loan cycle, Naseem is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf to buy a new sewing machine plus lace and some spools of thread. She is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will further support her efforts.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine plus lace and some spools of thread.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, nineteen, lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years she has been working hard managing her vegetable stall.

To help grow her business Sylivia has requested a 600,000 UGX loan through BRAC Uganda to buy tomatoes, cabbages, onions and green peppers. Greater quantities of produce will help her generate larger profits and enable her to cover essential needs for her family. Sylivia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop.

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce for her vegetable stall.

loans.name: David Alejandro

texts.es:
David es una persona muy linda que contar y es que para iniciar su empresa de venta de productos Herbalife primero fue cliente y llego a consumir estos productos por salud y gracias al extraordinario efecto que tuvieron se dedicó a la venta de estos y es tanto el amor y el cariño que tiene por la marca que se unió a un club donde realiza variedad de actividades y constantes exámenes para confirmar que pueden distribuir el producto.
Solicita un crédito para comprar productos de la marca Herbalife y no esperar a  realizar pedidos si no venderlos directamente y es que quiere que todas las personas acepten el reto de cambiar su hábito alimenticio ya que le harán un bien a su cuerpo y ese es su reto.
texts.en:
David is a very nice person who says that he wants to start his business selling Herbalife products. 

At first he was a customer who consumed these products for his health, and because of the extraordinary effect that they had, he began selling them.  He loved them so much that he joined a club in which they carry out various activities and tests to confirm that they can distribute the products.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase Herbalife products.  He does not expect to place orders, but to sell directly.  He wants everybody to accept the challenge of changing their dietary habits because they would be doing something good for their bodies. That is his challenge.

loans.use: to purchase Herbalife products.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a vigorous 46-year-old woman. She is married and has four children.

For the past six years Nasreen has been running a fabric business. She buys various textiles in different colors and designs at wholesale rates and then resells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn an adequate income through her business.

Nasreen has now applied for a 45,000 PKR loan to buy a wide variety of textiles in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and expects a boost in her earnings. She plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of textiles in different colors and designs

loans.name: Delmy Rosa Alba

texts.es: Delmy de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por 5 personas. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su grupo familiar por medio de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo el que realiza desde hace 20 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre solicitan sus productos. Delmy desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra bastante deteriorado, y es para  ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Delmy is 48 years old. She lives in her own house along with her family, which is made up of 5 people. She is a woman who works hard to provide for her family through her business selling beauty products from catalogs. She has been doing this for 20 year years, so she has a good number of clients that always request her products. Delmy wants to repair the roof on her house because it is quite deteriorated. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so she can buy: galvanized metal roofing sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last nine years. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, mehndi, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Farah is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed, so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Selima

texts.en:
Selima, 23 years, is a young rural lady. She lives with her husband, Tahidul, and one little daughter. They live in a small village, Altagram, Dhupguri, in the district Jalpaiguri.

Selima’s husband is a mason by profession. His income is very scanty and inconsistent. Thus, Selima struggles to manage her household expenses. 

Selima is a very enthusiastic and optimistic woman. Now Selima decided to start a milk-supply business to generate more income for her family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  

She plans to sell the cow milk from door to door to her neighbors. Milk has a good demand in their locality. This will allow her to generate a good income to take care of her family and meet the household expenses.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-supply business.

loans.name: Maria Milagro

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace 28 años por lo que se siente muy feliz por tener un lugar seguro donde vivir. Ella desde hace 14 años cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad y es gracias a ella que se gana la vida, por lo que desea invertir en su negocio para tener mejores ganancias. María sabe que para invertir en su negocio necesita una buena cantidad de dinero con la que no cuenta actualmente por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: huevos, leche, pan, granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas frías y calientes, etc. Para que su negocio pueda darle mejores ganancias.
texts.en: María, 49 years old, lives in a home that is humble but is her own property. She's lived there for 28 years and she is very happy to have a safe place to live. For the last 14 years, she's had a small store selling staple foods, and it's thanks to the store that María makes a living, so she wants to invest in her business in order to achieve better profits. María knows that investing in a business requires a good amount of money, which she currently doesn't have.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in eggs, milk, bread, grains, sweets, hot and cold drinks, etc. This is so her  business can give her improved proceeds.

loans.use: to invest in eggs, milk, bread, grains, sweets, hot and cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Margaret, 44 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Igoji, a remote village in Nkubu. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Nkubu area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en:
Suryia is a married woman and a mother of two children. The only source of earning in her family is from the rickshaw that her husband (shown in the picture) drives. This rickshaw helps them provide transportation service in their city to passengers. 

Suryia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown very good repayment behaviour. This loan amount will help Suryia's husband to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She hopes to earn a higher income in the future.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is 25 years old. She is from a small village, Altagram, in the district Jalpaiguri. She has completed her education up to grade 9.  She is married to Gauranga, aged 27 years. They are raising their two daughters together with love and care. One of their daughters attends school and reads in grade 2, and one is below school-going age. 

Shefali's husband is a farmer. He grows green vegetables in his own farmland and sells to his neighbors. The income from their agribusiness is not sufficient to provide them financial sustenance. So for additional income, Shefali runs an animal husbandry business. She sells milk in her neighborhood. To generate more income, she wants to purchase another cow, as she wants to sell milk products like ghee, curd, cheese, etc., along with milk to generate more income for her family. She has chosen this business as there is a great demand for milk and milk products in their area.

Thus Shefali has requested a loan to purchase one more cow. She dreams to invest the earnings from the business into further increasing her business and saving money for her daughters' future.

She gives thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling vegetables for the past 10 years along with her son who is also shown in the photo. She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, ginger, and garlic to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, gingers and garlic to meet market demands consistently.

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakina

texts.en: Ghulam Sakina, aged 49, deals in selling animals; she has been in this business for a period of about seven years. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her family of eight members. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them at higher prices while her husband sells them out in the market. Now she is requesting 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals including goats and cows for resale. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase more animals including goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 57-year-old woman. She has been in business of beauty parlor services for the past eight years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy cleansers, makeup kits, hair rollers, and hair care products to deal with more customers at a time. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy cleansers, makeup kits, hair rollers and hair care products to deal with more customers at a time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce and stucco the walls of her house.

loans.name: Kadidi

texts.en:
Kadidi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kadidi operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge with respect to the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Tulsi Rani

texts.en:
Tulsi is 58 years old, married and the mother of two sons. She is from the rural village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her sons are engaged in  a small business.  Her husband is an old man and can not earn for the family. 
 
Thus, Tulsi is engaged in the business of selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. 

Tulsi started her business from her house. Now she wants to grow her business. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris from the wholesale market to fulfill the demands of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. With the growing needs of her family, she started her business to give financial support to her family. She is a successful entrepreneur. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and her plans are to use the profit from her business for the betterment of her family members and to get ahead with her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of saris to sell

loans.name: Tumpa

texts.en:
Tumpa, 18 years old, is a young married woman from Dhupguri. She is a responsible mother of a young child.  She faced a lot of financial problems soon after her marriage because her husband's income was not sufficient to meet the expenses of their household. Her husband Jadab, 24 years old, is engaged in a small business. His income is low and insufficient to manage the household expenses.

Thus, Tumpa started a business of animal husbandry when they were facing financial problems.  She started selling milk from cows to contribute to the family income.  She has become famous for providing good-quality milk.  She also sells milk products to generate an extra amount of income.  
 
Now she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase one more cow to generate more income. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

Tumpa gives hearty thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is from Dhupguri. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are going to school in grade 9 and grade 6, respectively, while the other one is too young for school. Sabitri is a homemaker who looks after her children and does all the household work. She lives with her family in West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.

Sabitri’s husband, 48-year-old Ganesh, is a cycle van puller and rents a cycle van from a local owner. Thus, their income is very low. From the beginning, they have faced many problems to run the family. Then Sabitri came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase a cycle van. Now Sabitri hopes her husband’s income will increased. Like rickshaws and autos, a cycle van is also one kind of transport which carries people from one place to another, especially in remote areas. She hopes their condition will improve from the earlier situation.

Her goal is to purchase land.

Sabitri thanks her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van to earn more money.

loans.name: Osu Nyame Bekyere Group

texts.en: The two women in the photo are part of the group called Osu Nyame Bekyere, and they both live in the same neighborhood. They sell groceries and design materials. Rebecca (seen in the photo standing on the right) is the group's representative. She is 48 years old and single with two dependable children. Rebecca has been hawking beautiful design materials for eight years. This allows her to contribute to the expenses of her family in addition to her own personal expenses. She buys her design materials at the market in Ghana. Rebecca and the other member of her group would like to improve their businesses, so they have requested a seventh loan from the field partner, ID Ghana. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy her design materials at the market in Ghana.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 45-year-old woman, married to Maingi. The couple is blessed with three children. Penina provides additional income to support the family.  She has been a livestock farmer for ten years, earning an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) at the end of every month.

Penina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of 15,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy goats and animal feeds. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy goats and animal feeds.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 44-year-old rural woman who lives with her husband and two children. They live in a small village, East Altagram, in Dhupguri of Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. 

Mamata's husband, 52-year-old Jachiruddin, is engaged in a poultry farm business. His income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Mamata runs her own milk-supply business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she gives financial support to her family and saves money for a secure future. However, this ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling milk products like butter, curds and cottage cheese.

Mamata seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Mamata will be able to reach her goal, which includes constructing a new and better house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry and milk-supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Jane, 40, who is based in the Kapsowar area of Kenya and is the mother of four lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming and personal business, and through these ventures she has been able to make ends meet. Jane and her family live in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities. Jane is very enterprising, and through farming she has been able to support her family, although she has been facing challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will assist her to produce more. With the loan, Jane will be able to completely turn around her life because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. Through the loan, she will be able to assure her family of improved living standards, and she is confident that the new profits will allow her to comfortably repay the loan. Jane intends to purchase more land through savings that she will make, and this will assure her family of a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: Musrat has successfully built her business selling bed sheets with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more varieties of bed sheets and spreads to increase sales to gain more profits. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of bed sheets and spreads to increase sales to gain more profits.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a very young woman from Dhupguri. She is only 25 years old, married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She is married to Aliyar, a 27-year-old farmer. They live in a small village, East Altagram, in the district of Jalpaiguri. Merina and her husband attended school till seven standards. Their one child reads in class two, and one is too small to go to school. 

Merina's first priority is her children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture since many years ago. They grow different types of crops and sell them in the local market. To cope with the growing price increase of essential commodities, they need to cultivate more crops to generate more income. They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland, as the crop has a high demand in the market.

In order to purchase seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Merina applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future, and she wants to save money from her profits to fulfill her dream.

Merina appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies in order to grow paddy.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is a 31-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Maqsood’s husband. Her husband runs a tractor as a transportation service. It helps him carrying material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs. In order to purchase new tires along with some spare parts, Maqsood contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will allow her husband to provide better facilities to his customers to get a boost in his income.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with some spare parts for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en: These TWO women are part of the group called Happiness. They have an average age of 34 and an average of two children. They live in traditional extended families in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods in Accra, Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together buying and selling assorted soaps, rice, and stew. After successfully repaying all of their previous loans, this is the sixth group loan for the women of the Happiness Group. Victoria intends to use this loan to buy assorted soaps. She purchases her soaps from the market and supplies a diverse clientele of women and men using cash sales. Victoria hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in her business. They will need a total loan of 2,400 Ghanaian cedi (GHS).

loans.use: To purchase assorted soaps from the market and supply a diverse clientele of women and men using cash sales

loans.name: Bugudu

texts.en:
Bugudu is a widowed woman with eight children, who attend school. Together with her children, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a goat meat selling business for the past one year, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 15 goats for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 15 goats for resale.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is a 25-year-old married woman who has been running a school for three years. She has four children and she works hard to provide them with whatever they need to be successful. She also teaches the senior classes in her school. Her passion for education drives her desire to provide the children in her community with good quality education.  Because of her school's solid reputation, more parents want to send their children to her school. This would also help Saba increase her revenue. However, in order to accommodate them she needs to build another classroom. She needs a loan of 100,000 PKR to be able to do this.

loans.use: to build another classroom for accomodating more students.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old, from the town of Carles in Iloilo. She own a business selling clothes, accessories, kitchen utensils and plastic wares. This has been her business for 14 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy items that are always being asked for by customers, like more clothes, accessories and slippers. Norma is excited about the possibility of what a loan can do for her inventory.

Her income will be for healthy meals, household needs and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she hope to have a more successful livelihood.

loans.use: to buy clothes, accessories and slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and pay laborers in her farming activity.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 51-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of ‘Pakora’ making and sales along with her husband who is also shown in the photo.  It is a dish consisting of pieces of vegetable, chicken dipped in a gram flour or besan. They are experts in making good-tasting pakoras and earn enough through this business to contribute to the family income. In order to increase sales, she needs to purchase a stock of gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Ziro

texts.en:
Ziro is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maya Rani

texts.en:
Maya, age 31, is a married woman.  She is from Dhupguri. She is married to 41-year-old Gouranga. They have two children (one son and one daughter).
