Maya and her husband are illiterate and they can only sign their names.  She lives in ward No.16 in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and children.

Maya’s husband is engaged in a car repair business. Maya is a hardworking lady. She helps her husband financially by running a grocery business, after managing her household work.  She sells food items like spices, rice, pulses, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits etc. 

Now she wants to grow her business to satisfy the demands of her customers and because this is a very profitable business. Thus, Maya is taking a loan from BJS to purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery business.

With the expansion of business, she hopes to have a better income that will help her to develop the financial condition of her family. She wants to invest the profit to provide a higher education for her children and construct a new and better house.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery business.

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en: This group of two women is called the Tsuishitoo Group. Their average age is 50 years old and they have an average of two children at home. They both live in traditional extended families in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods in Accra-Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together, buying and selling such items as pork, kenkey (cooked maize paste) and fish. After successfully repaying all their previous loans, this is the sixth group loan for the women of the Tsuishitoo Group. Christiana is a member of this group and intends to use her loan funds to buy pork and smoked fish. She purchases her supplies at neighboring markets and sells to a diverse clientele of women and men, who pay sometimes in cash and often on credit. Christiana hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to meet her family expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder into her business.

loans.use: to purchase pork and fish at neighboring markets and sell them to a diverse clientele.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 52-year-old married woman with five children ages 15-34. She and her family live in Carles, Iloilo. For 12 years, Irene is engaged in selling home-based snacks and she has a restaurant business locally known as a "carenderia". She also sell bread. 

Her husband also helps in their business in order to meet the needs of their family. Irene is asking for a loan to buy chicken, pork meat, and fruit flavored powders for her fruit shakes. Irene has high hopes for the future, especially with the help of the loan.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business and an increase in her customer base.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork, and fruit flavored powder

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a young farmer from Igoji, a remote village in Nkubu Kenya, who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is the mother of two children and has been doing farming for the last two years so that she can supplement her income from the salary she gets. Mercy does crop farming and cattle keeping and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and diseases. This has made her seek a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase a goat. With this goat, her projections are that by the end of the year the goat will have given birth to at least four other goats. Through goat keeping, she will be able to get goat skin, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell goat meat which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Clemence has operated a kiosk business from home for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbors. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice to sell in her business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Ranchpar village with her husband and four children (she has two daughters and two sons). Her four children are school aged and attend the local village school. Susanna has run their family farm since she got married. Her husband is a singer.
 
Susanna keeps a cow and two calves on her farm. The plot of land that she owns also brings profits to the family. Susanna cultivates onions, garlic, eggplant, and grass as a forage. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 will help her purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter. 

Susanna received a prior loan from a local financial institution but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work in recent times, Susanna was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Hello lenders! Meet Monica, 73 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Kirege, a remote village in Chuka. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Monica is happily married and blessed with six children. For the past 35 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Chuka area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. Monica is a member of Mukuria Rikaba Self-help Group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a smallholder farmer based in Mugwe village in Central Kenya. She owns a 1.25 acre piece of land that she uses to grow tea and keep two dairy animals. She has also planted nine trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have five children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for 37 years!  

Mercy is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in Chuka market, only a few kilometers from Mercy's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Mercy's livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rose operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy office supples and a computer, and make truck improvements.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: For 22 years now, Victoria from Carles, Iloilo has been engaged in fishing. She is 52 years old with two children ages 13 and 21. She learned this business from her husband who is also a fisherman. Victoria is asking for a loan to further invest in her business. She will use it to buy fishing nets and a compressor. She works hard for this livelihood and she dreams that someday she can improve her business and increase her profits so she can uplift the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a compressor.

loans.name: Geraldina

texts.en:
Before coming to the US from Honduras five years ago, Geraldina had over 25 years of financial experience and over seven years experience implementing strategy that combined technology and finance to reduce costs.  She has pursued professional development training and plans to begin her Master’s Degree in Data Analytics at the University of Maryland. She ultimately wants to become a fully accredited functional consultant. 

Geraldina says, “I believe that informed business people make better decisions.” Her business goal is to “provide them with user friendly, effective, productive information through the use of top of the line software.”

Geraldina’s business helps to support her family, including one daughter in college and one teenage son. Geraldina has benefited from professional development projects that give her training on key market practices. These projects and classes serve as building blocks Geraldina can use to be eligible for Project Manager positions. This loan will help offset the costs of this training not covered by the trainers.

Geraldina knows that this continued education is critical to the future she sees. She says, “I see myself and my business as a facilitator of growth and success for other people and other businesses.”

loans.use: to pay for upcoming training session expenses

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema  is a married woman, 42 years old, with six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rehema operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Erika Marisol

texts.es:
Erika de 25 años de edad, es una mujer que termino sus estudios de bachillerato obteniendo el título de bachiller comercial en opción secretariado. Es casada desde hace dos años  y el hijo que tienen en común tiene un año de edad, su esposo trabaja de transportista manejando una mototaxi. 

Erika posee un negocio de destazo de carne de cerdo y res, desde hace más de cuatro años, lo aprendió de su mamá que también se dedica a este negocio y cuando termino sus estudios de bachillerato, ya que no quiso seguir en la universidad, se dedicó de lleno a ayudarle a su mamá, de esta manera surgió la idea de poner su propio negocio, ya que con la experiencia adquirida se sentía con la capacidad de administrar por su propia cuenta en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cerdos y vacas para el destazo, ya que quedo descapitalizada porque tuvo gastos médicos con su hijo que le demando bastante dinero y tiempo y en esos días no generaba ingresos en su negocio, por tal motivo se quedó sin capital, ya con el crédito obtenido podrá nuevamente entrar de lleno al negocio y poder generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar las obligaciones adquiridas.
texts.en:
Erika is 25 years old. She completed her high school diploma in secretarial skills. She has been married for two years. She and her husband have a one-year-old son. Erika's husband drives a motorcycle taxi.

Erika has a business slaughtering cows and pigs for their meat. She has had the business for four years, having learned the trade from her mother who also has a slaughterhouse. When Erika finished high school she did not want to go on to university and so worked helping her mother full time. From this came the idea of starting her own business. With the experience she had gained, Erika felt capable of running her own business.

This loan will be used to buy pigs and cows to slaughter. Erika has been left without capital to make these purchases herself as she had to cover medical expenses for her son. This cost a lot of money and took up a lot of time so Erika was not able to earn money at her business. She therefore has no capital but, with this loan, she can start up the business again and earn the necessary income to pay for necessities.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows to slaughter.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian came to the US from Venezuela over six years ago. Now living in Florida with her husband, she is an authorized independent retailer for a satellite dish company. Vivian says, “I decided to start my business because I have been working in the field for many years. I help clients save money by giving them TV service at the best price.”

While the business is easy to manage – Vivian can draw on her prior experience in the field – there are costs that need to be handled. Her business offers technical support for the products and right now, Vivian uses an independent technician. With this loan, she would like to purchase a dedicated vehicle for her business. She would then be able to hire her own technician and not contract it out. Vivian sees this vehicle purchase as just one step on a long journey. “I expect to open two more stores within the next two years,” she says.

loans.use: to pay for a business vehicle and hire an in-house technician

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva de 45 años de edad es una mujer que se gana la vida con la venta de una gran variedad de productos. Ella  vive junto a su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace 20 años y por lo que se siente muy contenta por contar con su casa. Rosalva se gana la vida con la venta de diferentes productos como: jabón, detergente, mariscos, papel higiénico, chorizos, etc. Los que vende desde hace 2 años de forma ambulante por las playas y sus alrededores. Rosalva desea invertir en su negocio que es su mayor fuente de ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, mariscos, etc. Para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rosalva is 45 years old and earns a living selling a variety of products. Rosalva has been living with her husband in a house that the couple owns for 20 years. Rosalva is very happy to be able to own the house. Rosalva makes a living selling different products, such as soap, detergent, sea food, toilet paper, chorizo and more. She has been selling these items as a street vendor for two years, on the local beaches and nearby areas. Rosalva wants to invest in her business, her greatest source of income. To do this she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy soap, detergent, toilet paper, sea food and more. This will allow her to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, toilet paper, sea food and more.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria de 29 años de e dad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 9 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijas apoyada en su negocio de venta de pupusas las que elabora 4 días por semana en su vivienda. Gloria sabe que su negocio es muy importante para la economía de su hogar y es por ello que desea invertir en  él, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: repollo, tomates, zanahoria, chicharrón, queso, frijoles, aceite, etc. Para elaborar las pupusas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria, 29, lives in her own house with her two daughters, ages nine and four.  For a long time she has been working hard to provide for her daughters through her business selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) which she makes four days a week at home.

Gloria knows that her business is very important for the economy of her household and therefore she wants to invest in it.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, oil, etc. to make the pupusas.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija y 2 nietas desde hace 20 años. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por sostener la economía familiar apoyada en su trabajo de atención al cliente en una venta de zapatos en la que labora desde hace 3 años. María ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda que acaba de terminar de construir pero le hizo falta colocar rejas en la construcción del corredor por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, ángulo, platina, electrodos y mano de obra para colocar rejas en la construcción del corredor.
texts.en:
For 20 years Maria, 54, has lived in her own home with her daughter and two granddaughters.  She has been working hard for a long time to support the household economy by selling shoes, which she has been doing for three years.

Maria has decided to take out a loan to continue improving her house which she just finished building.  In order to put up grillwork on the porch she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy iron, corner pieces, flooring, electrodes and to pay labor costs to put up the grillwork.

loans.use: To buy iron, corner pieces, a floor, electrodes and to pay labor costs to put grillwork on the porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fertilize his cocoa plantation and maintain his land.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 58 años de edad habita junto a su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Ana es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día para sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de leche de vaca en su domicilio, además junto a su esposo tiene una plantación de plátanos los que vende también en su domicilio por mayoreo. Ana desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha decidido remodelar un cuarto para la cocina ya que actualmente esta se encuentra ubicada en una champa de palmas de coco y madera por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, y mano de obra para remodelar el cuarto para la cocina.
texts.en: Ana, 58, has lived with her husband in their own house for some time. Ana is a woman who works hard every day to support her home through her business selling cow's milk from her house. Additionally, alongside her husband, she has a plantation of bananas, which she sells at wholesale also from her home. Ana wishes to improve her living conditions so she has decided to remodel a room into a kitchen since, currently, it is located in a hut made of wood and coconut palms. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor to remodel the room for the kitchen.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor to remodel a room into a kitchen.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor tiene 28 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 9 años de edad. Víctor posee un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos para todas las preferencias. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su compañera de vida mantienen la economía del hogar.  Víctor comenzó la construcción de su vivienda hace algún tiempo pero por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el deseo de finalizar su vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para comprar ciertos materiales que aun le hacen falta para terminar su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará hierro, cemento y arena. Espera poder contar con este crédito y así poder terminar su vivienda y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Victor is 28 years old and lives with his spouse and their 9 year old daughter. Victor owns a small business selling shoes of all kinds. He earns a living this way and, together with his wife, supports his family. Victor began building his house some time ago but, due to a lack of economic resources, has not managed to finish it. With a desire to complete the house, he has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to buy certain materials that he still needs to finish the house. With the amount requested, he will buy iron, cement and sand. He hopes to be able to have this loan and thus finish his house and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement and sand to finish construction on his house.

loans.name: Rosa De Jesus

texts.es: Rosa de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gatso de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Rosa is 50 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion. For ten years she has worked in agriculture. She grows corn and beans. She sells her products in different markets and with what she obtains from her sales she is able to pay for her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. as well as to improve the land seen in the photograph so she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es: Andrés de 37 años de edad vive con sus padres en casa propia el se dedica a la apicultura desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Andrés está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 10 colmenas para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Andrés, 37, lives with his parents in their own house. He has been dedicated to beekeeping for many years. He sells his products around the area where he lives. Andrés is requesting a loan to buy 10 beehives in order to continue his work and generate good income.

loans.use: to buy 10 beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, pest control, chemical and organic fertilizers, etc and to improve his land.

loans.name: David Alfredo

texts.es: David de 37 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de huevos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes ya que es un producto muy vendible, David vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas huevos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: David, 37, has been dedicated for many years to selling eggs. His business is located in his house and he has many customers since it is a very salable product. David lives in his own house with his spouse. He is requesting a loan to buy more eggs at wholesale so he can continue his sales and generate good earnings.

loans.use: to buy more eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize his cacao and plantain plants and do maintenance on his land.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru:
Хамида веселая трудолюбивая и вежливая продавщица из района Шахритус. Ей 51 лет. Хамида замужем и имеет пятерых детей. В Таджикистане многодетные семья является нормой. Ее дети уже взрослые. 
   Хамида настоящая бизнес woman, у нее имеется продуктовый магазин, где сама занимается продажей продуктов. В 10 лет Хамида набралась большого опыта в сфере торговли. Она ценит каждого клиента и к каждому она подходит индивидуально. Хамида ценить свою работу и свой бизнес. Сейчас Хамида просит кредит, чтобы расширить бизнес путем провозки большого количество товара( продукты питания: сахар, масло, кофе, жвачки, драже, соль и т.д.). У нее не хватило не большой суммы денег и Хамида надеется на получения кредита и осуществления цели.
texts.en: Hamida is a happy, hardworking and polite retailer from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  (In Tajikistan, large families are quite the norm).  Hamida's children are all adults already.  Hamida is a real business woman; she has her own grocery store where she sells food products herself.  Over the past ten years, she has acquired a good deal of experience in the field of commerce. She values each one of her customers and relates to everyone individually.  She enjoys her job and her business.  She is taking a loan to bring in more merchandise (food products such as sugar, butter, coffee, chewing gums, jelly beans, salt etc.) in order expand her business.  She is only lacking a small amount of money, and she is hoping to receive this loan in order to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy food products such as sugar, butter, coffee, chewing gum, jelly beans, salt etc.

loans.name: Ivan Dionisio

texts.es: Ivan de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de calzado,  repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ivan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ivan is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own house. He has a shoe workshop where he repairs and makes shoes. His shop is located in his place of residence. He has a large clientele due to the quality of his product. With what he makes from his sales he manages to get ahead with the household expenses. Ivan is requesting a loan to buy leather, thread, glue,  fabric, etc. so he can continue to make shoes. This is his only source of work and doing this he can keep his family together with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, venenos, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder tener un mejor cultivo y si mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The youth who has his face blanked out is 21 years old and lives in an area of high risk. For the past several years he has been working in agriculture growing corn and beans. He sells his product in the various markets. The youth lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, poison, etc as is shown in the photo, so that he can have a better crop and higher revenues.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide fertilizer, manure, poison, etc.

loans.name: Kavuti

texts.en:
Kavuti is married and has four children. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Kavuti dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam is married and has one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for sale. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 33 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura (siembra maíz), con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir una parte de los gastos de la casa, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios para continuar con sus cultivos como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en: Miguel, 33 years old, lives with his wife and their three children. He has worked for the past 10 years in agriculture (growing corn); with his sales he manages to cover a part of the household expenses.  He is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary supplies to continue with his crop such as seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land that his shown in the photograph, and in this way, have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Segundo Francisco

texts.es:
Segundo Francisco tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, sin carga familiar. Vive en casa de sus padres junto con ellos. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; que está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo Francisco se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores(patos, cerdos) y tambiñen brinda el servicio de transporte urbano en mototaxi desde hace 04 años. Además, eventualmente percibe ingresos por servicios de construcción. Con préstamo invertirá en alimento de engorde balanceado para sus animales y también le dará mantenimiento a su mototaxi(cambio de carpa). Así, ofrecerá una mejor atención a sus clientes y de esta manera obtendrá una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Francisco is 23 years old, single, and without family responsibilities. He lives in his parents' house with them. His family is very close. He lives in a community dedicated to trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry; it is located in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Segundo Francisco works raising and selling small animals (ducks, pigs) and also has offered urban transportation service in motorcycle taxi for the past 4 years. In addition, he occasionally gets income from construction work. With the loan, he will invest in balanced fattening feed for his animals, and also will do some maintenance on his motorcycle taxi (replace the awning). So, he will offer better customer service and, in this way, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in balanced fattening feed for his animals and also do some maintenance on his motorcycle taxi (replace the awning).

loans.name: Wilson Leonel

texts.es: Wilson de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de jocotes y también al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Wilson está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Wilson, 36 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and their child. He works growing jocote fruit, and also growing corn and sorghum. He sells his products in the nearby areas in the zone. Wilson is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, manure,etc. to continue with his work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su sobrina, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos como: sopas, frijoles, aceite, huevos, jabon, etc. todo por mayor para surtir aun ms la tienda y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter and her niece. She has had a store in her home for the past 10 years. She has many customers for her variety of products and the good prices. She is asking for a loan to be able to purchase more products such as soup, beans, oil, eggs, soap, etc. all in bulk, to stock her store even more and in this way be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase soup, beans, oil, eggs, soap, etc. all in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her cocoa, coffee and banana plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Эту швею зовут Хафиза. Она живет в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Хафиза замужем, у нее трое детей. Дети учатся, а муж работает за пределами страны. Хафиза тоже работает, она швея и занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Эту деятельность она уже ведет 7 лет и стала профессионалом своего дела. Хафиза сейчас хочет расширить свою деятельность. За счет кредита она планирует купить компьютерную швейную машинку, с помощью которой будет делать на платьях вышивки. Таким образом она хочет увеличить доход от деятельности и улучшить финансовые условия семьи. 
Хафиза верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This seamstress is named Hafiza.  She lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  Her children are in school and her husband works abroad. Hafiza also works.  She is a seamstress and is in business sewing traditional dresses.  She has been in this line of work for seven years and has become a real professional in this trade.

Currently, Hafiza wants to expand her business.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to buy a computerized sewing machine that will help her embroider dresses.  In this way she will increase her business income and will improve her family's financial position.  Hafiza believes you will help.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра проживает на территории северного города Худжанд. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж работает шофером. В браке у Гулчехра имеется двое сыновей. Старшему сыну 25 лет, он женат и с женой живут в родительском доме. Младшему сыну 22 года. Дети Гулчехры работают малярами. 
   Гульчехра в течение 5 лет вышивает бисером на платьях. Она просит кредит, для купли тканей. На остальные заемные деньги она отремонтирует дом. Уже несколько лет они не делали ремонт и собирали средства для обновления стен. Ремонт обойдется им не очень дорого, потому что ее сыновья сами могут сделать ремонт, только не обходимы краски и необходимые стройматериалы. Гульчехра заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulchehra lives in the northern city of Khujand.  She is 45 years old and married.  He husband works as a driver and they have two sons.  Their eldest son is 25 and he and his wife live at home with Gulchehra and her husband.  Their youngest son is 22 years old.  Both sons work as house painters.

For the last five years Gulchehra has beaded dresses.  She is requesting the loan to buy fabric.  She will repair her home with the remaining funds.  The repairs won't cost much since her sons can do the work, but they have to buy paint and building materials.  Gulchehra thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and building materials

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 31 год, замужем, есть 2 детей школьников. У нее высшее образование, по специальности журналист. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аида 10 лет занимается животноводством, полеводством и продажей молока. Благодаря упорному труду Аиды в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец, 2 бычка, 2 лошади и 10 коз. Также есть 1,42 ГА земельной доли, где Аида выращивает эспарцет для заготовки сена для скота.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 200 тюков сена и 4 тонн семян картофеля для получения большого урожая экологически чистого и вкусного картофеля. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aida is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children.  She has a higher education in journalism.  However, her family's main source of income is the faming, cattle, and milk business Aida started 10 years ago.  As a result of her hard work, today Aida has three cows, 20 sheep, two bulls, two horses, and 10 goats.  Aida also has 1.42 ha of land where she grows sainfoin for cattle fodder.  

With an aim to developing her business further, Aida applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 200 bales of hay and four tons of potato seed so she can have a large, ecologically friendly, and tasty harvest.  Aida plans to invest the profits in further adding to her herd of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase 200 bales of hay for livestock and 4 tons of seeds for growing eco-friendly potato

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen needs a loan to buy inventory for her Brazilian-focused store. She started her downtown Framingham MA business in 2009 and sells Brazilian products and travel services. “I love to travel and help my customers to set their travel,” Carmen says. Carmen lives with her husband and she supports her nephew’s education.  

Carmen, like most small business owners, gets to experience the ups and downs of being the boss. On the positive side, Carmen is proud that she is the travel service and local products source of choice—not just for the local market but also for the larger surrounding area. But, she says, “The largest difficulty is always to find financial support from banks.” 

In the future, Carmen would like to expand her product offerings to include selling mobile phones. She would also like to complete her undergraduate degree. In the meantime, she plans on making sure your next trip is amazing!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business selling Brazilian products and travel services

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo always had a knack for fixing things. “Since I was quite young, I’ve been very knowledgeable about fixing engines and other things related to machinery.” Now, Eduardo runs a repair shop, focusing on medium-sized machines. He is confident enough in his work that he can provide a guarantee on the repairs. Eduardo lives with his wife and daughter. 

As a small business owner working with other small business owners, Eduardo knows how important low costs are to his clients – and he keeps this in mind when he sets his own rates. “I try to support the business owners as well," he says. 

With this loan, Eduardo will build a website for his business. His longer term goals include hiring someone and teaching his trade.

loans.use: to create a website and online platform to schedule appointments

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 19-year-old university student majoring in Arabic Language, and she is in her second year.  She is seeking to get her Bachelor's so that she can improve her studies and start her Master's journey. 

Her father is a retired man. Hanan lives with her family that consists of five members in Baqaa, Jordan.

Now she is applying for this loan to be able to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Haneen's Group

texts.en:
Haneen is a 19-year-old university student majoring in accounting, and she is at the beginning of her study journey. 

She lives with her family that consists of four members. Haneen's aim is to experience work life after graduating. 

Yousef, her brother, who is appearing in the photo with her, wants to help her in paying her upcoming semester fees, which they didn’t have enough money to pay. They have applied for this loan to provide Haneen with what she needs for her study.

loans.use: to pay for Haneens' upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Arabic language, and she is in her third year. Rahma is aiming to get her Bachelor's so that she can continue her study and register for Master's.

Her father is a water tank driver. 

Because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Elyan

texts.en:
Elyan is a 20-year-old university student majoring in social sciences, and she is in her last year. 

She lives with her family that consists of six members in Irbid, Jordan. Her father is a retired man, and his pension wasn’t enough to cover his family's needs. Therefore, Elyan is aiming to find a job with a good income in her study field after getting her Bachelor's, and she is only one step away. 

Now she is applying for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los pueblos aledaños, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, abonos, etc. y asi seguir con sus siembras.
texts.en:
The young woman with the pixelated face is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She has devoted herself to agriculture for six years.  When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries shown in the photo.  She then goes out to sell it in surrounding towns.

The young woman lives in her own house with her life partner.  She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and compost, etc.  This way she will continue with her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and compost, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is single and has no children. She owns a house that has neither piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over one year, she has operated a tailoring business.

She comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 21-year-old single lady living with her family in Baqaa, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in English language and literature, and she is in her second year. 

Majd is seeking to continue her studies till she gets her Bachelor's. But because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Therefore, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is a 21-year-old single lady living with her family. She is a university student majoring in class teaching, and she is in her second year. 

Two of her family members are currently working at a governmental entity. Aseel is aiming to find a job in her study field after graduating. 

She is now applying for this loan and asking for your help to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue his study by paying his semester fees.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of seven sons and daughters. Her husband works at a governmental entity, and his income isn’t enough to cover his children's needs. Therefore, Sumaya has started her own business.

She has been selling clothes at her house for eight months. Because her business is profitable, she is planning to expand it in the future by opening her own clothes store to raise her profit. Now she is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Rula's Group

texts.en:
Rula is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Special Education, and she is at the beginning of her study journey. She lives with her family that consists of nine members. 

Rulas’ aim is to experience work life after graduating. Basma, her mother, is appearing in the photo with her and wants to help her in paying her upcoming semester fees, but she didn’t have enough money to pay. They have applied for this loan to provide Rula with what she needs for her studies.

loans.use: To pay for upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sara Elsa

texts.es: Sara de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 23 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sara esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, detergentes, golosinas, huevos, refrescos, arroz, azucar, etc. para poder surtir aun mas la tienda y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sara, age 65, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.  She has had a store at her house for 23 years.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy soups, detergent, candy, eggs, soft drinks, rice, and sugar, etc.  She will buy these things in order to be able to stock her store even more.  This way she will have improved earnings.

loans.use: to buy soups, detergent, candy, eggs, soft drinks, rice, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Atitecas Santiago Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlán is the largest of the lake communities on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Atitecas Santiago,” meaning “Women of Santiago Atitlán,” was formed here by 14 ladies. They are requesting their very first loan from Friendship Bridge that they will use to purchase supplies for their businesses that include traditional textile production (weaving and embroidery), and arts and crafts, including beading for textiles and jewelry and painting supplies. 

Gabina is a 38-year-old member of the Trust Bank with five years of formal education. She has four children, and two of them are in middle school. For five years, she has sold cosmetics like facial creams, scented soaps, shampoos and facial and body creams. As she wants to increase her inventory and attract new clients, Gabina is requesting a loan to generate additional income. With the additional income, she wants her children to be able to complete their formal educational studies.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are delighted to learn about relevant topics that will help them make wise decisions with their first loan. They are also committed to the well-being of their families. Each month, the women acquire new information with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who takes part of the meeting to share data on effective business management practices, self-esteem and women’s rights as well as nutrition, hygiene and healthful practices. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus.” It is most effective.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics inventory and attract new clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his computer.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan started Seven Sixteen Technologies LLC  (www.716tech.com) in 2011, providing basic websites for small companies. He takes great pride in helping small business owners use the Internet to expand the reach of their businesses. While this drew on over five years of website experience,  Jonathan’s true interests were elsewhere.

“Growing up, the one thing I used to ask Santa for every Christmas was a cash register,” says Jonathan. He has always had an interest in retail and saw an opportunity to leverage his long experience with web design with an online store.  His girlfriend was very interested in Kawaii products, Japanese products that emphasize cuteness as their appeal. Jonathan says this is “a niche market that has been lacking in organized stores.” Given his web experience, Jonathan built a secure web platform (www.kawaiimiko.com) – with the added benefit of highlighting the work of Seven Sixteen Technologies.

Jonathan needs a loan to purchase bulk inventory. “We have been able to order some of it, but this loan will allow us to complete our inventory.” Maintaining inventory has been the most difficult part of this business. Jonathan must meet minimum bulk orders to be able to resell for a profit. Ultimately, Jonathan wants the Kawaii store to be a self-sustaining showpiece for what Seven Sixteen Technologies can do.

loans.use: to pay for bulk inventory for his website

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a self-dependent young man living with his family that consists of five members in Irbid, Jordan. 

He is a university student majoring in accounting, and he is in his third year. He also works in the evenings as a taxi driver to help his family financially.

Ismael is seeking to get his Bachelor's in order to find a better job in his study field. But because he doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en:
Shorouq is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Early Children Education, and she is in her last year. She lives with her family that consists of 10 members. 

Shorouq is only one step away from reaching her aim of finding a job in her field, which is considered as one of her interests. But because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Computer Science, and she is in her first year. She lives with her family that consists of three members in Irbid, Jordan. 

Ranias’ family has been facing financial problems in the current period. For that reason, she is aiming to work in her field after graduating to be able to help her family. Now she is applying for this loan to ask for your help in paying her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay healthcare costs.

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Abubakarr. He is married and has two children, aged 12 and 8 years. In 1999, Abubakarr established his soft drinks, beer and pure water business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his living standards and take care of his family. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 600,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Le. Abubakarr requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, beer and pure drinking water for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 Le. 

In the future, Abubakarr plans to buy a plot of land to build a store and shops for his business and educate his children up to college level.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, beer and pure drinking water for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 24 years. In 1992, Fatmata established her textile business, selling mainly cotton materials, lace, etc. She began her business to help her husband in the running of their home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. 

Fatmata has a good repayment history. She has taken and completely repaid two loans and now requires a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) to buy wax cotton and lace materials. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level and help her to access more profits. Fatmata used the profit from her last loan to pay school fees and other school charges for her children, and bought some household items.

In the future, Fatmata plans to be a supplier to other traders and schools with school uniforms, continue to improve her business and educate her children to the university level.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wax cotton and lace materials for her business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo has worked on cars all his life. He has owned his own car repair shop for seven years now. “My business is a passion. I love every minute I spend working on it,” he says. 

Guillermo’s focus is on quality customer service, with an emphasis on a fair and honest price. He recently relocated to a better location with more visibility, and he says “business is growing at a steady pace.” One hurdle he faces is missing out on larger jobs because of lack of inventory and working capital. 

Guillermo needs a loan to help manage his inventory and cash flows. After all, he needs to pay for the repair parts before the customer pays him!

Guillermo lives in Florida with his wife. His vision for the future is to “fulfill my career dreams as a Master Mechanic and continue achieving success with my business through many years of satisfied clients.”

loans.use: to pay for auto parts

loans.name: Leonel

texts.en:
Leonel started LAVCOR LLC in 2011 because he saw contracting opportunities to provide Florida county governments with equipment and supplies. Since then, he has worked with a range of government departments in the Miami-Dade area. Leonel is proud that he has “been able to establish long-term contracts for department equipment and supplies. I look forward to continuing this trend.” One concern he has is that he “will receive a contract/order and have most of my capital tied up.”

Leonel needs a loan to help fulfill supply orders for a current contract. Successful fulfillment of this loan will help Leonel’s business continue to establish itself as a go-to contractor in the area. Eventually, Leonel would like to grow large enough to purchase a warehouse – but he knows this is a marathon, not a sprint. “I see myself learning and studying for better ways to run the business.”

loans.use: to purchase supplies to fulfill a government contract

loans.name: Selevesta

texts.en: Selevesta is a married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in produce of beans and maize supplying them to schools. He faces challenges of inadequate capital, besides that, he hopes of constructing a store to keep his merchandise. Selevesta needs a loan to buy maize to supply to schools

loans.use: to buy maize to supply to schools

loans.name: Andreas

texts.en:
Andreas is a final year student at Accra Polytechnic Institute pursuing HND Accountancy, and he aspires to be a Chartered Accountant in future. The loan is to help pay his tuition fees.

His younger sister and a cousin inspire him to realize his dreams, so he can help in taking care of their education.

His profession interests him because he has always been good with numbers, and also will give him the needed financial independence to support himself, his family, the community and others that may need help one way or the other.                                                                                                                                               

If he were denied this loan facility, he would have asked family members which is not always a guaranteed source of help. 

“For me, Kingsbridge Microfinance is one of the best microfinance institutions in the country, so I would like to let investors know that Mother Ghana is a safe and a peaceful place for business to be held.”

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees and hostel fees

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Broken phones are Adrian’s specialty. Saving his customers money is an added bonus. Adrian is a natural when it comes to making repairs. After suffering a workplace injury, Adrian stayed at home and began helping his friends and family by fixing their broken phones.  From this experience, he realized this could be a good business opportunity and started his repair business, AR Tech Wireless Repair, LLC. 

“I have loved working with technology for as long as I can remember,” Adrian said. “I saw an opportunity to do something awesome and I took it.” Adrian doesn’t just repair cell phones.  He can repair tablets, computers and other wireless devices. He invested a great deal into his business, including the start-up expenses, equipment and tools. Instead of replacing or sending off broken wireless devices to outside companies, Adrian is proud that he can help his customers while saving them money. 

“It has always been a dream of mine to love what I do and enjoy coming to work every day,” Adrian said.  “This is where am I am most comfortable and I have really high hopes for what my business can turn into.”

Adrian came to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to fund his inventory. He needs to purchase new stock and invest in the marketing of his business. Now that Adrian has built himself a client base and word-of-mouth business, he wants to take his marketing efforts to the next level.

loans.use: to pay for inventory costs and tools to repair cell phones, tablets and computers

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 18 años, posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Flora esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, golosinas, granos basicos, refrescos, huevos, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Flora, 59, lives in her own house with her life companion.  She has had a store located in her place of residence for 18 years, and she has many customers because of the variety of products and the good prices. 

Flora is requesting a loan for the purchase of soup, snacks, basic grains, soft drinks, eggs, etc.  In this way, she can continue with her sales, which generate good earnings for her.

loans.use: to purchase soup, snacks, basic grains, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: This loan helps Nadia get connected to her local prepay micro-grid. Nadia, 30, lives in a small green wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered micro grid, and to finally get rid of her dirty, costly kerosene lamp. Mainly, she is looking forward to being connected, as it will allow her to save money. Nadia will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered micro-grid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for blouses, skirts and ladies' dresses

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Adama. She is married. In 2010, Adama established her clothing business (gara, bamako, country clothes), Africana for men, women and children. She started her business so that she will be able to take care of her family needs. Her business is located in the city center and her customers are all ages. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Adama requires a loan in order to buy additional gara, bamako and country clothes. She hopes that this loan will add to her business and bring in more clients. 

In the future, Adama plans to secure land and educate her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for gara, bamako and country clothes

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isata.  She is married. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help in the business. 

In 2010, Isata established her drinks and water business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family needs. Her business is located in the city center and her customers are all ages. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata requires a loan in order to buy additional soft drink and bundles of packet water. She hopes that this loan will increase her principal and generate more income.

 In the future, Isata plans to own more shops for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and bundles of water

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mark. He is married and has 3 children, ages 4, 7 and 12. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him, helping with the house chores.  

In 2010, Mark established his building materials business. He began his business just to engage himself in an economic activity and to expand his patent drug business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,443,600 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mark has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cement for his shop. 

In the future, Mark plans to improve on the cement trade to start selling by wholesale and hopes to open an outlet within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana has been involved in business activities since 2009, when she started with her own working capital of $300. She is requesting a loan of USD 600. She has a kiosk in her house, and she taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy additional supplies with the loan including sardines, milk, tea, coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, eggs, candles, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks. She said with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to get good management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sardines, milk, tea, coffee, sugar, candles etc.

loans.name: Eleopoldo

texts.es:
Eleopoldo tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente y con 2 menores hijos bajo su cargo, vive en casa propia de material rustico, en el caserio Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicha comunidad está ubciada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Eleopoldo es la produccion y comercialización de chicha de jora la cual realiza junto con su conyuge; además de dedicarse a la venta de banano ya que tiene terreno agricola en el Caserio de Carrasquillo, actividad que realiza hace 2 años, teniendo como transporte de su producto su mototaxi, contando ya con clientela fija para su venta.

El destino del crédito es para mantenimiento de terreno agricola de y compra de maiz insumo principal para elaboracion de chicha de jora. La compra le ayudará a obtener mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida ya que el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido que es temporada escolar aumentado consumo de banano y por parte de chicha cliente con capacidad remunerativa por cosecha de arroz por la zona.
texts.en:
Eleopoldo, 48, is married with 2 children.  He lives in a small house in Laynas, a rural town in La Matanza.  (La Matanza is a region along the northern coast of Peru.)  The local economy depends on farming, animal-rearing and small commercial businesses.  
Eleopoldo and his wife operate a farming business.  They have grown maize and bananas for 2 years on land that they own.  They own a mototaxi for transporting their crop and have a regular set of buyers for what they sell.
Eleopoldo is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies that he needs to carry on his farming business.  The investment will allow him to increase his yields and, in turn, his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Machozi est commerçante, conseillère d’un collectif d’affaires «Bora», âgée de 56 ans, mariée a un chauffeur, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs d’haricots et 2 sacs de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Machozi, age 56, is a merchant and advisor to the Bora business group. She is married to a driver, and they have 5 children who all go to school. 
Machozi sells foodstuffs and has been practicing this activity for 14 years. She conducts her sales at a local market. She originally launched her business with capital received from her husband.   

She plans to buy 2 sacks of beans and 2 sacks of potatoes.  

Her goals are to bolster her capital and to ensure that her children are fed, clothed, and educated. 

Machozi wishes to thank Hekima for helping businesswomen who cannot use the traditional banking system in their efforts to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of beans and 2 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que ella es una persona muy amable y responsable, Maria solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband and two children. 

She has owned a grain mill for several years. She has many customers, mainly the women who make tortillas and who arrive at Maria's to grind the corn, since she is a very kind, responsible person.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy blades, plates and all the necessary tools to keep the grain mill in good order. She will then carry on with the work so that she can provide for her family without constraint.

loans.use: to buy blades, plates, and all the necessary tools.

loans.name: Melba Nubia

texts.es:
Si hablamos de esfuerzo y dedicación, Melba es la indicada para proyectar el significado de esas dos palabras. Ella es madre soltera de seis hijos entre las edades de 34 a 13 años, la mayoría de ellos independientes, gracias al apoyo de su madre. Melba tiene 52 años de edad y es comerciante de palmitas de maíz y manzanas acarameladas desde hace diez años, cuando quedó sola con su mamá y tuvo que lanzarse en este negocio sin ninguna experiencia.
Ella es reconocida por llevar a vender sus productos en todas las ferias de su pueblo. No obstante, no solo quiere quedarse vendiendo ahí, quiere llegar a comercializar sus productos por todo el país. Melba sabe que debe seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar manzanas, caramelo y palomitas de maíz. Esto le permitirá tener siempre mercancía para vender y generar mayores ingresos. Entre sus planes está tener su propio local y poder tener vendedores por toda Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Melba, 52, is the very personification of grit and persistence.  She is a single mother and has six children ranging in age from 13- to 34-years old, most of whom are able to support themselves now thanks in no small part to her hard work.  Melba is a street vendor.  She has made a living selling palomitas and caramel apples for ten years.  She started the business even though she knew nothing about it because she was on her own and needed an income.  
Melba is a familiar figure in local markets now.  Even so, she would like to sell in other parts of the country as well.  She knows that she should invest in the business so she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy apples, caramel, palomitas, etc.  The investment will allow her to stock enough inventory to meet demand and, in turn, increase her income.  For the future, she would like to have a store of her own and pay vendors to sell her products throughout Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to store his food.

loans.name: Soledad Ynsenia

texts.es:
Soledad es padre y madre para sus dos hijos, quienes son el principal motor en su vida y por quienes lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante, con muchos esfuerzo y por iniciativa propia abrió una tienda de ropa en su ciudad natal, Ica. Ella trabaja día a día por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le está yendo bien por su dedicación al trabajo y sobre todo por los grandes deseos de superación que tiene.
Soledad quiere mejorar su negocio, es por ello que utilizará el crédito para poder redecorlarlo, quiere pintar las paredes, comprar nuevos estantes para poder exhibir la ropa que vende. Ella está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto sus ingresos mejorarán. Más adelante espera cumplir su sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Soledad is father and mother to her two children. They are the driving force of her life whom she struggles for day by day to get ahead. On her own initiative and with much effort she opened a clothing store in her native city of Ica. She works about 10 hours daily. She feels that things are going well because of her dedication to work and moreover for the great desire to excel that she has.

Soledad wants to improve her business so she will use the loan to redecorate it. She will paint the walls and buy new shelving to display the clothing that she sells. She is grateful to the lenders at Kiva and wants them to know that with the loan her revenues will improve. In the future she hopes to fulfill her dream of seeing her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to improve her store selling clothing (buy shelving)

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a ala agricultura y ganadería, además de el comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Ricardo es a la compra y venta de leña, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años, con experiencia en el negocio y clientela fija en la zona. Ricardo realiza sus ventas en los caseríos aledaños. El destino del crédito será para la construcción de una pared de división en su casa, lo que le dará mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 31 years old and single. He lives in the Buenos Aires district, where he was born. He lives with his family in a house of his own. Life is good in this community and locals work in agriculture and commerce. The district is located in the Morropón province, in the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru.

Ricardo buys and sells firewood. He has been doing this for more than two years and has accumulated good experience and a fixed customer base. He sells the firewood in different surrounding villages.

Ricardo will use the loan to build a wall to divide two rooms at home. This will result in a safer and more comfortable house, and thus better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to build a wall at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Feliciana to improve her business. Feliciana lives in Suai; she is married and has 5 children. Most of her daily income is from selling cows so she is still happy to operate her business. 

Feliciana started her business in 2001, with her own working capital of $1,000. She and her husband were going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow because this has become their business activity. Feliciana is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future. She also cultivates other animals such as buffaloes, cows, pigs and goats.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
Las palomas  es un grupo integrado por  11 personas trabajadoras, amables, responsables y honradas, originarias de la misma comunidad donde desde 1937 se estableció uno de los ingenios de mayor producción de azúcar. Por lo anterior, la mayoría de los habitantes trabaja en el campo (sembrando, limpiando, cortando, la caña de azúcar), algunos laboran en el ingenio como obreros y otros más acarrean caña en temporada de zafra (cosecha). También hay quienes salen a trabajar a otras ciudades para ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro, pero también hay quienes se aventuran y establecen su propio negocio. Tal es el caso de los clientes del grupo llamado Las Palomas, quienes comentan que el nombre del grupo surgió por la libertad de volar y la belleza de esta ave.

Los integrantes del grupo son:
Perfecta - Venta De Ropa
Concepción- Venta De Ropa 
Ángela - Venta De Calzado
José Luis- Venta De Bisutería 
Margarita - Venta De Ropa
Susana- Venta De Cosméticos
Sandra Luz- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo 
Alba- Venta De Ropa
Nahum - Venta De Ropa
Guadalupe- Venta De Cosméticos 
Uleria- Venta De Antojitos

Nahum es un joven muy alegre, carismático, honesto, que ama  bailar. Ha ganado varios premios por ser quien mejor baila en las discos. Hace algunos años, cuando estudiaba la preparatoria concursó en la categoría de baile moderno y obtuvo el primer lugar. A pesar de que ama la danza, Nahum no se dedicó a ella por el costo que genera y porque la economía en casa no era muy estable.

Nahum inició la venta de ropa de manera ambulante desde hace ya 13 años, hoy en día tiene un local en el centro de la comunidad. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a sus padres con el gasto de la casa, satisface necesidades personales e invierte en más mercancía. Nahum trabaja todos los días con un horario de 10:00 am a 08:00 pm en el local que está instalado en la casa de su hermana quien lo apoya con el almuerzo y la cena.

“Gracias VisionFund Mexico por brindarme la gran oportunidad de ser su cliente” esas son las palabras de Nahum quien comenta que con el préstamo otorgado comprará pantalones, blusas, playeras y camisas para dama y caballero.

*En la imagen: Nahum viste de playera color naranja y está parado sobre un banco.
texts.en:
Las Palomas (the doves) is a group made up of 11, hard-working, friendly, responsible and honest members, who are all from the same community, where one of the most productive sugar refineries was established in 1937. Before, most of the population worked in the fields (cultivating, cleaning, or cutting sugar cane), while some worked in the refinery and others transported the sugar cane at harvest time. Some people left to work in other cities in order offer a better future to their families, and others took the risk of opening their own businesses. In the latter group are the members of Las Palomas, who point out that they chose their name for the bird’s freedom of flight and beauty. 

The members of this group are:
Perfecta – sells clothing
