Concepción- sells clothing 
Ángela – sells shoes 
José Luis- sells jewelry 
Margarita - sells clothing 
Susana- sells cosmetics
Sandra Luz- sells shoes through catalog 
Alba - sells clothing 
Nahum - sells clothing 
Guadalupe- sells cosmetics
Uleria- sells snacks

Nahum is a joyful, charismatic and honest young man who loves to dance. He has won various prizes as the best dancer in discos. A few years ago, while studying his college preparatory course, he won first prize in the modern dance category in a competition. But despite his love for dancing, Nahum decided not to choose it as a profession because it entails a lot of expenses and his income would not be very stable. 

Nahum started selling clothes in the street 13 years ago, and today has a shop in the center of town. With his earnings he helps his parents with household expenses, covers his personal needs, and invests in more stock. Nahum works every day from 10:00 am until 8:00 pm in his shop, which is set up in his sister’s house. She helps by offering him lunch and dinner. 

“Thank you VisionFund Mexico for offering me the great opportunity to be your client “, says Nahum, adding that with this loan he will buy pants, tops, t-shirts and button-down shirts for both men and women. 

*In the photo: Nahum is wearing an orange polo shirt and is standing on a bench.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, t-shirts and button-down shirts.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en: A buy and sell business helps Erlyn provide for the family. She buys copra from her neighbors and sells it in bulk to the market. It brings a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling copra easy and simple, Erlyn plans to expand her business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital to pay for inventories of copra not only from her neighbors but from other barangays also. She wants to cater to more customers for a good income opportunity. Erlyn smiles at the fact of having a better living and seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of copra and sell them out in bulk in the market to fetch higher prices.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y tomates desde hace 32 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en las agencias de compra-venta de granos de básicos, Oscar esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos y poder darle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old and lives in his home with his four children. He has grown staple grains and tomatoes for the last 32 years. When the harvest is ready he sells his produce to the stores which specialise in buying and selling staple grains.

Oscar is applying for a loan to buy fertilisers, pest control treatment, herbicides, seeds, compost, etc. to improve his land which you can see in the photograph. He would like to continue growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, pest control treatment, herbicides, seeds, compost, etc. to improve his land

loans.name: Syd Ann

texts.en:
Syd Ann settled for a living in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has two children who are still studying. Syd Ann has been helping her husband to manage their own farm. 

Syd Ann used her previous loan for their farm and it was repaid successfully. She was determined to expand her farm and to have a better source of income for the family. Syd Ann took  a new loan recently to purchase a new variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer in order increase the crop yield on her rice farm. She hopes for an increase in income that would augment the entire family's general living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer to increase the crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Raysa Evelis

texts.es:
Raysa es una joven de 21 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como obrera de campo en su ciudad natal, Tinguiña. Es una persona muy entusiasta, alegre y amable con todos, en sus tiempos libres le gusta ir a nadar y escuchar música porque cree que la música es una de las mejores manera de expresar los sentimientos de las personas. 
Raysa está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor para amoblar su casa, de esta manera toda su familia podrá gozar de momentos agradables unidos. Con esto Raysa seguirá luchando para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Raysa, 21, is a young woman with a strong will to get ahead. She is a blue-collar worker and works in his hometown, Tinguiña. She is an enthusiastic, joyful and kind person. She likes to swim and listen to music during her free time and thinks that music is one of the best ways for people to express what they are feeling.

Raysa appreciates the support that Kiva lenders have given her. She will be able to buy a TV set and her family will enjoy good moments together. This will help Raysa to continue fighting to make headway and offer her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a TV set.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa, 55 years old, is married and has five children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 20 years, Ma. Luisa has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

Ma. Luisa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Ma. Luisa has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening businesses. Fatima is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlinda is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Arlinda has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ceria

texts.en:
Ceria  is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ceria  is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ceria  has been farming vegetables for 25 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Sofia has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Sofia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nicanora works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling accessories in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nicanora is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business making accessories.

Nicanora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her accessories making.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Carmelina works hard to support her family. She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Carmelina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more clothes to sell to customers.

Carmelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alicia has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Celia Flor

texts.en:
Celia Flor is 41 years old and has four children. Celia Flor is married and has three children who are in school.

Celia Flor is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Celia Flor requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celia Flor has been farming vegetables for twenty years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Celia Flor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia lives in Suai, and she is married and has one child. She is applying for a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes and she also sells in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to add with her working capital to buy more clothes such as kids t-shirts, kids skirts, children's clothes, and other things to sell. Lidia has been involved in business activities since 2005, when she started with her own working capital of $1000.  

She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them, so she is still happy to do her business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run her business in a bigger store. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and goats.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, t-shirts, skirts, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Graciet

texts.en: Graciet is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she is happy to do her business. Graciet became involved in this business a few years ago. She started with her own working capital of $ 200. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said that with this loan she will improve her management for her business to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita: Es una mujer trabajadora tiene de 37 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada. Su esposo es pastor,  tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace 10 años vive en una vivienda de minifalda de madera y concreto, en la cual habitan 10 personas.  Con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento y mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita financiamiento para construir anexo de madera, que será utilizado como habitación. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas y apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en: María Margarita, 37, lives in Puerto Cabezas, the town where she was born and raised.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  She has lived in a tiny house of wood and cement for 10 years, a house that she shares with nine other people.  She is applying for a loan that she will use build an extra room for the house.  The investment will partly relieve the overcrowding and provide her family with a better quality of life.  For the future, María Margarita hopes to have a proper house of her own.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her house.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
María es conocida por sus bordados de calidad. El conformismo no es una característica de ella, por lo que no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad de ingresos más en su casa. Además de ser costurera lleva 12 años vendiendo cosméticos desde su hogar, pues al ver que tenía muchos clientes en el área de costura, se afilió a la venta de productos estéticos. Ella es madre soltera de dos niños de 13 y 15 años de edad, quienes van al colegio gracias a la ayuda de su madre. 
María es una vendedora exigente, pues le gusta ofrecer productos de calidad y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. De manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar los perfumes de las marcas que sus compradores exigen. Esto le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, que en muchas ocasiones son productos caros, y podrá tener ingresos seguros. En un futuro piensa establecer una tienda completa y aumentar las líneas de mercadería.
texts.en:
María's known for her high-quality embroidery.  Conformity isn't one of her traits, so she never misses any opportunity for more income in her household.  In addition to being a tailor, she has 12 years of experience selling cosmetics from home.  When she saw she had a lot of customers for her sewing, she got involved in selling beauty products.

She's the single mother of two children, ages 13 and 15, who attend school thanks to the help of her mother.

María's a demanding vendor because she likes to offer quality products and fill her customers' orders.  That's why she's requesting a loan to buy the brands of perfume that her buyers demand.  This will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs, which often are expensive products, and she'll be able to have a dependable income.

She wants to start a complete store and increase her lines of merchandise in the future.

loans.use: to buy perfume

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 43-year-old married woman  from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She sells fish, crab and sea shells to the nearby town to earn a living. 

Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy a pump boat and fishing net. These are tools that could help Jenelyn improve her catch and create greater income to enable her to provide her family with basic necessities. Jenelyn hopes to expand her business and make it a success for a sustainable livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a pump boat and fishing net

loans.name: Emylene

texts.en:
Emylene, 26 years old, is from Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. Emylene has been engaged in raising hogs for five years. She works hard taking care of her hogs to earn a living. 

Emylene feels like it is now time to venture into another business. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as biscuits, canned sardines, cooking oil, chips, soft drinks, fruit-flavored juice powder, coffee and sugar to start a sari-sari (variety) store. She dreams of having a stable income until such time when she needs to send her child to high school and college. In the future, Emylene plans to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as biscuits, canned sardines, cooking oil, chips, soft drinks, fruit-flavored juice powder, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to venture in the hog raising business after she learned that she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Rosalina is a member in good standing.  She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

 Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins, and to buy more piglets to raise and sell. In the future, she wants to own a meat shop in the nearby town to generate more income to continuously provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed, animal vitamins, and more piglets.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su madre y hermana, en casa propia. Aproximadamente desde hace 10 años en la zona; él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; que está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Carlos se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales en el distrito de Cayalti, desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de mercaderia (productos medicinales) ya que depende de mucha demanda y pedidos. Y también para la compra de andamios para ampliar y mejorar el negocio. Lo cual le permitira mayor y mejor atención al publico, permitiendole captar un número mayor de clientes, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his mother and sister in their own home. He has lived in this area for about 10 years and has good personal and work references from his neighbours. He lives in a community that works in business, agriculture and cattle. His community is located in the district of Cayaltí, a province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Carlos has sold natural medicinal products int the district of Cayaltí for over five years. This loan will be used to buy merchandise (medicinal products) as there is a lot of demand for it as well as existing orders. He will also purchase scaffolding to expand and improve his business. This will allow him to offer a bigger and better service to the public and gain more customers, a higher income, larger profits and, in the end, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (medicinal products) and scaffolding to expand and improve his business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been farming sugarcane for 34 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en: Mrs. Javzandulam, 54 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as cook at a restaurant since 2013. Her husband transports goods between districts using his heavy truck. Their two children study at university. This year her younger son began studying finance at university, but due to lack of cash, she didn't pay his tuition fees. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay tuition fees for her younger son. As a result, her younger son can concentrate on his study without worrying about tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Danny Francisco

texts.es:
Danny Francisco tiene 27 años, es soltero, muy conocido en el medio por prestar el servicio en elaboración y venta de yogurt, tortas, etc. Vive en casa familiar con tia y hermano, no tiene carga familiar, hermano trabaja como mototaxista. Danny Francisco es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Danny Francisco se dedica a la elaboración y venta yogurt, tortas, bocaditos y empanadas. Desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de insumos y horno más grande, lo que le permitirá hacer una mayor cantidad de pedidos y a su vez también podrá captar a un número mayor de clientes; lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Danny Francisco is 27 years old, single, and very well known in the area for his home-made yogurt, sandwiches, etc. He lives in his family's home with his aunt and his brother. He has no family obligation; his brother works as a motorcycle-taxi driver.

Danny Francisco is a person with good work and personal references. He lives in a community of kind and respectful people who are dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and cattle-raising. The community is located in Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

Danny Francisco has made and sold yogurt, sandwiches, snacks, and meat pies for approximately 10 years. He needs this loan to invest in the purchase of inputs and a much larger oven, one that will allow him to fill a larger quantity of orders and, at the same time, to capture more customers. This will generate greater income, better earnings, and, finally, an improved quality of life.

loans.use: purchase inputs and a larger oven for his food preparation enterprise.

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: Mapayo est commerçante, membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Makimbilio», âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1 est gosse. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 4 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mapayo is a trader and member of the "Makimbilio" business collective. She is 34 years old, married and mother to six children, five of whom are at school and the sixth a young child. The customer sells groceries and lays out her goods on a stall in a shopping centre. She began her business with funds from her husband and has been carrying it out for nine years now. This new loan will be used to buy four sacks of beans. She would like thereby to increase her capital as well as to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of beans.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 43 years old, is married and has eight children, four of them in school. Janet is in the agricultural business, farming root crops in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janet has been farming for 23 years and has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Karundo Bagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Patrick, a member of Karundo Bagambakamu Group where each member guarantees the other, is a retailer and at the same time a farmer. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes. Besides that, he has hopes of building a permanent house. 

Patrick needs a loan as working capital to buy stock like soap, cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock like soap, cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 48 años de edad, casada, con 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 10 años estableció una pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, gaseosas, embutidos, entre otros productos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking woman who comes from Puerto Cabezas. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 adult children. She started a general store 10 years ago with the aim of having her own source of income.

Angela is applying for a loan to buy merchandise such as staple grains, Chiveria dairy products, detergent, soft drinks, cold meats and other products. Her dream is for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as staple grains, Chiveria dairy products, detergent, soft drinks, cold meats and other products.

loans.name: Kulsyina

texts.ru: Кулсыйна, 53 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. Кулсыйна в поисках доходов для своей семьи в 2000 году начала заниматься разведением скота. Благодаря непосильному труду и терпеливому характеру Кулсыйны на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство - 2 дойные коровы и 2 лошади. Кулсыйна реализует молочную продукцию местным жителям. Домашнее вкусное молоко пользуется большим спросом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Сегодня ее доходов катастрофически не хватает на жизнь, хотя дети присылают ей деньги. А прибыль от реализации молока и молочной продукции позволит Кулсыйне развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kulsyina is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of two. In the search of a source of income for her family, in 2000 she started raising livestock. Thanks to Kulsyina’s extremely hard work and patience, presently she has a good farm, with two dairy cows and two horses. She sells dairy products locally. Delicious farm milk is in great demand, which is why Kulsyina has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy dairy cows. At present her income falls critically short of what she needs to support herself, even  though her children send her money. The revenue from selling milk and dairy products will allow Kulsyina to develop her business further and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk sales and produce offspring.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is requesting a loan of USD 1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including slippers, candles, shampoo, eggs, coffee, sugar, noodles, sardines, soy sauce, toothpaste, cooking oils and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $350. 

There are six members in the family, including her four children and her husband. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to have a good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, candles, shampoo, eggs, coffee, sugar,  noodles, etc.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда трудолюбивая женщина, работающая простым рабочим в агропромышленном комплексе. Ей 45 лет. Дополнительно она занимается выращиванием пшеницы и кукурузника на 0,80 га арендованной земле. Ее муж трудовой мигрант России, а дети еще учатся. Их бюджет семьи скудный. В связи с этим Махсуда решила начать собственный прибыльный бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Она планирует заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатых скотин. Она намерена держать скот при дворе своего дома, где имеется сарай для скотов. Чтобы начать бизнес, Махсуда просит кредит. Она за счет кредита собирается приобрести пару крупнорогатых скотин. Корм для скотов у нее имеется. Она просит Вас помочь ей закупить скот и заранее благодарит Вас за Вашу отзывчивость и понимание.
texts.en: Makhsuda is a hardworking woman who works in the agricultural industry. She is 45 years old. She rents a 0.8 hectare plot of land where she grows wheat and corn. Her husband works in Russia and her children are still in school. Their family budget is tight. This is why Makhsuda decided to start her own profitable business and improve her family's financial situation. She is planning to buy and sell cattle. She will keep the cattle in the yard, where she has a cowshed. Makhsuda is asking for a loan to start the business and will use it to buy a pair of cattle. She already has feed for the cattle. She asks you to help her buy cattle and thanks you in advance for your compassion and understanding.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a new business

loans.name: Hedwig

texts.en:
Hedwig is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. He is married and has a 3-year-old child. Hedwig engages in fishing. He catches and sells fresh fish, crabs and clams to the people in the community. He has been into fishing for almost 10 years now.  Hedwig is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and a boat pump engine. 

With the additional capital, Hedwig could now improve his daily catch, and possibly augment higher earnings. Hedwig hopes that he can continue making better profits from his fishing business to support the needs of his growing child.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a boat pump engine.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Born in New Jersey but raised in Puerto Rico, Melissa returned to the US in 2001. She has been writing and performing music for 20 years. “Music is my passion, and with hard work and determination, I’ve begun to see the fruits of my labor, having my songs played on television, film, and more,” she says.

If you take a look at her website (http://www.melissaotero.com/), you can get a sense of Melissa’s dedication to music. She has been able to tap into the American and Latin market, getting her music featured on LifetimeTV, in video games, and Telemundo.

As Melissa looks to get her music out, she needs a loan for a venue rental and marketing for an upcoming show in Appleton, WI. Melissa’s long-term goals are to “tour nationally with better funding and be able to live exclusively off my music.”

loans.use: to pay for venue rental for upcoming show and marketing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, 46 years old, is married and has five children, two of them in school. Elvira works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

Elvira has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Elvira has previously borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 49 years old, married, and has nine children.  Two of her children are in school. Nina is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nina has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bufole's Group

texts.fr: Kabingwa est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Pathmos, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 26 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des chevres dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter 4 chèvres. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler quelque clientes portent des bébés.
texts.en: Kabingwa is a trader and member of the Pathmos community bank. She is a 26-year old customer of IMF Hekima, who is married to a trader and mother to  four children, three of whom are at school and the fourth a young child. She began her business with funds from her husband and has been selling goats in one of the town's smaller markets for the past three years. She is going to buy four goats and would like to get more loans, as well as to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks. It should be noted that several customers are carrying their babies in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four goats.

loans.name: Mkono Mkononi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Efrasie est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise Mkono Mkononi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un maçon, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 12 enfants dont 7 scolarisés et 5 sont encore petits. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés à son domicile depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter des biscuits, piles, savon Omo, huiles, sucre, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The customer, Efrasie, is a trader and president of the Mkono Mkononi Banc Villageois. She is a 46-year old customer of IMF Hekima, who is married to a mason and mother to 12 children, seven of whom are at school and five still very young. She began her business with funds from her husband and has been selling a variety of manufactured products from her home for the past six years. She is going to buy biscuits, batteries, Omo soap powder, oils, sugar, etc. She would like to increase her loans, as well as to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, Omo soap powder, oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 40-year-old  married woman and a mother of six children (12-22 years old) from Dulag, Leyte. She is a fish vendor, selling fresh  fish to the people in her community. 

Juliet  is asking for a loan to buy foam (for fish storage) and a variety of fresh fish to resell. This will help Juliet to create higher earnings that could help provide for her family's needs. In the future, Juliet would like to expand her fish vending business to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy foam (for fish storage) and a variety of fresh fish

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
María Maritza tiene 47 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, su esposo se dedica a la agriculltura y a la perforación de pozos para extarer agua. Tiene casa propia(con servicios básicos luz y agua). María Maritza vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires. Natural de la zona. La comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado y al comercio de platano. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla María Maritza es la crianza de animales menores además tiene una pequeña chacra producto de la herencia de sus padres. Tiene sus cabras las cuales las pastea en el cerro y en la tarde las encierra en su corral; su esposo se dedica a perforar pozos de manera artesal y a la agricultura. El destino del crédito es para realizar los acabados de su pozo, es decir el revestimiento de las paredes del mismo, ayudandole a obtener otros ingresos adicionales por la venta de agua, ya que en la comunidad son pocas las personas que cuentan con el servicio de Agua.
texts.en:
María Maritza, 47, lives with her companion.  Her husband earns a living in agriculture and drilling wells manually to extract water.  She has her own home and basic electric and water services.  She lives in the Buenos Aires district and is a native of the area.  It's a small community located in the province of Morropón in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents work raising livestock and selling bananas.  

María Maritza's job is raising small animals.  She also has a small farm, an inheritance from her parents.  She has goats that graze in the hills; in the afternoon she encloses them in the corral.

The loan is to make the finishing touches on her well: that is, the lining on the walls.  This will help her earn additional income by selling water, because few people in the community have water service.

loans.use: to finish the walls of her well

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila, 55 years old, is married and has six children, two of them in school. For the past 30 years, Cerila has been in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cerila has previously borrowed nine times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cerila would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Libett Aurora

texts.es:
Estando detrás de un escritorio, contestando llamadas y programando la agenda de un abogado, despertó en Libett el interés en ingresar en el mundo de las leyes, fue entonces cuando nació su iniciativa de estudiar derecho. Esta joven de 37 años, está casada y es egresada de la carrera de Derecho, una licenciatura que considera le ayudará a poner en práctica los principios jurídicos de las personas. Ahora está trabajando como gestora legal, sintiéndose realizada profesionalmente en lo que ha estudiado. Además vende perfumes y ropa como otra forma de ingresos. 
Para Libett hay un peldaño muy importante que debe escalar y es que a pesar de haber finalizado su carrera no ha podido sacar su título como abogada. Por esta razón es que solicita un crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y así poder convertirse en una licenciada en Derecho y notario como manda la ley. Entre sus planes está convertirse en una fiscal y así poder trabajar más profundamente para el bien y el desarrollo de la sociedad. Por lo pronto quiere establecer su propia oficina donde pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Being behind a desk, answering phone calls and scheduling the agenda of a lawyer awoke in Libett the interest to enter into the legal world, which was when her desire to study Law was born. 

This young woman of 37 is married and has completed a course in Law, a degree which she believes will help her to put legal principles for people into practice. Now Libett is working as a legal advisor and having studied for this she feels professionally fulfilled. She also sells perfume and clothes to obtain another form of income. 

For Libett there is very important step that she has to take. Having completed her course she has not been able to obtain her qualification as a lawyer. For this reason she is applying for a loan to pay for the degree so that she can become a graduate of Law before a notary, as dictated by the law. Libett has plans to become a district attorney so that she can work more in depth for the good and development of society. At the moment she would like to set up her own office so she can offer her clients a better service.

loans.use: to pay for a degree

loans.name: Moise Group

texts.fr: Kanyere est commerçante, membre  d’un collectif  d’affaires «Moise», âgée de 47 ans, mariée à un agent de la brasserie, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient. La cliente est propriétaire d’un restaurant au marché central de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des poissons frais, viande, riz, farine, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital,  scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kanyere, age 47, is a merchant and member of the Moise business group. She is married to a brewery agent, and they have 5 children who all go to school. 

Kanyere owns a restaurant in the city’s central market. She launched her business 30 years ago with capital received from her husband.   
She plans to stock up on fresh fish, meat, rice, flour, etc.  

Her goals are to bolster her capital and to ensure that her children are fed, clothed, and educated. 

Kanyere wishes to thank Hekima for helping businesswomen who cannot use the traditional banking system in their efforts to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, meat, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a married woman with five children aged 7-13. Her husband is a fish vendor who works hard to earn a living for the family. Anita just started to operate a sari-sari (variety) store to help her husband support their family. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish and merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, soy sauce, milk, coffee, sugar and chips. Anita is optimistic of what a loan can do, especially for her inventory. Once her business thrives, Anita's profit will be used for school fees, healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, Anita plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, soy sauce, milk, coffee, sugar and chips

loans.name: Israël Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbunzu est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise Israël, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 43 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers aliments prêts à consommer au rond point du centre ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter des pommes de terre, grillades etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The customer, Mbunzu, is a trader and member of the Israël Banc Villageois. She is a 43-year old customer of IMF Hekima, who is married and mother to eight children, all at school. She began her business with funds from her husband and has for the past six years been selling a variety of ready-made food at the roundabout in the center of town. She is going to buy potatoes, grilled foods etc. She would like to increase her loans, as well as to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, grilled foods, etc.

loans.name: Ep3 Kibumba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lubungo est une femme d’affaires, membre d’une association de crédits «EP3 Kibumba»,âgée de 57 ans, mariée à un pasteur et mère de 10 enfants dont 3 étudient et 7 sont grands. Elle est vendeuse divers matériels de construction dans le  centre commercial de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter divers matériels de construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux  petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Lubungo, is a businesswoman and member of the "EP3 Kibumba" loan association. She is 57 years old and married to a pastor; she is also mother to 10 children, three of whom are at school and the remaining seven adults. She sells a variety of building materials in the town's shopping center, and she is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy various building materials (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.) She would thereby like to be able to build a house, as well as to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to buy various building materials (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 46 years old, is married and has five children, four of them in school. For the past 15 years, Evelyn has earned a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sorpene

texts.en:
Sorpene is 49 years old and married with six children.

Sorpene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Sorpene has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing and pig fattening.

Sorpene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Soraya Raquel

texts.es: Soraya: Es una mujer trabajadora, sociable,  originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 32 años de edad, madre soltera. Con el propósito de ser una mujer profesional y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña hija, solicita financiamiento para cubrir gastos de monografía.  Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda, actualmente habita en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Soraya is a hardworking, sociable woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 32 years old and a single mother.

With the aim of being a professional woman and of providing a better quality of life for her little daughter, she is asking for funding to cover the expenses of her dissertation. Her dream is to build her own house. At the moment she is living with her parents.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of her dissertation

loans.name: Mohy

texts.ru: Мохи добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1961 году. Мохи замужем и имеет 3 совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж пенсионер. Мохи в ИМОН обратилась в первые, так как она имеет план организовать свой бизнес купле продажей ювелирных изделий. Она давно мечтала владеть собственным бизнесом и наконец, сейчас она имеет возможность реализовать свою мечту в реальность. Мохи участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она очень умная женщина и показала себя как целеустремленная женщина на тренинге. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки ювелирные изделия, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mohy is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1961, is married, and has three adult children. Her husband is retired. This is Mohy's first time applying for a loan with IMON and she has a plan to start a business buying and selling jewelry. She has dreamed of starting her own business for a long time and now has the opportunity to make her dream a reality. Mohy participated in the Achieve Success program organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate. She is a very smart woman and proved herself to be motivated during training. She applied for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy jewelry in order to start her new business. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in order to start a new business

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 46 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school.

Juditha is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Juditha has been farming rice and vegetables for 22 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bold-Erdene

texts.en:
Bold-Erdene is 38 years old and married. He lives with his wife and parents in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to the local people since 2004. His parents have retired from work and receive a state pension. 

With his previous loan, Bold-Erdene successfully opened a grocery store where his mother works as seller. He is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 MNT to buy a natural gas vehicle in order to replace his current car for his taxi service. His current car is so badly damaged that it is no longer capable of transporting clients safely to their destination. The advantage of a natural gas car is that it emits less smoke compared to other engines.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Altangoo

texts.en:
Mrs. Altangoo, 24 years old, lives with her mother and sister in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. This summer after her graduation from university, she began to work as a nurse at a hospital. Her mother is a cook and works at a small cafe. Her sister is a cashier at a supermarket. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car for transportation. The places where she, her mother, and her sister work are far away from their home, so they want a car. The main advantage of an electric car is that it does not emit harmful pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for transportation

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
41-year-old Merlita is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has six children. The oldest child is  21, while the youngest is ten. 

Merlita engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. She has been into fishing for many years now.

Merlita is asking for a loan to buy a weighing scale, foam (fish storage), and additional stocks of fresh fish. This is very essential in augmenting her source of income. With this loan, Merlita can afford to buy nutritious food and can set aside some of the savings for college education for her children.

Merlita hopes that, with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, foam (fish storage), and additional stocks of fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes, a toilet and to finish a septic tank

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 39 years old and has five children. She operates her poultry and livestock business in her municipality. 

Liza requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase geese, chickens, and poultry materials. In the future, she hopes to expand her livestock and poultry business to nearby municipalities and see her children have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase geese, chickens, and poultry materials

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 32 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening. 

Marites requested her third loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopess to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.es: Mary Jean: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera, de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: clavo, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman who comes from Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother to two school aged children. 

Mary Jean is applying for a loan to buy building materials such as nails and wood and cover the cost of labour, with the aim of improving her home. Her dream is to extend her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as nails and wood and cover the cost of labour

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar has a buy-and-sell banana business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She mastered the business during the early years of her marriage. The business has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase more bananas for her buy-and-sell business. She wants to expand her business and she would be more than happy to respond to the needs and demands of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children are in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables for 25 years, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the operation.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Consolacion has been farming rice for 35 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru:
Мушараф жительница города Худжанд. Худжанд расположен на северной части Таджикистана. Этот город богат своими  древними традициями высокой культурой. Мушараф из тех жителей, которая сохранила один из многих национальный символ народа. Она шьет "курпа" и "курпача" 
   "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Машараф около 5 лет занимается изготовлением "курпа" и "курпача". На сегодняшний день для нее основной деятельностью.  Мушараф просит кредит, чтобы купить больше тканей и швейных принадлежностей для продолжения маленького бизнеса.
texts.en: Musharaf lives in the city of Khujand, located in the northern part of Tajikistan. The city is rich with the ancient traditions of high culture. Musharaf is one of the residents who maintains many of the national symbols of the people by sewing kurpa and kurpacha, which are types of cotton mattresses. Kurpa are a standard square size and used as blankets, while kurpacha are long mattresses used as sofas. Musharaf has been sewing both of these for over five years and it is currently her main activity. She is asking for a loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtuya, 26 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling mobile phones to local people since 2013. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their son attends kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy various kinds of mobile phones in order to meet customer needs. This will help her business prosper and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of mobile phones in order to meet the needs of customers

loans.name: Martha Vanessa

texts.es: Martha: Es una señora alegre, amable, tiene 30 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería, en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, jabón de lavar ropa, de baño, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Martha, 30, is a happy and friendly woman.  She's a native of Puerto Cabezas and has four children.  A year ago, to have her own income, she started her own small store in the hallway of her house, which is on wooden stilts.

She's requesting her first loan to buy basic grains, snacks, detergent, laundry soap, bath soap, and other merchandise.

Martha's dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, detergent, soap, and other merchandise

loans.name: Santos Evelio

texts.es:
Santos Evelio de 39 años de edad, de profesión Ingeniero Agrónomo, Soltero, dos hijos  menores de edad, en la colonia donde habita la gente es progresiva la mayor actividad es la Agricultura y Ganadería, Santos Evelio a diario con mucho amor se dirige a su trabajo desempeñando el cargo de Sub-Director de Inatec, anteriormente trabajó en una micro financiera, tiene muchos conocimientos profesionalmente, desde pequeño le ha gustado el trabajo procede de familia humilde y muy trabajadora que se dedican a la Ganadería y al cultivo de Tubérculos, también  Don Santos tiene ingresos por la venta de Tubérculos que produce en la parcela de un hermano, este ingreso lo ha venido invirtiendo en el mismo negocio y en su hogar para disfrutar de una buena alimentación con su familia. 
La vivienda de don Santos Evelio está muy bonita,  pero claro nunca faltan los retoques o alguna que otra mejora por hacer.  El crédito anterior fue emitido por afodenic lo invirtió en compra de un solar para posteriormente construir una vivienda para uno de sus hijos cuando crezcan o establecer un negocio y el crédito antes de afodenic que le emitió Kiva con este pudo repellar las paredes y poner puerta que tanto necesitaba en su hogar ahora su familia goza de seguridad y comodidad en la vivienda.  

Este crédito lo necesita para realizar zanjeo en la calle hasta la casa donde habita para revisar la tubería que presenta problemas hay fuga de agua y no permite que llegue hasta al casa, necesita cambiar esta tubería que está dañada con esta inversión su familia gozara del vital liquido sin tener que molestar al vecino como lo estamos haciendo actualmente. Continuar con las mejoras en la vivienda donde habito para verla terminada y acondicionada en su totalidad y luego empezare la construcción de la vivienda en el solar ya que tengo dos hijos y pretendo dejarlos a cada uno en su hogar si Dios me lo permite.
texts.en:
Santos Evelio is a 39 years old agronomist who is single and has two young children. The people from the town where he lives are progressive and mainly work in agriculture or with cattle. Santos Evelio goes to work every day with a lot of love. He currently works as the Assistant Director of Inatec. Previously he worked for a micro finance company. He has a lot of professional knowledge and ever since he was little he has liked working. 

Santos comes from a humble and very hardworking family who work with cattle and grow tubers. Santos also gains an income by selling the tubers that he produces on a lot of land that belongs to his brother. This income will be put back into his business and will be used at home to feed his family well. 

Santos Evelio's home is very beautiful, but of course there are always improvements to be made. His last loan with Afodenic was used to buy a plot of land where he can build a home for one of his children when they grow up, or to set up a business. The loan before that which was issued through Kiva was used to whitewash walls and add a door which the house really needed. Now his family can enjoy safety and comfort in their home. 

Santos needs this loan to build a ditch on the street up to his house so he can take a look at the pipes which are currently causing problems. The pipes are leaking water and the water is not getting to his house so he needs to replace the damaged pipes. With this investment his family enjoy the vital liquid without having to disturb their neighbour, which is what they are currently doing. 

Santos will continue making home improvements so he can see his house finished and completely set up. After that he will start building a home on his plot of land as he already has two children and he wants to leave them each with a home, God willing.

loans.use: to buy pipes and pay for the cost of labour to repair pipes which are leaking water

loans.name: Jérémie Group

texts.fr: Nyabulohwe est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Jérémie, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un évangéliste, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 6 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son salaire. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements depuis 20 ans. Elle va acheter de vestes, pagnes, pantalons, chemises, chemisettes, jupes, sous vêtements, singlin, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Nyabulohwe, age 46, is a merchant and the president of the Jérémie community bank. She is a client of the Hekima MFI. She is married to an evangelist, and they have 6 children who all go to school. 

Nyabulohwe has been selling various clothing for 20 years. She initially launched her business using her earnings as capital.   
She plans to buy vests, pagnes, pants, shirts, slips, skirts, undergarments, singlin, etc.   

Her goals are to strengthen her credit and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. 

Nyabulohwe wishes to thank Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy vests, pagnes, pants, shirts, slips, skirts, undergarments, singlin, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 42-year-old fish vendor from Dulag, Leyte. She has two children. 

Thelma has been selling fish for 20 years now. In addition to selling fish, she also operates a sari-sari store business. This allows her to earn PHP 5,000 per month. 

Thelma is asking for a loan to buy and sell more fish and merchandise, such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, spices, soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Any income derived from this business will be used for tuition fees, healthy meals, and reinvestment in the same businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell more fish and merchandise, such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, spices, soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes and pay for costs and labour to install a drinking water service

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of pig feed to pay for her children's tuition fee.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 60-year-old married woman from Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines, who has four adult children who are all married. She has recently signed up her membership in PMPC after she learned about the financial assistance it gives. 

Elena owns and manages a small restaurant in front of their house, which is on a national road; many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their town, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from PMPC.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice toppings, fish, and spices to cook more dishes

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a pensioner and is supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of 40,000 PHP. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Rhoda has been given priority as a pensioner member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs for her retail business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house for her whole family

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and is married. They have 3 children, all of who are in school.  

Rosemarie is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosemarie has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

Rosemarie has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and she has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to help sustain her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 47 years old. She is married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. Neria joined the microfinance group of PMPC after she learned that she can receive financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Neria decided to raise pigs in their backyard to generate income while being a housewife. She wanted to help her husband in supporting their family. Recently, she took out a loan to buy animal feed and vitamins for proper and rapid growth of her pigs. This will give her pig raising income a big boost. 

Neria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively, aside from her plan to concrete the pig pen, so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and married with two children.

Susana earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Susana has been farming vegetables for twenty-five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Florida works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Florida is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of firewood to sell through her firewood retailing business.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is managing her eatery business in Sindangan, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. 

Her business has been doing well and supports the needs of her family. Trinidad has local customers and also accepts catering jobs for additional income. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase meat and spices to make and sell more servings of her specialty dishes. This will help her continue to not only provide for her family but also help support her grandchildren's education. 

Trinidad wants to expand her business and would be even happier if she could open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina settled in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has been a plain housekeeper for a long time, since she got married. Her husband earns an income from transportation services to make a living. 

As the years have gone by and her family needs more financially, she decided to engage in a retail business in their village to earn more income for the family. She joined Gata Daku MPC and has taken out a new loan to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store in order to increase her sales. She hopes to expand and improve her business to support the needs of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Atirgul

texts.ru: Атиргул 33 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Атиргул - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 2 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Благодаря упорному труду Атиргул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть товар в обороте на 300,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения ассортимента товара в магазине, Атиргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en:
Atirgul is 33 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in grocery sales for two years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a working capital of 300,000 KGS with a monthly profit of about 20,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further expanding the assortment of inventory in her shop, Atirgul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food products to broaden inventory in her grocery store and be more competitive

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis actualmente está cursando la carrera Ingeniería Comercial, con miras a un futuro mejor  y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Es un joven muy emprendedor y sacrificado, que ayuda a su familia, y quiere poder seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que está estudiando.
Sabe que la única forma de crecer es por medio del sacrificio, y pide este préstamo para poder cubrir en algo las cuotas de su carrera y así seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is currently pursuing a degree in Commercial Engineering, with a view to a better future,  improving his quality of life and that of his family. 

He is a very enterprising young man who makes sacrifices in order to help his family, and wants to continue helping, which is why he is studying. 

He knows that the only way to grow is through sacrifice and is asking for this loan to cover some of his university fees and thus continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Reminda

texts.en:
Reminda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother.

Reminda requested a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she wants to add heads of pigs for commercial sale. She hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for growing piglets

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a 23 years old and married. She is from Dulag, Leyte. Juvy operates a thriving sari-sari (variety) store, which she has been doing for five years. 

Juvy requested a loan, which she will use to buy spices, condiments, canned goods, cooking oil, soy sauce, chips, biscuits, and soft drinks. She would like to improve her inventory to attract more customers and increase business profitability. Any income generated from this business will be used for food, electricity bills, and reinvestment in her business. In the future, Juvy plans to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase spices, condiments, canned goods, cooking oil, soy sauce, chips, biscuits, and soft drinks

loans.name: Binh's Group

texts.en:
Binh is 60 years old and married. She lives with her husband, her son, daughter-in-law, and grandchildren in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family has a garden of fruit trees and a small farm for sow raising. Due to the number of members in the family, the family’s income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. 

Binh's grandchildren are in school, so their expenses are increasing. She wants to invest in breeding and requested a loan from M7-MFI to do so. She expects this loan will help her buy more breeding of sow and food for the sow. She hopes that in the coming year her family’s income is higher than this year; her children have comfortable lives; and her grandchildren have good conditions for learning.

loans.use: to invest in breeding

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Aurelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Aurelia has borrowed and successfully repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 5 years, but she also earns income from pig fattening and restaurants.

Aurelia aspires to build and expand her businesss so she can provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Thành works in agriculture farming food.

Thành is 38 years old and he is married with 2 children.

Thành  lives with 2 dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thành faces in his life is not having hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thành Nguyễn hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ike

texts.en:
Ike is 44 years old and a resident of Dulag, Leyte. He sells food supplements such as vitamins and minerals that are essential for health. He has been operating this business for many years.

Ike requested a loan, which he will use to buy more supplies of food supplements such as vitamin C and medicines. He can now cater to the needs of his customers as well as improve his earnings. He provides a nutritious diet which is essential in his day-to-day livelihood activities. In the future, Ike hopes that with an additional capital he can continue making a better profit from his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplements such as  vitamin C and medicines
